loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of ground nuts, beans and sunflower seeds for resale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 48 years old and married with six children. He does quarrying so as to earn a living. He has employed five people in his business. He has sustained his business for twenty years because of his hard work and determination. He hopes that through Faulu Kenya, he will grow his business. He has requested 15,000 Kes to buy tools for quarrying.

loans.use: To buy tools for quarrying

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 53-year-old widow with five children. Two of the children are married. After her husband passed away, Amneh started to make Cotton Sweet and sell in their neighborhood to be able to raise the rest of her children. Therefore, she bought a candy machine that can help her make this kind of sweet. Now after gaining the people's trust in her product and having regular customers, Amneh felt the urge to have a new machine to improve the quality of her candy and maybe make other kinds of candy. That’s why she applied for this loan. In the future, Amneh wants to be able to open her own candy shop to sell many kinds of candy, not only Cotton Candy.

Since Amneh is a conservative person, she preferred that her son Osama appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new machine to make cotton candy

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 25 years old and she has 2 children who are ages 5 and 3 years old. She owns a store in which she sells different lotions and Vaseline, water, radio cells, candles and foodstuffs such as rice, sorghum, sugar, etc.She works together with her husband; they have done this business for 3 years, and this business has enabled them to meet the needs of their home. Solange needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, rice and sorghum, and she plans to buy more Vaseline as well. She plans to buy a piece of land with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy food such as rice, sugar, sorghum, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Life couldn't be called life at all when one doesn't live it to the fullest. Lilibeth, 46, realizes this truth and makes sure she and her family live their lives at the maximum. She finished only the first year in high school. At present, she works hard in business to make up for what she lacks in education. Her husband Policarpio, a vendor, works hard too. They have two children, one of whom is already working, while the younger one studies in college.  Together, they live in Parola Area, Binondo, Manila.

Lilibeth manages her own sari-sari (variety) store. Here, she sells daily household essentials and sells rice in retail. Lilibeth also raises hogs for a living.  These businesses are all managed and operated near their home. Lilibeth has worked these businesses for 12 years now. With the help of one delivery boy, she makes around Php1, 000 net income daily.

To help her improve her business, Lilibeth applies for a Php26, 000 loan. She will use this money to purchase additional grocery items for her store.  She will also purchase at least four hogs for slaughter and sell. Lilibeth says that this loan will definitely increase her capacity to earn. With the incoming profits, she plans to allocate funds to what is needed in her business: materials needed for hog raising, replenishment of stocks in her store, and more. She also plans to avail herself of government services for health and insurance to keep her and her family in good shape.

Like many micro-entrepreneurs, Lilibeth also has her share of periods of low sales, especially during summertime when people go out of town or prefer to stay home all day. But still she refuses to settle for anything less than a life lived to the fullest. She desires to achieve success in business and see that her children will also become successful. Lilibeth hopes to have a vacation in their home province in Cebu.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her store and to purchase at least four pigs for slaughter and sell their meat.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 49 is married to Jackylyne who runs a grocery stall,and they are blessed with four children aged 25,21,17 and seven years .He owns a commercial vehicle, which operates in Nairobi capital city and earns an income of KES.20,000 per month. He has been in this business for nine years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he intends to use the loan amount to purchase spare parts for his vehicle.

He will use the anticipated profits to purchase another matatu and hopes to have a fleet of matatus in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his matatu (minibus)

loans.name: Philice

texts.en:
Philice is a single woman with two children, a boy and a girl. They all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, clothing and school fees. 

For the past 6 years, she has operated a cereals business, selling in a shop and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also makes natural fruit juice which she earns as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cereals operators in the market. She dreams of building her own shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts and passion fruits, and to pay for transport charges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of ground nuts and passion fruits, and to pay for transport charges.

loans.name: Mahmasobir

texts.ru: Махмасобир проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей находятся на заработках в России. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование, бухгалтер. По специальности работает 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmasobir lives in Khuroson. He is 47 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. Two of his sons are working in Russia. He has a vocational education as a bookkeeper. He has been working in his field for ten years.  Additionally, he works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle at home. He primarily raises cattle for later sale. He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with seven children, four boys and three girls, five of whom graduated from school while two attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

Joyce has operated a poultry business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, especially disease outbreaks in her poultry business. She dreams of establishing another poultry business of egg-layers in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a clutch of chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clutch of chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is from the village of Gata, Jimenez, Mis. Occ. She is 39 years old, married and has no children. To make a living, Rosie runs a business venture in the retail sector selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Rosie has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 1300 PHP a month for these activities. Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rosie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell in her general store.

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Enarcita

texts.en:
Being one of the persevering community partners in CCT*, Enarcita, 49, works hard to make her business flourish. She was not able to reach high school; nevertheless, she makes sure that sad fact will not get in the way of a great future for her and her family. Enarcita is married to Francisco, a tricycle driver. Together they persevere to augment their family needs and reach their dreams. They have two children, one who works already, and one who studies in college. Their family used to live in Negros Oriental; at present, they reside in Tondo, Manila.

Enarcita manages her own sari-sari (variety) store. Here, she sells daily household essentials like cooking oil,  toiletries, and beverages in retail prices. She also sells rice in retail, which works well since rice is the staple food of Filipinos. Her store being located adjacent to their home, Enarcita is able to invest her complete day time in this business and gets to earn Php1, 700 net income daily. She manages her store without the aid of any employees.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. Enarcita intends to use this loan to restock grocery items in her store, such as soft drinks, milk in boxes, instant noodles, and toiletries, among others. She also plans to purchase sacks of rice for her rice retail business. Aside from supporting her business capital, this will also lead the way to increase savings to pay for franchise of her newly bought van.

One struggle Enarcita has at present is the low rate of sales. But she continuously devises strategies to get the community to patronize her store, because her dream of seeing her business grow fuels her perseverance to work hard. It is her desire to purchase their own lot and build their own home.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of rice and grocery items as stock replenishment for her variety store.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is 26 years old, and she has two children who are ages 3 and 9 years old. Her husband is a farmer. This business has enabled her feed her family. Marie Claire owns a store in which she sells a variety of items including foo stuffs such as salt, rice, sugar, and she also sells other items such as soap, candles, radio cells, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop such as soap, candles, sugar, etc.in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy items to put in her shop such as soap, candles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель района Хуросон. Ему 40 лет. Он женат, имеет 8 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. В семье он один работает. У него высшее образование. По профессии он агроном. В этой области проработал 5 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом он открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для покупки муки, сахара, масла, конфет, и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Safarali lives in Khuroson. He is forty years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. He is the only one in the family who is employed.  He has a higher education as an agronomist.  He worked in his field for five years. Now he works in trade. He opened a grocery shop near his house. He is taking out a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, sweets, and sausages.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, sweets, and sausages.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Mis. Occ. She is 48 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Tita runs a business venture in the retail sector selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Tita has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 1800 PHP a month for these activities. Tita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Tita is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Tita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: Antoinette is 34 years old, and she has 6 children who are ages 18-23 years old. She is a widow and she is very hardworking. She sells kerosene which is used as fuel for their lamps in the neighborhood since they don’t have electricity. She has done this business for 6 years and it has enabled her pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a loan to buy bicycle spare parts, buy another motorcycle in addition to the one she has, and purchase kerosene. With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her bicycle, a motorcycle, and kerosene.

loans.name: Wala'a

texts.en:
Wala’a is a 26-year-old single lady. After getting her diploma degree, she worked at a sewing workshop and gained a lot of experience there.  Then she used her mother’s sewing machines at home to start a small sewing business.

Three years ago, Wala’a started her own sewing workshop by herself. At first she used her mother’s machine at home, and through these years, she was able to expand her business and open an independent sewing workshop that includes six sewing machines, one cutting machine, and three employees.

Now, Wala’a has applied for this loan to buy a distributing bus, and in the future she want to open a sewing factory.

loans.use: To buy a bus for distributing clothes to the shops

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 23 years old, and he is married with two children who are ages 1 1/2  and 3 years old. His wife is a farmer. He owns a bar in which they sell different kinds of beer, soft drinks such as sodas, and he also sells a few foodstuffs.This business has enabled him develop his standards of living. J. Damascene is requesting a loan to buy more beer,sodas and some foodstuffs in order to make more profits.His is planning to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase beer, soft drinks and foodstuffs to resell.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 56 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, юрист. По профессии  не работает. Она  занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Берет заказы у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Munavar lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 56 years old, married, and has four children. She has a law degree. She does not work in her profession.  She sews traditional dresses. She takes orders at home. She has been doing this work for more than twenty years. She is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is a young leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she brings up a son and two daughters. The first daughter studies at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven). Gulmira works in a school canteen and earns 5000 soms per month. In order to meet the family needs and contribute additional money to family budget, Gulmira, three years ago with the initial investment of 6000 soms, started to breed livestock animals. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, so for this purpose she applied for the loan. In the future Gulmira plans to start house repairs, and she also wants to save money for purchasing a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 43-year-old farmer from Vani District, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Elena, 12-year-old son and 11-year-old daughter. 

Zaza is retailer of vegetables. He has his own minibus, which is used in his business. He purchases potatoes and onions from wholesalers in Vani once a week and sells them in the local market. This business gives to the family approximately 500 Laris per month. Along with the abovementioned, Zaza’s family has four milk cows and two calves. They produce cheese and sell on average 60 kg of cheese per month at the local market. 

With the requested loan, Zaza will purchase 1.2 tons of potatoes in South Georgia and sell it in his village. Due to the lower price and transportation costs, his cost per kilo of potatoes will be reduced by 0.50 Laris. It will increase his profit. 

Zaza and Elena plan to reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the rest will be used in the family.

loans.use: to purchase 1.2 tons of potatoes

loans.name: Kanyerere Ii Kyamwasha Bakyara Basheija Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Smith believes that without taking risks, one's odds at business success are minimal. Many people who know Smith describe him as a risk-taking and bold entrepreneur. Smith, who is happily married with 6 kids, has thrived in his food sales business, courtesy of his diligence, resilience and determination. His honesty, too, has been invaluable the last 9 years. Smith mostly sells beans, maize and coffee in food markets in Ntungamo. Weekly he says his business generates him shillings of 250,000 as profit. 

Smith says being a farmer has come in really handy especially during times when there is a  food crisis in Uganda. He says demand for his crops increases and as such he is able to make more sales profit. With this loan, Smith says he is going to purchase high-grade manure for his farming and gardens. He anticipates a betterment in his crop yields with the passage of time.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure fertilizer for his farming and gardens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a young man from Palestine. He has a children's clothing store in the city. Othman finished school but couldn't find a job therefore he started a clothes store.

Othman, who is photographed here, wants to have a good season's returns, so he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger amount of summer clothes which will attract more customers.

Othman is a man with a good reputation and known for commitment and good manners.

loans.use: to purchase children's summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 56-year-old school teacher from village Tolebi, West Georgia. He lives with his wife Neli and his mother. Neli is a professional accountant. Along with their main professions, both of them are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, Zurab and Neli own two milk cows and sell approximately 40 kg of traditional Georgian cheese on the local market. Also the family has 1.2 ha plot where maize is grown. Each year they harvest 4 tons of grain, one of which is sold locally. The rest is used in the dairy farm. 

With part of the requested credit, Zurab will till and fertilize the land. Afterwards he will sow maize. Zurab and Neli hope that after fertilizing, they will receive approximately 5 tons of maize and sell two of them. That will increase the income of the family. The other part of the loan will be used for covering some costs related to the wedding of Zurab and Neli’s son. 

In the future Zurab and Neli plan to purchase more milk cows for expansion of the dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for tilling service by a tractor owner, purchase fertilizers, and cover cost of wedding for his son.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 37-year-old, single woman living in the Sinkor Area. Regrettably, she dropped out of school in the third grade. She has four children between the ages of 8 and 16 years old: two live with her, while the other two live with her father. 

Cynthia started settling second-hand clothes in 1992. For example, she sells slippers and underwear (for both ladies and gentlemen) to her customers. 

Cynthia is now requesting a loan to purchase additional slippers and underwear. In the future, she hopes to live to see her children receive a better education than she did.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing items (e.g., slippers and underwear)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various items for his store.

loans.name: Malohatkhon

texts.en:
Malohatkhon is a hardworking, single girl living in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. For 3 years, she has operated her own sewing business. Specifically, Malohatkhon sews women’s dresses. Her mother helps with the business by selling the dresses made by Malohatkhon in the market of “Korvon.” Malohatkhon is seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS ($1,125) to purchase a sewing machine and additional fabrics in order to expand her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, and mainly in Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and additional fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hardware items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bale of mitumba(used clothes) for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, aged 50, is married with four children.  For 4 years, he has been running a business of selling a variety of curios.  His spouse Pauline, brings in additional income through farming.


He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to add more curio stock for sale.

He will use the expected profits to expand his business and hopes to export curios to other countries.

loans.use: To buy more curio stock for sale

loans.name: Monjuma

texts.en:
Monjuma is 35 years old and lives in Sinkor.  She is married with 4 children between the ages of 8 and 15 years.  Her husband is a health worker. 
Monjuma started manufacturing soap four years ago.   Her biggest challenge is the heat which causes a lot of problems.  Monjuma is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and caustic soda to manufacture more soap. She hopes to be a big business woman and earn more money in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oil and caustic soda to manufacture more soap

loans.name: Babamurod

texts.en:
Babamurod is a 61-year-old cattleman who is married with six children. Babamurod has been in this business for 4 years. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the cattle-shed and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. He sells his cattle in the market of Yavan, Sultonobod and in the market of Rudaki region. Now, Babamulod would like to expand his business and purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he has applied for 5000 Somoni and with your help he hopes to reach his goal. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Chebii is 48 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She has been selling tealeaves in Mobon trading centre in Kapsabet town for 15 years, getting a monthly income of KES. 13,100.

Jane has borrowed KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD.  This is her fourth loan and she has serviced all her previous loans successfully.  She hopes to use this amount to purchase tea leaves bags for resale, and wishes to use the anticipated amount to improve her tea plantation.

Her dream is to own a tea factory in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Purchase tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a drum of pigs' feet.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 46, lives in Sinkor.  She is married to a school teacher, and the couple have two children aged 17 and 21.  One lives with her at home, while the other one is in college.

Mary has been selling wood and charcoal for the past eight years, although she sells a smaller amount during the rainy season.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood and charcoal for her business. She plans to improve her children’s livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new sewing and carpentry machines.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед житель района Кубадиян. Ему 29 лет. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. У него средне - специальное образование, строитель. Он уже 4 года как занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством и садоводством. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи. А также у него имеется сад, где он сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян арбуза.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Qubadiyon area. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He has a vocational education in construction.  For four years he has been working as a day laborer doing construction.  He also farms. At his house he has a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He also has an orchard where he grows fruit trees. He has been doing this for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is a 47-year-old craftsman from village Mukhrani. He is married and lives with his wife Elsa, his father, and three children. The youngest of the children is one-year-old Anastasia. Josef works as a welder. He has his own workshop and equipment and receives orders from the villagers. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the functioning of the family-owned small pig-farm. 

They have two pigs and five piglets. The family sells approximately 20 piglets per year. 

With the requested credit Josef plans to purchase feed for pigs and also cover expenses of maize sowing. The maize will be sown on the plot owned by the family. Harvested grain will be used for feeding pigs and piglets during the next year. 

Josef plans to reinvest the received profit in the pig-farm – he wants to sell fewer piglets and raise them in the farm. In the future more pigs will give him more piglets for sale, which means increased income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs and pay for tilling the land.

loans.name: Lulongo Sanyu Group

texts.en: 27 year old Florence has been running a food sales business for 6 years now in Lulongo food market in Mubende. The happily married mother of 5 says selling many of the cash crops she grows and harvests from her farming gardens has significantly impacted on the welfare of her family. She says she has been able to earn disposable income, which enables her to make ends meet on a daily basis, and that her weekly business profits are about 100,000 shillings. With this loan she is going to purchase better fertilizers for her farming gardens. She reckons this will improve her crop yields, which in the long run will mean selling her crops at a higher market price.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to use in her farming gardens.

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.en:
Mohiniso is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She sells jewelry. As a rule she works in her store, though she also has a trading stall in the local market.  She sells jewelry items in the national oriental style. She has customers and clients who also sell their jewelry to her. People trust her, knowing that she is very honest when assessing price and quality. Her business is the main source of income for her family. 

Mohiniso has been working with IMON almost for a year. She had proved herself an honest and reliable borrower. Today she is requesting 10,500 Somoni, which she intends to use to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings and bracelets in the oriental style. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase new items of jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foodstuff for her business.

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is married with two children. She has a shop at the center of Khujand city and sells men’s shoes. Tuhfaniso has been in this business for 12 years. She is very nice with customers and treats them well. The clients enjoy buying things from her and come back often. Tuhfaniso's business has become a stable source of income for her family. Tuhfaniso would like to get a loan of 10,000 somoni to increase the assortment of good she sells. She would spend the additional income to improve the family's living conditions.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new shoes

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en:
Muazzam runs a small business, selling men’s shoes. She is a widow with two adult children. Muazzam has been self-employed in shoes sales for 9 years and is the sole breadwinner for her family. Muazzam is a very determined woman and she is serious about her business. These characteristics have helped her promptly repay all her loans from IMON International during her 5 years of partnership with the organization. Maintaining a reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in Muazzam's work and have ensured the success of her business. Muazzam is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to increase her assortment of goods. She is hoping to use the extra financial support to stock up on more merchandise. The loan will not only be beneficial for Muazzam's business, but it will also help her meet her household expenses and to set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: To buy shoes for selling

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 26 years old and lives in village Tserovani, East Georgia. Lasha is married and lives with his wife Natia, two daughters 8 and 5 years old, his parents and brother in his home village. 

Lasha is a car repairman and works in the village. Also he is involved in the family dairy farm. They have four milk cows, whose dairy products are sold in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Total average monthly income from both activities accounts to 1000 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit Lasha plans to expand their cattle-shed. That will allow him to keep more cows and sell more dairy products. In the future Lasha will put aside some savings which will be used for the purchase of additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed expansion.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Mastura is married and has two children. She sells clothing at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. Mastura is very creative in her business and has many new ideas as to business improvement and development. She talks a lot with her clients and helps them not only with their purchases but gives them encouragement and hope in the midst of crises. Mastura would like to borrow $1000 USD to increase her inventories. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce currently sells paste and beans.  She is 28 years old, divorced, and has 5 children -- none of them goes to school.  Joyce borrowed a loan to stock more paste and beans to sell. She hopes to open a big shop in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more paste and beans to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase twenty bags of charcoal

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is 32 years old.  She is single and lives in West Point.  She has two children ages 3 and 7, who are both in school.

Garmai has been selling oil, spices, pepper and other food items for the past five years.  Although there are fewer customers during the rainy season, her business has to go on because it’s from her sales that her children's food and school fees are paid.

Garmai is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, spices, pepper and other food items. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, spices, pepper and other food items

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is a 31-year-old farmer from the village of Mukhrani. He lives with his wife, Gvantsa, two sons (6 and 7 years old) and his parents. Both of the children go to school. 

Teimuraz is busy trading – he buys cement in Kaspi or Gori (nearby towns) and sells it in his village. Also he has two milk cows. He uses the milk for cheese production. The cheese is sold locally. Also, the family owns a greenhouse where tomatoes and tomato seedlings are grown. He sells the vegetables in his village at the open market and the seedlings are sold in the next village. 

With the requested loan, Teimuraz plans to purchase glass for the greenhouse, as some of the old panes are damaged and need to be replaced. After the renovation, the required temperature will be maintained in the greenhouse and more, better quality tomatoes will be grown. It will positively affect the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase glass for greenhouse renovations.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 40-year-old single woman. After her brother passed away, she devoted herself to raising her sister and her brother’s children. Fatmeh has been doing embroidery since she was 13 years old as a hobby. Fatmeh uses her talent and skills to embroider beautiful traditional dresses, pillows and other traditional items. By word of mouth, people reach her to order special dresses for special occasions. 

Fatmeh has applied for a loan to buy more sewing materials, hoping that one day she will be able to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy more embroidery material.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 25 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area.  She is single and has two children, only one of them attends school.

Naomi has been involved in the sales of frozen chickens for the past five years.  She’s requesting a loan to purchase some cartons of chickens and used clothing.  She plans to work hard and earn more money and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and used clothing to sell

loans.name: Aïssa

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssa est âgée de 35  ans, mariée et  mère  de 2 enfants. Elle  vit avec son mari  et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle au  quartier Secoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de profession, elle fait également le commerce depuis des années afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Aïssa excelle dans la fabrication de jus de fruits, de la glace alimentaires, des boissons fraîches etc. 
Dans le dessein de diversifier son activité, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle  est en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 60 mois après 4 prêts solidaires et  3 prêts individuels bien remboursés.  Elle est à son 4 ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, un congélateur.  Elle  s’approvisionne sur place. Madame Aïssa vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes parmi ses clients figurent quelques hommes qui sont des boulangers.
 Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de continuer son activité.  
Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité et d’avoir plus de financement.
texts.en:
Ms. Aïssa is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in a traditional family in the Secoura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A teacher by profession, she has also had a business for years to support her family. She excels in making fruit juices, ice, cold beverages, etc. 

With plans to diversify her business, Aïssa turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which she has had an association for 60 months. Her four solidarity loans and three individual loans have all been repaid. She is on her fourth individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a freezer. She gets her supplies locally. Accepting cash or credit, she sells to a customer base composed mostly of women, although a few of her customers are men who are bakers. 

With this loan, Aïssa envisions making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA. This will enable her to repay her loan and to continue her business. Her ambition is to keep her business going indefinitely and to obtain more financing.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est âgée de 25 ans,  mariée  et mère de 2 enfants.  Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Pelengana de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mariam a laissé  l’école en classe de 8ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour mener le commerce de condiments alimentaires. Elle débuta cette activité  à  côté de sa mère qui vendait du poisson, après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle maîtrise bien les rouages du commerce. De nos jours, Mariam en plus des condiments, fait également du poisson séché, au marché Château. Elle mène cette activité depuis 7 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et clientèle. 
Afin d’augmenter son fonds dans le double souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de renforcer son commerce, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois. Après 2 prêts individuels correctement remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 3 cartons de concentrée de tomate, des paquets d’oignons séchés, des feuilles de baobab etc, elle s’approvisionne à Siribala et Niono. Mariam vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes   majoritairement.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, qui servira à prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales. Son ambition est d’avoir une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam is 25 years old, married and the mother of two. She lives in a traditional family in the Pelnengana district in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). Mariam has dropped out of school in the eighth grade (within Mali's educational system) in order to work as a vendor of food condiments. She started working together with her mother, who used to sell fish. After several years of apprenticeship, she has learned the ropes of her trade. At present she sells condiments as well as dried fish, at the Chateau market. She has been in this business for seven years, and enjoys a good business reputation and customer following. 

In order to increase her working capital with the double goal of meeting customer demand and bolstering her business, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and has now been a member for 24 months. After two individual loans, duly reimbursed, she is now on her third individual loan she plans to use to buy three boxes of tomato concentrate, packs of  drued onions, baobab leaves etc. She stocks up in Siribala and Niono. Mariam sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly benefit of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some family expenses. Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia est âgée de 23 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant.  Elle vit chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle au  quartier Pelengana  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) par suite d’épuisement de scolarité, elle s’initie rapidement au  commerce de condiments au marché. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis 3 ans. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois. Après un  1er  prêt individuel correctement remboursé, elle est à son 2ème prêt  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter 1 tonne d’oignon et bien d’autres paquets de condiments, dans la zone office du Niger (Dougabougou, Seribala etc.).
Madame Rokia vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, qui  lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins du fait qu’elle est célibataire et mère d’un enfant et d’aider son père dans la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales. Son ambition est  de mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokia is 23, single and the mother of one child.She lives with her father in a traditional family in the Pelengana neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative district of the Republic of Mali). 

She left school in the 9th year of "fundamental" (according to the education system in Mali) and quickly got started in selling condiments at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years and is very well known, with a lot of customers. With the goal of increasing her working capital to meet demand from her customers, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and has been associated with them for 12 months. After one individual loan that was repaid correctly, she is now on her second loan  which she plans to use to buy 1 metric ton of onions and other condiments, in the "Office du Niger" area (Dougabougou, Seribala, etc.).

Ms. Rokia sells for cash and on credit to customers who are women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to meet her own needs as she is a single mother, as well as to help her father with some family expenses. Her ambition is to have several income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase drinks to sell in her pub

loans.name: Sétou

texts.fr:
Madame Sétou est âgée de 64  ans, veuve  et  mère  de 8 enfants. Elle  vit avec ses enfants et petits enfants  au  quartier Sébougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Infirmière de formation et de profession, après sa retraite, elle continue les activités en enseignant aujourd’hui dans une école de formation d’infirmier, et en faisant le petit commerce. Elle le mène depuis 12 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience et notoriété, sa force de vente est due au ciblage de sa clientèle qui est composée majoritairement d’étudiants et personnels médicaux.  
Dans le souci de toujours satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle sollicite ce nouveau  prêt. Elle  est en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso,  depuis 54 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 3  prêts  individuels  tous correctement remboursés, elle    est à son 4ème prêt individuel. Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 70 complets de lit draps. Elle   s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
 Avec ce prêt elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA,   qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt,  de continuer son activité et de satisfaire certaine de ses charges.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sétou is 64 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight. She lives with her children and grandchildren in the Sébougou district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).A nurse by training and profession, after her retirement, she continues to teach in a nursing school, and also works as a vendor. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has a lot of experience and is well-known. Her strength is in being able to reach out to her target customers, mostly students and medical personnel.

With the goal of continuing to meet the growing customer demand, she is seeking this new loan. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 54 months; after three solidarity loans and three individual loans, all duly repaid, she is now on her 4th individual loan. She plans to use it to buy 70 sets of bed linens. She stock ups in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 75,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to repay her loan, maintain her business and cover some of her expenses.

loans.use: to buy bed linens

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is 37 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old child.  He makes seat covers for motor vehicles.  He has seven years of experience in this business and has employed one person.  

Shem has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he has been trained on business management.  He also saves his money through Faulu Kenya and can easily access business loans.  He has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy fabric materials to make seat covers.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make seat covers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three sons, 2 had graduated from school while 1 is still attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and clothing. 

For the past eight years, she has been operating a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Mary dreams of owning her own land in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Mary wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past 17 years, Stephene has been operating a business selling eggs door-to-door to his neighbours and passersby using his bicycle.  In his business, he faces a major challenge in transporting his goods. He dreams of establishing a retail shop to sell eggs in the future.       

With the loan for Kshs 10,000, Stephene wants to purchase 60 crates of eggs to resell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase 60 crates of eggs to  resell

loans.name: Nyeupe Group

texts.en:
The Yahaya, who is in his late thirties, is married and has four children who are still going to school.  He has had a construction welding business since 2000.  He works from 7.30am to 6.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Yahaya's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy spares parts for his welding business and to pay school fees for his children. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  Yahaya is requesting another loan to buy more materials for the welding business. His dream is to one day finish building his house, which he has already started.

Yahaya will share this loan with his loan group ,"Nyeupe", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Yahaya is 3rd from right in the back row.

loans.use: To buy materials for his welding business

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad forma parte del banco comunal “Belén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio y tiene dos puestos en los cuales vende artículos de aseo. Uno de los puestos lo atiende su marido y el otro Soledad junto a su hija. Soledad trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 30 años y comenzó con el comercio ambulante. Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo durante todo el día.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y también en locales comerciales ubicados en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería, específicamente artículos de aseo; papel higiénico, servilletas de papel y detergente. 
Sus metas son que su negocio prospere para concretar el sueño de brindarles a sus nietas una situación socio económica más confortable, ya que su hija quedó viuda hace poco tiempo y necesita apoyo. 
Soledad vive junto a su marido y ve constantemente a su hija y nietas
Para Soledad el apoyo y crédito de Fondo Esperanza, significa mucho para su vida, por lo que está muy agradecida. Respecto a las reuniones participa activamente de estas, ya que además es delegada del grupo.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the “Belén” community bank which is located in the city of Valparaíso.  She is in the sales business and has two sales locations from which she sells household products.  Her husband serves in one of the locations and Soledad and her daughter serve in the other.  Soledad has been self employed for 30 years.  She started out as an itinerant saleswoman.  She works all day, Monday to Sunday.

Soledad buys her merchandise from distributors and also in shopping centers in the city of Santiago.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise, specifically household products such as toilet paper, paper napkins and detergents.  Her goal is for her business to prosper so that she can ensure her granddaughters enjoy a more comfortable socio-economic status since her daughter was widowed a short time ago and needs her support.

Soledad lives together with her husband and constantly sees her daughter and granddaughters.

For Soledad, the support and loan from Fondo Esperanza mean a lot and she is very grateful.  She participates actively in her community bank meetings and she is her group's delegate.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers to the north-east of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and is also the seat of the country's legislative power.  It is the most important port in the country and has a large variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as, for example, the home of the poet Pablo Neruda, the Nobel Prize winner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, specifically household products such as toilet paper, paper napkins and detergents

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a single man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and clothing.                    

For the past 3 years, he has been operating a vending business, selling sweets, biscuits and groundnuts from door to door. His potential customers are passersby and neighboring community members.   Edward faces a major challenge of competition from other vendors in the village.  He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing a tuk tuk for the business. 

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Edward wants to purchase packets of sweets and biscuits to resell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy sweets and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Kanyogoga Twetungure Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Henry, a happily father of 5, has been operating his medical clinic business in Kanyogoga-Mubende for 10 years.  He says he began this business after he became aware of the growing demand for medicine in his home area. He not only offers therapy but also sells drugs to patients and people in the neighborhood. 

Before he embarked on this business venture, Henry was fully engaged in that common business that preoccupies most people in Western Uganda:  farming. Henry also raised pigs.  Weekly, he says his business generates for him 100,000 shillings in sales profit. With this loan, Henry says he is going to purchase more drugs to resell.

Henry is affiliated with the Kanyogoga Twetungure Group.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to resell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro D. 48 años D. edad, es soltero, tiene casa propia que cuenta  con los servicios sólo luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Túcume a una hora del departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a L. comercialización D. animales, agricultura y turismo.

DesD. hace varios años Pedro se dedica a L. compra, crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno(vacas) y aves D. corral (pavos, gallinas y patos), su  corral lo tiene en L. parte externa D. su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus animales los alimenta con dieta balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo ideal los ofrece en los distintos mercados D. Lambayeque y Chiclayo, lo que le permite a aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias D. su casa.

Por lo mismo Pedro a solicitado un préstamo  D. 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para seguir comprando animales (aves D. corral y ganado vacuno) para criarlas y venderlas al por mayor y menor en los  mercados, también lo va utilizar para comprar alimentos balanceados  y seguir incrementado sus ingresos brindando un producto sano y D. calidad.  Pedro es conocido por los comerciantes D. L. zona por ser una  persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas D.  mejorar en L. vida y en su desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
Pedro is 48 years old, single, and he has a house of his own. It is only equipped with electricity and it is locate din the district of Tucume, one hour from the department of Lambayeque. This region is known for its people who are dedicated to farming, agriculture, and tourism.

For many years, Pedro has been buying, raising and selling cattle (cows) and foul (turkeys, chicken, and ducks). He has his corral in the exterior part of his house for greater security and comfort. He feeds his livestock with a balanced feed and with natural grasses. Once they have reached an ideal level of development he offers them for sale in the different markets in Lambayeque and Chiclayo. This helps him to increase his earnings and to cover the daily expenses of his household.

Pedro has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to continue to buy livestock (poultry and cattle) to raise and resell in wholesale and retail in the markets. He will also use it to purchase balanced feed and to continue increasing his income, to produce a health and quality product. Pedro is known by the merchants in the region to be a very hardworking person who is very eager to improve in life and in his personal development.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Manuel Esteban

texts.es:
Manuel es un señor de 67  años de edad vive con su esposa e hijo mayor  en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. En una comunidad rural que cuenta con servicios de luz pero no de desagüe. Sin embargo Manuel vive feliz y tranquilo y tiene muchos deseos de superación.

Manuel se dedica ala crianza de ganado ovino, teniendo 40 animales a su cargo. La venta de animales le ha dado a Manuel muchas satisfacciones. Además cuenta con parcela agrícola en la que siembra limón semanalmente  y esto también le genera buenos ingresos. Manuel cuenta con clientela ya establecida en su zona, para ambos negocios.

Manuel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y en las mejoras  de sus corrales pues esto optimizará  las condiciones de crianza de sus ovejas y le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Manuel es un cliente conocido por nuestra entidad, su primer préstamo lo cancelo puntualmente.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 67 year old man who lives with his wife and their eldest son in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. It is a rural community which enjoys electricity but there are no sewage services. Manuel lives a happy and calm life and he has many dreams of improvement.

Manuel raises sheep and he has 40 livestock in his care. The sale of livestock has given Manuel much satisfaction. He also has a plot of farm land where he cultivates lemons weekly and this also generates a good income. Manuel has en established clientele in his region, for both businesses.

Manuel requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for his livestock and to improve the corrals to optimize the living space for his sheep. It will help him to continue to develop his business.

Manuel is a client known in our organization and his first loan was repaid on time.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Normaida

texts.es:
La señora Normaida,  vive en tecpatan estado de Chiapas México. Ella es casada  con el señor Luciano, con quien procreo seis hijos que  cuatro ya están casado y dos están siete años de edad.

   Ella es la segunda vez que solicita  el préstamo es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: aceite, carne, hoja de guineo, chile ancho  para la elaboración de tamales y luego venderlo en el mismo lugar. En esta actividad lleva  dos años y cuatro meses en donde comenta que la va bien ya que con ello está apoyando a sus hijos que están en la escuela.

   Para dedicarse a esta actividad  lo planeo con  su esposo para  que juntos trabajen  y les puedan dar lo más necesario a sus hijos  que aun están pequeños.

   Su más grande deseo  es salir adelante con su familia  y con su pequeña actividad.
texts.en:
Normaida lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married to Luciano, with whom she had six children; four are now married, and two are seven years of age.

This is the second time she requests a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: cooking oil, meat, banana leaves, and chilies for making her tamales and selling them.  She has been carrying out this activity for two years and four months, and comments that things are going well as her business is helping her continue supporting her school-aged children.

She planned with her husband in order to dedicate herself to this business, so they could work together to provide for their children who are still young.

Her greatest wishes are to get ahead with her family and her business.

loans.use: buy the ingredients for making her tamales.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married woman with two boys, one is attending school while the other is still too young.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing. 

For the past 2 years, Carolyne has been operating a business selling cookies from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality and competition from other sellers in the area. Carolyne dreams of establishing a tailoring business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 15,000, Carolyne wants to open a tailoring shop.  She needs to purchase cloth materials for this new business. 

Carolyne decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start a tailoring shop

loans.name: Araley

texts.es:
La señora Araley, vive en unión libre con el señor Leonardo, ella tiene veinticuatro años de edad y  a su responsabilidad están dos hijos: Pablo Leonardo de siete año, Carlos Alberto de seis años de edad.

    El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes como son: azúcar, huevo, aceite, harina,  para  la elaboración de dulces de nuégados, como también  elabora tamales  para venderlo en la misma localidad, en  esta actividad diez meses y cometa que le va viene ya  que con ello sosteniendo ingresos en su hogar.

   Comenta que se dedica a esta actividad para  por su propia idea ya que  también quiere aportar con los ingresos y su marido no se sienta sola con que solo el trabaje, así los dos trabajaran y  saldrán adelante.

   Su  grande  deseo es que con esta actividad  logre tener ingresos y con ello   sacar adelante a sus familia que es lomas  importante para ella.
texts.en:
Araley lives in a common-law marriage with her husband Leonardo.  She is twenty-four years old and responsible for two children:  Pablo Leonardo, seven years of age, and Carlos Alberto who is six.

The loan requested is to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: sugar, eggs, cooking oil, and flour for making nougat candies.  She also makes tamales to sell in the same locality.  She has been in the business for ten months, and comments that things are going well and the income has helped her support the household.

She states that starting a business was her own idea, because she also wants to contribute with an income so her husband won’t feel that he alone must work.  This way, they can both work and get ahead.

Her greatest wish is that she will manage to generate some income through this activity to help the family get ahead, which is an important goal for her.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making candies and tamales.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 45 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos en casa propia que esta ubicada en el caserío El Papayo del Algarrobo en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Rosa asume hoy en día todos los gastos de l hogar y es por eso que es una mujer muy trabajadora.

La actividad que ella desarrolla es la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola en el que actualmente tiene limón y mango en producción así como maíz.  Además del cultivo mencionado, Rosa se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y de pavos que luego comercializa en el mercado local. Rosa recibe el apoyo de uno de sus hijos que trabaja en labores agrícolas también. Ambos se apoyan en las actividades que realizan y existe una buena relación familiar. 

Rosa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos y pavos para  así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 
Rosa tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 45 years old, a widow, and she lives with her 3 children in a house of their own. It is located in the community of El Papayo del Agarrobo in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Rosa assumes responsibility of all of the household expenses which is why she is a very hardworking woman.

Her business activity is agriculture. She has a plot of farm land where she cultivates lemons, mangoes, and corn. In addition to the mentioned cultivations, Rosa also raises sheep and poultry. She resells them at a local market. Rosa receives support by one of her children who also works in agriculture. They help each other in their activities and they enjoy a good family relationship.

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her lemon plantation. She will also purchase balanced feed to raise her sheep and poultry to be able to sell them at a better price and to keep developing her business. Rosa has many dreams of improving their life. This loan will help her increase her sales and to reach her goal.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her lemon plantation.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda,  vive en unión libre con el señor Wilfrido con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están asu  responsabilidad  y son: Carlos Iván  de dieciseis años de edad en cuarto de primaria y Cristian  Jeovanni ni de siete años de edad en segundo de primaria.


      Ella  se dedica ala venta de tacos  en donde lleva  cuatro años y cuatro eses  y solicito el préstamo  para apoyarse en la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza y son: carne, repollo. Tortilla, chile verde, aceite, entre otros, en donde  comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido buenos resultados de ganancias.

     Comenta que cuando antes que se casara  trabajo con una señora que vendía tacos y aprendió como se prepara  y veía que le daba buena ganancias  por eso ella tambien se dedica a lo mismo y si le va bien.

      Lo que mas desea es que con esta  actividad logre salir adelante y  tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is in a common-law marriage with Wilfrido, with whom she has two children still in her care:  Carlos Iván, who is ten and in fourth grade, and Cristian Jeovanni, who is seven and in second grade.

She dedicates herself to selling tacos, which she has been doing for over four years.  She requests this loan to support herself in the purchase of the ingredients that she uses such as:  meat, cabbage, tortillas, green chilies, and cooking oil, among others.  She comments that things are going well with the business, and she has had good results income-wise.

She tells us that, before she married, she worked with a woman who sold tacos.  She learned how to make tacos from her, and saw that a good income could be generated, which is why she decided to embark in the same type of business.

What she wishes the most for is that, with this activity, she will manage to get ahead and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making tacos such as: cooking oil, meat, tortillas and green chilies, among others.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano es un joven trabajador de 27 años de edad el vive con su esposa y pequeño hijo en el distrito de Reque en Lambayeque. La zona donde vive Adriano cuenta con energía eléctrica más no con agua potable. El consumo de agua se hace mediante un pozo tubular.

Adriano se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura, él tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en este oficio que viene desarrollando en a misma zona donde vive actualmente. Adriano cultiva camote, fríjol y maíz por temporada. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que utilizará para la siembra de fríjol pues ya es temporada de este producto. 

Adriano ya ha tenido varios créditos con nuestra entidad y esto le ha permitido ir creciendo en su negocio. Ha cancelado puntualmente sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Adriano is a young, hardworking man who is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and their young son in the district of Reque in Lambayeque. The region where Adriano lives is equipped with electricity but there is no potable water. The water they use comes from a well.

Adriano has been dedicated to agriculture since he was very young. He has more than 10 years' experience in the business, which he has been developing in the same region where he lives. Adriano cultivates sweet potatoes, beans, and corn according to the season.

He requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles to plant beans. This product is currently in season.

Adriano has had various loans with our organization and this has helped him increase his business. He has repaid his loans on time.

loans.use: to start a bean plantation.

loans.name: Los Heroes Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Los Herores" estan ubicados cerca del centro del Municipio de San Felipe del progreso, para mayor referencia hay un Hospital General y una unidad Deportiva cerca del domicilio donde se reune el grupo, los integrantes son 8 personas y viven muy cerca cada una, se conocen desde hace vaR. años y todos confian en cada uno del grupo, el grupo en general comenta que se llaman así porque de todos los nombres que mencionaron vaR. ya estaban ocupados y el de los Heroes les gusto mas, los 8 integrantes son personas que se dedican al comercio por ejemplo este es el caso del Señor Rogelio que se dedica al comercio y su negocio es vender productos de limpieza como: suavitel para lavar la ropa, tambien clarasol y fabuloso para lavar los pisos y hacer el aseo de la casa. Don Rogelio lleva 4 años con este negocio por eso comenta que pasa por vaR. desafios como transportar el producto en una camionetita y hacer el gasto diario de gasolina, tambien como la camioneta se usa diario y son distancias grandes las recorre se tiene que hacer el servico seguido de la camioneta y hacer vaR. cambios, otro desafio que encuantra es que los precios suben y el tiene que dar un puco mas caro, si esto pasa don Rogelio sale perdiendo ya que sus clientes le reclaman porque volvio a subir y a el no le conviene porque va perdiendo clientes y los gastos que el hace con su camioneta sigen siendo los mismos ó mas caro, Don Rogelio dice; "el prestamo me va beneficiar por medio de los ingresos que vaya teniendo por medio de las ganancias de cada producto que se venda, de esta manera yo pueda mantener a mi familia" mis metas son engrandecer el negocio hasta poner un local para evitar tantos viajes, como tambien saber elaborar el producto, ya que compro el producto echo, pero no se como prepararlo y que tantas cosas sirven para hacerlo, Don Rogelio tiene 3 hijos, el pequeño es un niño de tres años, los dos mas grandes estudian la escuela primaria y la secundaria, don Rogelio vive en union libre hace ya 14 años y de edad tiene 46 años, vive en casa propia y su esposa es ama de casa, Los demas compañeros de don Rogelio son comerciantes tambien y sus negocios son los siguientes;
1.-Elidia, tiene un tienda de abarrotes
2.-Sonia, cria pollos y guajolotes y productos de belleza
3.-Anastacio, vende frituras chcharrones de cuadro
4.-Ma Agustina, vende ropa de segunda mano
5.-Natalia, vende pollos y verdura
6.-Georgina, tiene un taqueria
7.-Lilia vende Jarceria. Estos son los 8 integrantes del grupo de los "Heroes" y sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group is called "Los Heroes" and they are situated close to the town centre of San Felipe del Progreso (for further reference: there is a General Hospital and a sports centre near to the house where the group meet). There are 8 members in the group and they live close to each other. They have known each other for many years and they all trust each other. As a group, they say that they have called themselves by this name because all the names they came up with were already taken, and they liked their chosen name best. The 8 members all run businesses, as is the case with Señor Rogelio who runs a business selling cleaning products: 'Suavitel' for laundry, along with 'Clarasol' and 'Fabuloso' for cleaning floors and other surfaces in the home.
Don Rogelio has run this business for 4 years and he tells us that he has faced many challenges, such as transporting the products in his little van; having to pay daily for gas; also as he uses the van daily for travelling long distances he has to take the van for services and pay for maintenance. Another challenge comes from rising costs which means he would have to sell his products at a higher price. If this happens, Don Rogelio ends up operating at a loss as he does not pass on these price rises to his clients. If he keeps on increasing his prices then he will lose his clients, and the costs that he must pay for his van continue to be the same or higher. Don Rogelio says, 'the loan is going to improve the income I receive from the sale of each product, and so I will be able to provide for my family'. His goals are to increase the size of his business until he has his own shop, so that he will not have to make so many journeys, as well as learning how to make the product, as he currently buys the product ready made but does not know how to prepare it and many items are needed to make it. 

Don Rogelio is 46 years old and has three children. The youngest is three years old and his two older children are at primary and secondary school respectively. Don Rogelio has been with his partner for 14 years, they live in their own home and his partner is a housewife. The other members in Don Rogelios group are also businesspeople, and their businesses are as follows:   

1.-Elidia, runs a general store
2.-Sonia, raises chickens and turkeys and sells beauty products
3.-Anastacio, sells fried snacks
4.-Ma Agustina, sells second hand clothes
5.-Natalia, sells chicken and vegetables
6.-Georgina, sells tacos
7.-Lilia sells domestic products. These are the 8 members of "Heroes" and their businesses.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for laundry and domestic cleaning
