loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es una cliente de 41 años de edad, esta separada y tiene 2 menores hijos a quienes mantener. Ella vive en una casa alquilada en el distrito de Cayalti en Chiclayo, en una zona urbana de comerciantes. Amelia es una persona de buenas referencias personales y laborales y proviene de una familia de comerciantes que le han enseñado todo en ese rubro.

Amelia se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y patos, este negocio lo lleva desde hace 10 años y le ha traído buenos resultados que han valido su esfuerzo. Esta actividad la ha desarrollado en la casa donde vive y en la casa de sus padres, quienes le han sabido brindar su apoyo incondicional. Amelia desea extender su negocio pues el bienestar de sus hijos lo requiere.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de  1500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de patos y cerdos que le permitirán generar nuevas ganancias. Otra parte del crédito será utilizada en la ampliación del corral donde cría a sus animales para que estos crezcan en condiciones óptimas.

Amelia tiene muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Amelia is a 41 years old, separated, and she has 2 young children in her care. She lives in a rented house in the district of Cayatli in Chiclayo. It is a commercial, urban region. Amelia is a person who enjoys good personal and work-related references. She comes from a family of merchants who have taught her the business.

Amelia raises guinea pigs and ducks. She has been in business for 10 years and it has brought her good results, worthy of her efforts. She manages her business from the house where she lives and from her parents' house. They have provided her with unconditional support. Amelia wants to expand the corral where she keeps her livestock so that they will grow in optimal conditions.

Amelia has many dreams of advancement.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Maria Fidencia

texts.es:
María tiene  33 años de edad, está casada y vive en casa propia en el caserío Chica Alta del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. María es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. Ella desea arduamente mejorar su calidad de vida.

María se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos) y  ganado ovino. Estas actividades las realiza en la parte trasera de su casa. María sabe que darles la mejor crianza a sus animales traerá buenos resultados en sus comercializaciones. Es por ello que, María, les da todos los cuidados necesarios para que estos crezcan en condiciones óptimas.

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que usará para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus aves y de su ganado ovino. 

Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, married, and she lives in a house of her own in the community of Chicha Alta in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Maria is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She wants very much to improve the quality of her life.

Maria raises poultry (chicken and turkeys) and sheep. She has her business in the rear part or her property. Maria knows that raising her livestock well will yield good results at the time of sale. That is why Maria provides them with all of the care they need for them to develop in optimal conditions.

Maria requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for her poultry and sheep.

She will be very happy if she would receive a loan because it will help her to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a married man and has 2 children, all of whom had graduated from school.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past 27 years, Reuben has owned rental houses and rents them to travelers and local tenants.  He also has a business distributing drinking water, which adds to his income.   Reuben faces a major challenge of competition and seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 40,000,  Reuben wants to purchase water pipes for his water distribution business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes for his water distribution business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more food to sell

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Salustiana tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, con dos hijos: uno ya mayor de edad  y otro en edad escolar. 
Salustiana es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Capiata, a donde viaja cada mes a colocar y cobrar sus productos, pues vive en Carapegua. 
Gracias  a su sacrificio y esfuerzo pudo brindarle a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar, para que en el futuro puedan ser independientes y sepan progresar con una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y telas de color para tejer hamacas, pues en ésta temporada es un trabajo muy solicitado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Salustiana is 49 years old.  She is a single mother with two children: one grown up and one school age.

Salustiana is very entrepreneurial.  She weaves blankets and tablecloths and sells them herself on credit in the town of Capiata where she travels every month to drop off and collect payment for her products (she lives in Carapegua).

Thanks to her sacrifice and efforts, she has been able to provide her children with all the comforts of life and also an education so that they can live independently in the future and know how to make progress with a better quality of life.

Salustiana is requesting this loan to buy threads and colored fabric for weaving hammocks since this is something which is very much requested by her customers during this season.

loans.use: to buy supplies, thread and colored fabric for her weaving business

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is a married woman and has two children, a boy and a girl. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent.

For the past 2 years, Zaitun has been operating a Kanga selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge in the  high cost of transportation and in competition from other clothes selling businesses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000,  Zaitun wants to purchase bundles of Kanga for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy bundles of Kanga for resale

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita tiene 56 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 25 años en este negocio, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona capaz y responsable disfruta mucho de su trabajo y de sacar adelante su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y ropa interior. Maria desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 56 years old and sells general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 25 years and has shown herself to be a capable and responsible person who enjoys her work a lot and enjoys getting ahead in her business. 

María will use her loan to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics, towels, sheets and underwear.  She would like to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics, towels, sheets and underwear

loans.name: Twidike Group

texts.en:
Florian, who is in her early forties, is a divorcee with two children.  She has been selling fabrics and sarongs since 1991.  She works from 8.00am to 2.30pm(for six and half hours) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Florian's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She plans to use this loan to increase her stock of fabrics and sarongs, and to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to one day build a house of her own.

Florian will share this loan with her loan group, "Twidike", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sarongs to resell, and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Nouhou

texts.fr: Revendeur d’appareils électroniques, Nouhou est un jeune homme de 34 ans marié à une couturière et  père de 02 enfants. Commencé depuis 2004, il est à son troisième cycle de prêt dans notre institution. Ce dernier va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en portables, en télévision, puis en quelques accessoires électroniques (batterie,……) pour satisfaire les demandes des clients. il tient sa boutique dans un quartier de la capitale.
texts.en: Noubou is a young man, 34 years old, married to a dressmaker and a father of two children, who works selling secondhand electronics.  He is currently on his third loan cycle through our institution since he started in 2004.  This current loan will enable him to purchase stock – cell phones, televisions, and several electronics accessories (batteries, etc.) – to meet his clients’ needs.  His shop is located in a district within the capital city.

loans.use: to purchase electronics items

loans.name: Hipólito Rafael

texts.es:
A la vivienda de señor Hipólito Rafael le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas de su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar las protecciones y colocarlas en la vivienda. 
Desea que su familia este segura y protegida, mientras el se encuentra trabajando. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrico, ya que este es la fuente de ingreso que tiene. Su esposa la señora Kenia se dedica al cuidado de los hijos.
texts.en:
Hipólito Rafael's home needs some protection on the windows and doors.  He is requesting a loan so that he can pay somebody to make the bars and fit them.

Hipólito would like his family to be safe and well protected while he is out at work.  He plans to repay his loan with part of the wage that he earns from his work in a factory which is his source of income.  His wife, Kenia, takes care of their children.

loans.use: to fit bars at his windows and doors

loans.name: San Miguel Del Centro Group

texts.es:
El grupo que presento se llama "San Miguel del Centro", los integrantes del grupo platicarón que el nombre de su grupo es el mismo que el de su comunidad, San Miguel es una comunidad grande pero no cuenta con muchos servicios y esta muy retirada de la carretera, las calles principales las estan empezando a pavimentar, por lo mientras hay mcucha tierra suelta y los caminos muy empedrados, el grupo lo forman 7 personas de la misma comunidad, la gente de esta comunidad es muy educada, y muy amable, la mayoria de la gente es comerciante y otra parte se dedica a criar animales, la representante de este grupo es doña Gregoria, una señora casada hace 15 años, tiene 4 hijos que van a la escuela, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, su esposo trabaja como constructor de obras, por el tipo de trabajo de su esposo habeces tiene que salir y regresar como a los 8 o 15 dias, ya que el señor sale a otros estados si es necesario para trabajar, doña Gregoria vive en casa propia, y nos platica que trabaja como cocinera, tiene un negocio de antojitos Méxicanos, y vende quesadillas, pambazos y tacos dorados, de tomar hace café, té y atole, en su negocio ya tiene varios años y nos cuenta que sus desafios son que no le dieron el permiso en su presidencia para que trabajara entre semana en el mercado, solo la dejan ponerse los fines de semana que son los dias sabados y domingos, tambien nos comenta que le hace fA. dinero para poder invertirlo y comprar todo lo nesario para poder trabajar su negocio, doña Gregoria no quiere endeudarse por eso piensa invertir bien el dinero y que le deje algo de ganancias, de este modo quiere ayudar en su casa comprando lo nesesario y tambien para que los niños tengan una mejor calidad de vida, los sueños que tiene doña Gregoria son poder mejorar y poner un negocio estable, ya que ella se desvela mucho para poner su negocio y camina mucho tiempo del negocio a la casa, tambien quiere que sus niños no dejen la escuela por fA. de recursos por eso quiere echarle ganas y es por sus hijos. Los demas integrantes del grupo se llaman;
1.-Juan y el se dedica a cuidar y engordar borregos
2.-Cristina, ella vende tacos  y gorditas
3.-Maria, compra y vende borregos
4.-Maria, Juana cria pollos y guajolotes
5.-Maria Julia cria de borregos
6.-Rufina, cria de borregos
texts.en:
This group is called "San Miguel del Centro".  The members say that their group's name is the same of that of their community.  San Miguel is a large community but it doesn't have many services and is a long way from the main road.  They are starting to pave the main streets of the community.  In the meantime, there is a lot of loose earth and the roads are cobbled.  There are seven members of this group who all live in the same community.  The locals are very well-mannered and very kind.  Most people make a living selling products, whilst others raise animals.

This group's representative is Gregoria who has been married for 15 years and has four children who go to school: two sons and two daughters.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Owing to the nature of her husband's work, he sometimes has to stay away from home for one or two weeks since he travels to other states if it is necessary for his work.

Gregoria lives in her own home and she tells us that she works as a cook.  She has a business making Mexican snacks and she sells quesadillas, 'pambazos' (white bread, dipped in red chili pepper sauce, stuffed with potatoes and chorizo) and 'tacos dorados' (fried tacos).  She also serves coffee, tea and atole (a traditional, corn-based hot drink).

Gregoria has been in her business for several years and tells us that one of her challenges is that the local authorities won't give her permission to work in the market during the week.  They only let her work there on weekends: Saturdays and Sundays.  She also tells us that she lacks the money she needs to invest and buy everything she needs to work in her business.

Gregoria doesn't want to get into debt and so she is planning to invest her money wisely so that it leaves her some profits.  In this way, she would like to be able to help at home, buying what the family needs and improving the children's quality of life.  Gregoria's dreams are to improve and stabilize her business since she loses sleep in order to set up her business and she has a long walk between her business and her home.  She doesn't want her children to have to leave school because of a lack of money.  She does everything for her children.

The other members of the group are:
1. Juan - who looks after and fattens lambs
2. Cristina - who sells tacos and 'gorditas' (stuffed corn cake)
3. María - who buys and sells lambs
4. María Juana - who raises chickens and turkeys
5. María Julia - who raises lambs
6. Rufina - who raises lambs

loans.use: to make Mexican snacks

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: El Sr.  Leandro tiene 53 años de edad, es casado con la Sra. Neida, tiene cuatro hijos y todos mayores de edad e independientes, vive por la zona de la Mutualista hace 20 años que se vino de Camiri, en ese entonces empezó su negocio con una venta chiquitita ahí mismo donde vive; luego fue creciendo a lo que ahora es una tienda mucho mas completa y surtida. El crédito que se le dio al señor es para la reparación de su vehículo que es con el cual va y compra su mercadería. El Sr. quedo muy entusiasmado con la rapidez con la que se le otorgo el crédito, es una persona buena y trabajadora, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leandro is 53 years old and married to Neida.  They have four children who are all grown up and live independently.  Leandro lives in the Mutualista zone.  He came to the city from Camiri 20 years ago.  He started his business from a very small sales location in his home.  His business gradually grew into what it is now: a much bigger and better stocked store.

The loan that Leandro has been given will be used to repair the vehicle which he uses to go and buy his merchandise.  Leandro was delighted by the speed with which he was granted his loan.  He is a good, hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Ideal Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ideal lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes tienen 11 ciclos con Adim. La coordinadora es la señora Thelma quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Masaya. Ella inicio este negocio hace 40 años vendiendo los productos que producía en su huerta actualmente ella compra cosechas. 

Las otras integrantes son Irene de 41 años quien desde hace 8 años realiza trajes típicos y Tania de 22 años se dedica a la realización de bordados y ropa típica.
texts.en:
The 'Ideal' group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial women who have been working with ADIM for 11 loan cycles.  The group's coordinator is Thelma who sells fruit in Masaya market.  She started her business 40 years ago, selling the produce that she grew in her vegetable garden.  She currently buys other people's harvested crops.

The other members of the group are 41 year-old Irene who has been making traditional dresses for eight years and 22 year-old Tania who makes embroidered products and traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Doña Eleazar esta muy contenta por el préstamo que esta obteniendo ya que le servirá de mucho para tener surtido su negocio de venta de jugos y licuados. Ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 6 meses y lo puso para tener otro ingreso extra, ella comprara naranjas, betabel, azúcar, leche, chocolate, fresas, manzana, zanahorias etc. También dice que se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno desde hace 8 años ya que ella es madre soltera y tiene que sacar a sus pequeños hijos adelante con sus estudios. Doña Eleazar es una señora muy emprendedora y muy alegre dice que los días sábados y domingos vende cena fuera de su casa ella vende tacos dorados, quesadillas, enchiladas, pozole y aguas frescas comenta que con este negocio ella tiene 5 años y que lo puso por que sus vecinas la animaron por que cocina muy sabroso y eso la motivo a poner su negocio. La meta que tiene doña Eleazar es poner en su casa una cenaduría donde sus clientes se sientan a gusto y cómodos cuando vallan a comer a la cenaduría.
Los otros 9 integrantes se llaman Silvia, Irma, Leshlye, Griselda, Laura Angelica, Blanca, Argelia, Anayeli, Librado, ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en una papeleria, venta de antojitos mexicanos, zapato por catalogo,ropa para dama y niños,ropa interior, venta de elotes preparados, tienda de abarrotes y panaderia.
texts.en:
Eleazar is very happy with the loan that she is receiving as it will help her a lot in stocking her business selling juice and smoothies.  She has owned her business for approximately six months.  She set it up in order to make an extra income.  She will buy oranges, beets, sugar, milk, chocolate, strawberries, apples, carrots etc.  She says that she also washes and irons other people's clothes.  She has been doing this for eight years since she is a single mother and has to get her young children ahead in their studies.

Eleazar is a very entrepreneurial and cheerful lady.  She says that on Saturdays and Sundays she sells dinners outside her home.  She sells fried tacos, quesadillas, enchiladas, 'pozole' (meat and hominy stew) and 'aguas frescas' (fresh fruit drinks).  She says that she has been in this business for five years and that her neighbors encouraged her to set it up because her cooking is very tasty.  Eleazar's goal is to set up a restaurant in her home where her customers will feel at ease and comfortable when they come to eat.

The other nine members of this group are Silvia, Irma, Leshlye, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Blaca, Argelia, Anayeli and Librado.  They would like loans to invest in a stationery store, a business making Mexican snacks, catalog shoe sales, ladies' and children's clothes sales, underwear sales, cooked corn on the cob sales, a grocery store and a bakery.

loans.use: to sell juice, smoothies and meals

loans.name: Tado

texts.fr: Revendeuse de maïs, d’ignames et de bois de chauffe  à domicile depuis six ans, Mme  Amavi est veuve avec 02 enfants à charge. Elle s’approvisionne à kpalimé (une ville de la région des plateaux  située à 120km au nord-ouest de la capitale Lomé) et à Bassar (ville de la région de la Kara située à 450 km au nord de Lomé) elle a 59 ans et  s’est fixé  un objectif : se battre pour éduquer convenablement ses enfants.
texts.en: Madame Amavi has been selling corn, yams and firewood from her home for the past 6 years. She is a widow with two children in her care. She sources her goods from Kpalimé (a town in the region 120km northwest of the capital city, Lomé) and from Bassar (a town in the Kara region, 450km north of Lomé). She is 59 years old and has set herself the task of seeing to her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Rio Grande La Cruz Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Río Grande la C.  porque la mayoría de sus integrantes pertenecen a la colonia que se llama la C., este grupo esta integrado por 14 persona que se dedican a diferentes actividades para el subsidio de sus familias.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes: Norma (Venta de refrescos), Eva y Bernarda (Venta de pescado), Lucia, Cecilia, Maribel y Eufemia (Venta de antojitos), Estefana (Venta de quesos),  Teresa (Venta de frutas y Verduras), Paula (Venta de productos herbalife), Obdulia (Taller de costura), Rosa (Venta de perfumes), Lucia (Venta de chiles y semillas) y Claudia (Venta de ropa).
Teresa es una de las integrantes de este grupo ella tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Juan quien se dedica a las labores del campo, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 trabaja y el otro estudia el bachillerato.
Lucia tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de frutas y legumbres así como también ofrece la venta de refrescos. Ella solicito el crédito para comprar más productos como son: jitomate, cebolla, ajo, papas, chiles, manzanas, plátano, entre otros.
Lucia tiene 8 años con su negocio ella inicio con este negocio debido a la necesidad que tenía de poder darle una profesión a su hija; ya que su hija iba a otro lugar e iba a necesitar dinero. Ella comenta que inicio con un poco de mercancía pero con el tiempo fue adquiriendo clientes y sus ventas han mejorado un poco, además que es el único negocio que existe en su colonia. 
Para Lucia es muy importante su negocio ya que el pudo realizar el sueño de su hija de estudiar una carrera y ahora su hija ya trabaja y la ayuda un poco económicamente, aun su negocio sigue siendo muy importante ya que ella quiere que su otro hijo estudie también una carrera y espera poder lograrlo.
Su meta es poder hacer un propio local en donde pueda vender sus productos y eso  lo lograra con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Las integrantes de este grupo están  muy agradecidas por el apoyo del préstamo ya que con  ello podrán invertir en sus negocios
texts.en:
This group is called 'Río Grande la C.' because most of the members live in La C. district.  This group has 14 members who all work in different business activities to support their families.

The members of this group are: Norma (who sells soft drinks); Eva and Bernarda (who sell fish); Lucia, Cecilia, Maribel and Eufemia (who sell snacks); Estefana (who sells cheese); Teresa (who sells fruit and vegetables); Paula (who sells Herbalife products); Obdulia (who has a dressmaking workshop); Rosa (who sells perfume); Lucia (who sells chilis and seeds) and Claudia (who sells clothes).

Teresa is one of the group's members.  She is 47 years old, married to Juan who works in agriculture, and has two children.  One of her children already works and the other is studying for his high school diploma.

Lucia has a small fruit and vegetable business in her home.  She also sells soft drinks.  She requested this loan to buy more products such as tomatoes, onions, garlic, potatoes, chilis, apples, bananas, etc.

Lucia has been in her business for eight years.  She started out in her business because she needed to be able to provide her daughter with a profession.  Her daughter was moving somewhere else and was going to need money.  She says that she started out with a small amount of merchandise but, over time, she gained customers and her sales have improved a little.  It is the only business in her district.

Lucia's business is very important to her since it enabled her to fulfil her dream of her daughter studying for a degree.  Now her daughter is working and helps her a little financially.  Her business continues to be very important because she also wants her son to study for a degree and she hopes to be able to help him achieve this.  Her goal is to own her own premises where she can sell her products and she will achieve this through her effort and commitment.  The members of this group are very grateful for the support of this loan since it will enable them to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables such as apples, bananas, chilis, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Canela Group

texts.es:
El señor Rey como le dicen de cariño su familia y conocidos, el desde muy pequeño sus padres le inculcaron el amor por la tierra le enseñaron a trabajarla, dice que cuando era joven se dedico al cultivo de maíz, pero se le hizo un trabajo muy pesado y que le dejaba muy pocas ganancias. Ahora se dedica al comercio de paletas de hielo y helados, aproximadamente hace 16 años comenzó con el negocio, primero en su casa, luego en su localidad que es Curungueo y después como le fue hiendo bien se fue a otras comunidades como son Macho de Agua, Río De Guadalupe y otras comunidades, su negocio es ambulante el se pone fuera de las primarias y cuando no hay clases el vende sus paletas en las calles de las rancherías, por eso don Rey esta pidiendo su crédito a Fundación Realidad para surtir producto de helados y paletas ya que el las compra y las revende también para comprar barquillos, vaso para el helado, y comprar otra hielera por que comenta que la que tiene ya esta muy viejita.  Sus necesidades son muchas, ya que el tiene que sacar  adelante a su familia, quiere hacer unos cuartos por que ya donde viven no caben ya que todavía varios de sus hijos viven con el, comenta “Quiero darles una mejor vida comprarles mas camas para que ya no duerman todos enracimados antes no tenia piso mi casa y gracias a que he tenido mejores ventas por que he surtido mas con los créditos que me han otorgado ya le hice piso de cemento a mi casa por eso sigo trabajando con la financiera por que me ha ayudado a darle una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos”.   El es casado desde hace treinta años con doña Amalia ellos tienen seis hijos, la mayor de nombre Mariana es casada con dos niños, luego le siguen Armando y Ángeles de 24 y 22 respectivamente, dice don Rey que ellos dos le ayudan con los gastos de la casa, a comprar el gas o la leña y al pago de la luz y cuando pueden le ayudan con los gastos de la escuela de Miriam y Liliana de 18 y 13 años, y su hija Lourdes de 20 años es madre soltera, comenta que ella ayuda en las labores del hogar. El sueña con poder darles una carrera a sus hijas y no truncarles sus sueños a ellas.   Su meta es proponerse hacer un local estable en su casa, para que su esposa doña Amalia y su hija Lourdes le ayuden a vender su producto, y mas adelante comprar un conservador para sus nieves y paletas.  
Los otros 3 integrantes se llaman Mariana, Virginia y Benito ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en  la compra  de Frutas y verduras y antojitos mexicanos (corundas).
texts.en:
His family and friends affectionately call Reynaldo Señor Rey. From an early age his parents taught him to love the land and how to work it. As a young man he grew corn but it was very hard work and brought him little profit. Now Rey sells popsicles and ice cream, a job he’s been doing for sixteen years. He started out by selling from his house, then in his community of Curungueo, and finally as all was going well, he started going to other communities such as Macho de Agua and Río De Guadalupe amongst others. He walks around to sell his wares, outside primary schools for example, and when school is out, he sells in the streets of the communities. 

Now Rey is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Realidad to buy more stock and also to buy ice cream cones, glass containers for ice cream, and another cooler as the one he has is very old.

Rey’s needs are many as he has a family to help get ahead in life. He wants to add more rooms to his home which is no longer big enough since several of his children still live at home. He says, “I want to give them a better life and buy more beds so that they don’t all sleep together. Before, my house had no floor but thankfully sales increased so I was able to take out loans and put in a concrete floor. For this reason I am still working with a finance company because it has helped me provide my children with a better quality of life.”

Rey has been married for thirty years to Sra. Amalia. They have six children. The oldest is called Mariana; she is married and has two children. Then there are Armando and Ángeles, aged 24 and 22. They both help Rey with household expenses such as buying gas or firewood, and paying the electricity bills. When they are able, they help pay for the school expenses of Miriam (18) and Liliana (13). His daughter 20-year old Lourdes is a single mother and helps with the household chores.

Rey’s dream is to help his daughters get good jobs so they don’t have to cut short their dreams. His goal is to establish a permanent store in his house so that his wife Amalia and daughter Lourdes can help him sell the products. In the future he wants to buy a freezer for the ice cream and popsicles.

The three other members of his group are Mariana, Virginia, and Benito who are seeking loans to buy fruit and vegetables, and Mexican snacks such as corundas (type of tamal sold in Michoacán).

loans.use: to buy ice cream and popsicles

loans.name: Miguel Oswaldo

texts.es: Miguel G. de 29 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa y su pequeña hija. Miguel es un hombre trabajador y cada día se levanta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo lleno de  esperanza y alegría. Él se dedica al transporte de carga como: piedras, arena, tierra etc. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad y  se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingreso. Para él la familia lo es todo y es por ella que se esfuerza para poder darles lo que se merecen. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertirlo en su camión,  ya que por el uso se deteriora con facilidad y quiere darle un buen mantenimiento para conservarlo en las condiciones óptimas que le permitan realizar su trabajo con facilidad. Este préstamo lo utilizaría para comprar repuestos como batería, llantas y para la compra de  materiales de mantenimiento así como para resolver problemas del motor, etc. De esta forma espera seguir realizando sus actividades y continuar subsistiendo y luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su querida familia.
texts.en:
29-year old Miguel G. lives in his own house with his wife and young daughter. He is a hardworking man who gets up early every morning full of hope and joy to go to work. His job is transporting cargo such as stones, sand, earth etc. He’s been doing this work for many years and it has become his main source of income.

His family is everything to him, and it is for them that he works very hard to give them what they deserve. Miguel recently decided to seek a loan from Kiva partner Integral to spend some money on his truck which has deteriorated through extensive use. He wishes to give it a good service so that it lasts a long time in good condition. The money will be used to buy parts such as a battery, tires, and other items needed to sort out the engine problems. By doing this maintenance Miguel hopes to continue working so he can provide a better quality of life for himself and his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy parts such as a battery, tires, and other items needed to sort out the engine problems of his truck

loans.name: Monarcas Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora ella tiene varias actividades económicas dice que le gusta mucho sus trabajos y los disfruta ya que de ahí sale el dinero para sacar adelante sus tres pequeños hijos ya que es divorciada, ella se dedica hacer donas de azúcar y de chocolate para vender en su colonia y comenta que su ex esposo fue que le enseño hacer las donas y ella tiene vendiéndolas desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a vender por las noches hamburguesas fuera de su casa de lunes y sábado y ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la venta de bisutería de plata, dice que ira a surtirse a la cuidad de Taxco Guerrero que es donde dan la plata muy económica para que así ella tenga un poco mas de ganancias. Dice que desde muy pequeña sus papas le inculcaron el amor al trabajo por eso ella es muy trabajadora y responsable con sus hijos y su casa. Además hace poco junto un poco de dinero y compro dos terrenos y después los revendió y ahí tubo un poco mas de capital para comprar otro mas grande el cual esta por venderlo y con ese dinero seguir invirtiendo  en otros terrenos y con lo que saque de ganancias ella les hará una casa a sus hijos ya que donde viven es rentado. La meta que tiene para sus negocios de las hamburguesas es poner una senaduría estable en su casa para que sus clientes estén cómodos y para la venta de la bisutería quiere tener muchas clientas para poder vender pronto su mercancía y comprar más.
Las otras 10 integrantes se llaman Erika, Maria de los Ángeles, Araceli, Maria del Pilar, Marisela, Adriana, Raquel, Lucia, Marisela, Teresa ellas quieren el préstamo para invertirlo en tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  tienda de ropa para dama, panadería, lavado de autos, repostería y antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Señora Leonarda is a very hard-working and entrepeneurial woman. She has various businesses and says that she really likes her work. She enjoys it because that is how she has been able to earn money to take care of her three small children since she got divorced. She works making sugar and chocolate donuts and selling them in her town. Her ex-husband is the one who first taught her how to make donuts and she has been doing it for 4 years. 

Leonarda also works selling hamburgers at night, from Monday to Saturday. Now she is requesting a loan in order to sell silver jewelry. She is planning to go to Taxco in Guerrero to stock up on jewelry, because that is where they sell silver at a very reasonable price. She would like to begin selling jewelry in order to increase her earnings. 

Leonarda says that since she was very young, her parents imbued her with a love of work and that is why she is so hard-working, as well as responsible with her children and her home. Also, she recently put together some money to buy two pieces of land which she then resold at a higher price. With the capital from the sale, she was able to buy another larger piece of land which she is about to sell. She will continue investing in property and eventually with her earnings she will build a house for herself and her children, because the place they currently live is a rental. 

Her goal for her hamburger business is to put a permanent restaurant in her home so her clients have a comfortable place to eat. With the jewelry sales, she would like to build her clientele and be able to sell her merchandise quickly in order to buy more. 

The other 10 members are Erika, Maria de los Ángeles, Araceli, Maria del Pilar, Marisela, Adriana, Raquel, Lucia, Marisela, Teresa. They want the loan in order to invest in their businesses: a grocery store, selling cosmetics by catalog, a ladies' clothing store, a bakery, a car wash, and selling Mexican pastries and snacks.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Los Cedritos Group

texts.es:
Angelina tiene 49 años, comenta que ella no estudio pero que sabe leer y escribir ya ella sola se enseño viendo, también comenta que le gusta mas el trabajo y la realización de artesanías de barro. A ella le enseñaron a realizar las figuras y ollas sus papas ya que también era artesanos, desde hace 25 años ella y su esposo el señor Ausencio empezaron su negocio propio de la artesanía en la temporada de diciembre es cuando más vende las mariposas y las pinta como las monarca ya que cerca de su localidad esta en santuario de la mariposa monarca, también vende las ollas para hacer las piñatas en la temporada decembrina. Ellos tiene un puesto cerca de  central de autobuses de Zitacuaro, desde hace 15 años y que ahí vende sus diferentes artesanías, ellos empezaron vendiendo en la ciudad de México pero debido a que ya no dejaron poner puestos ambulantes decidieron regresarse a su localidad a vender las artesanías, ellos tienen 3 hijos de nombres Raquel que trabaja y les ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Esther de 15 años y estudia secundaria y Elsi que tiene 13 años estudiante de primaria. Comenta doña Angelina que ahorita gracias a dios le está yendo muy bien en su negocio, que si necesita el crédito para invertir y comprar lo que les hace falta para seguir vendiendo sus artesanías como pinturas de diferentes colores para decorar las artesanías, tierra, leña, barnices etc. La meta que tiene para su negocio es pedirle al gobierno municipal que le rente otro lugar de suelo donde pueda vender sus artesanías ya que donde tiene el puesto esta pequeño y ella quiere exponer más de sus artesanías.
Los otros 6 integrantes se llaman Araceli, Leticia, Maria Fernanda, Fernando, Anayeli, Ana Velia ellos invertirán el préstamo que están solicitando para la compra de insumos para elaborar artesanías de barro y en la compra de frutas y verduras para su venta.
texts.en:
Angelina, 49, comments that she never went to school but she does know how to read and write because she taught herself by watching.  She also comments that she likes work more and making crafts.  Her parents taught her how to make figures and pots since they too were artisans.  For the last 25 years she and her husband, Ausencio, started their own crafts business during the December season which is when most of the butterflies are sold; she paints them like Monarchs since the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary is nearby.  She also sells pots to make piñatas for the December season.

They have had a stand near the Zitácuaro bus terminal for the last 15 years.  She sells her various crafts there.  They started out selling in Mexico City but when street vending stalls were banned they decided to return home to sell their crafts.  They have three children: Raquel who works and helps with household expenses, Esther, 15, who is in middle school and Elsi, 13, who is in elementary school.

Angelina comments that now, thanks be to God, she’s doing very well in her business but needs the loan to be able to invest and buy what they need to continue selling crafts like different colored paints to decorate them, clay, firewood, varnish, etc.  The goal she has for her business is to ask the municipal government to rent her a space where she can sell her crafts because the space she currently uses to sell her items is very small and she wants to display more of her crafts.

The other six group members are: Araceli, Leticia, María Fernanda, Fernando, Anayeli, and Ana Velia.  They will use the loan they are requesting to buy raw materials to make clay crafts and to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
Belén ella es una persona soltera con  una Mayoría de edad, vive en coapilla estado de Chiapas México. Estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria  ya que sus  padres no tenían recursos para darle una educación.
    Ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes desde hace  diese siete años y seis  meses, en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos a salido adelante junto con su familia  que son su sobrinos.
     Nos comenta que desde muy joven su madre la enseño a  lo que es la panadería y con el tiempo comenzó a practicarlo y es así como hasta la fecha de hoy sigue trabajando y le deja buenas ganancias que es con lo que se  sostiene en sus gastos que se generan en su vida diaria.
     Lo que más desea es  que con esta actividad y el préstamo  logres se seguir trabajando hasta que dios  le siga prestando vida.
texts.en:
Belén is a single older woman who lives in Coapilla, located in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She completed up to second grade of elementary school, as her parents did not have the resources to provide her with an education.

She has worked making bread for the past 17 ½ years and says that it is going well, as she has been able to get her family ahead in life, including her nephews.

She tells us that her mother taught her to make bread when she was very young and over time, she began to practice and that is how she continues working today.  It provides her with good profits, which is what she uses to cover the expenses generated in their daily life.

What she wants most from her work and this loan is to continue working as long as God continues giving her life.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients such as oil, flour, eggs, cheese, baking powder and other items to make bread.

loans.name: Canastitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Canastito lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Tereza del Carmen  de 39 años quien se tiene un pequeño taller de costura. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años con su esfuerzo y con ayuda de los prestamos ha ido creciendo.

Ella realiza especialmente gabachas, sabanas, fundas…etc. las cuales comercializa en Managua, Masaya y en algunos colegios con las maestras, con el crédito comprar tela, hilo, seda.

Las otras integrantes son Rosa  de 52 años vende platanitos, enchiladas y frutas desde hace 40 años y Maribell  desde hace 20 años vende pan.
texts.en:
The Canastitos Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of the group members is Teresa del Carmen who is 39 years old and has a small sewing workshop. She started this business on her own eight years ago and with the help of loan, it has grown.

Specifically, she makes aprons, sheets, pillowcases, etc. which she sells in Managua, Masaya and in some high schools among the teachers. With the loan, she will buy fabric, thread and silk.

The other group members are Rosa, who is 52 years old and had sold plantains, enchiladas and fruit for 40 years, and Maribel, who has sold bread for the past 20 years.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and silk.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married and has two daughters and a son. He lives in the small town of Maliye Kopani.  Ivan is a farmer. He grows early spring vegetables and has 5,000 tomato, 40,000 pepper, and 50,000 strawberry plants in addition to 3 tons of radish. Ivan has been working in agriculture for 20 years. He has invested about 200,000 Grivnyas in this business. 

Ivan is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to repair his greenhouses and to install a drip irrigation system.  The irrigation system will cost him 2,000 Grivnyas.  He also needs to purchase seeds for 2,000 Grivnyas, farming fiber for 6,000 Grivnyas, fertilizers for 4,000 Grivnyas, as well as gasoline and oil for 1,000 Grivnyas. Ivan is hoping to meet customer demand this season and increase his income as a result.

loans.use: to buy seeds, protective plastic film, fertilizers and install a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Jenifer Lisseth

texts.es: Jenifer Lisseth de 20 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con sus dos abuelos y una prima.  Jenifer es una jovencita emprendedora y responsable en las actividades que realiza. Junto con su abuela han trabajado muy duro y han logrado establecer una tiendita dentro de su hogar, desde hace unos años Jenifer es la responsable del negocio ya que la abuela ya no puede trabajar debido a su avanzada edad. Jenifer es una joven soñadora y llena de metas. Sueña con ver su tiendita abastecida con las mercancías más demandadas por los clientes, con el objetivo de convertirse en la tienda número uno de la zona, en donde los clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. A pesar de ser muy joven es una mujer bien decidida y con muchas aspiraciones. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar diferentes artículos de tienda tales como: arroz, azúcar, café, leche, frijoles, golosinas,  bebidas, pan dulce y de más mercadería atractiva para cada uno de los clientes. Tiene la esperanza que de esta manera lograra su sueño y podrá darle a su familia una realidad diferente.
texts.en: Jenifer Lisseth is 20 years old and lives with her two grandparents and a cousin.  Jenifer is an enterprising young woman and is responsible with her work.  She has worked hard with her grandmother to open a store within their home.  For the past few years, Jenifer has been the head of the business, as her grandmother can no longer work due to her age.  Jenifer is a young dreamer and is full of goals.  She dreams of having her store stocked with the products that her customers demand most so that she becomes the number one store in the area where her customers find what they need.  Despite being so young, she is very determined and has many aspirations.  She has decided to request this loan in order to invest in her business and buy different store items such as rice, sugar, coffee, milk, beans, sweets, refreshments, pastries and other items desired by each of her customers.  She hopes that this way, she will achieve her goal and be able to provide her family with a different life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, milk, beans, sweets, refreshments, pastries and other items desired by each of her customers.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek is 62 years old and lives in Tsakhkunk village in the Sevan area with his wife.  Aghabek’s children are married and live separately from their parents. For a long time, Aghabek worked at a state-owned cattle farm as a farm worker.

Aghabek and his wife have been farming for over 18 years and they say they like that occupation very much. On their own farm they breed cows and sheep. Thanks to his farming Aghabek was able to buy a truck, which he uses to deliver fodder for his farm animals. 

Aghabek is asking from Kiva lenders a loan for 500,000 AMD, which he will use to buy 8 or 10 calves. That will allow him to expand his farm and increase his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy calves for his cattle farm

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es: Félix Alberto se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Tiene más 21 años en este negocio. Es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su actividad, por lo que tiene que levantarse todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El sueña con realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, el tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solamente 4 están a su cargo. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de redes, cuchillos, mejoras a su motor, gasolina, entre otras herramientas necesarias.
texts.en: Félix Alberto works selling seafood and has been in this business for more than 21 years.  He is a very hardworking person and enjoys his job, for which he has to get up every day at 7am and work until 6pm.  He dreams of making housing improvements and has he five children, four of whom are his dependents.  The purpose of this loan is to buy nets, knives, gasoline, and other necessary tools, as well as to make improvements to his motor.

loans.use: to buy nets, knives, and gasoline, and to make improvements to his motor.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es casada con el señor Sergio, con quien procreo  cuatro hijos  quienes ya están casados y a su responsabilidad  tiene  dos nietos que  estudian en el colegió : Sergio Rodulfo  de catorce años y José Daniel  de doce años de edad.

    El préstamo que ella solicito  lo invertía en  la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, como son: harina, huevo, aceite, queso, royal, entre otros, en esta actividad lleva  tres años y nueve meses en donde le va bien ya que con ello a estado teniendo ingresos en su hogar.

    Se inspiro en esta actividad  para que con ello pueda trabajar para tener ingresos y así poder apoyar a sus dos nietos que están estudiando, como también de las ganancias obtener para cubrir los gastos pequeños que se generan en su hogar.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda estar trabajando  así lograr ahorrar y de ellos aportar para que sus nietos sigan estudiando  y terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Señora Luisa is married to Señor Sergio with whom she engendered four children who are now married. She is responsible now for two grandchildren who are attending high school: Sergio Rodulfo who is 14 and José Daniel who is 12 years old. 

She will invest the loan she is seeking in the purchase of ingredients for making breads and pastries, such as flour, eggs, oil, cheese, and baking powder among others. She has had this business for three years and nine months and it is going well, since she has been bringing in profits for her household. 

She was inspired to start this business so she could work for profits with which to support her two grandchildren who are in school, as well as have money from the earnings to cover the small costs generated by her household. 

What she most wishes for is that with this business she would be able work and thus save money to contribute to her grandchildren's continued studies so that they may complete professional education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making breads and pastries.

loans.name: Carlos René

texts.es: Carlos René, de 50 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder atender su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto que posee en el mercado regional de la ciudad en que vive. Es un lugar muy concurrido y en especial el puesto de Don Carlos ya que siempre mantiene verduras y frutas frescas, además, los clientes lo prefieren por ser un hombre honesto y amable ya que su prioridad son las personas que demandan sus productos. El sueña con tener un puesto abastecido de las diferentes frutas y verduras pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para realizar su sueño. Debido a esto Don Carlos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar variedad de frutas como: sandias, melones, bananas, cocos, manzanas, etc. Así como variedad de verduras: papas, yuca, güisquiles, zanahorias, chiles, etc. Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera logrará obtener mejores ingresos que le permitirán tener y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos René, 50, lives in his own home along with his wife. Every day he gets up very early to be able to staff his business which consists of selling fruits and vegetables in a stall he has in a regional market in the city where he lives. It is an area that receives a lot of business, and especially Don Carlos's stall, as he always keeps fresh produce and, in addition, his customers prefer him for being an honest and pleasant man since his priority is the people who demand his products. 

He dreams of keeping a stall that is well-stocked with the different fruits and vegetables but he does not have the necessary economic resources to fulfill his dream. Because of this, Don Carlos has made the decision to seek this loan to invest in his business and be able to buy a variety of fruits such as watermelon, other melons, bananas, coconuts, apples, etc., as well as a variety of vegetables: potatoes, yucca, chayotes, carrots, chile peppers, etc. With faith in God he hopes by this means he will bring in better earnings which will allow him to have and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits such as watermelon, other melons, bananas, coconuts, apples etc. as well as a variety of vegetables: potatoes, yucca, chayotes, carrots, chile peppers etc.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina, es casada, con el señor   Emilio con quien procreo dos hijos quienes ya están casados.

    Ella se dedica a  la elaboración de panes y solicito préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración  de panes, así también en la de tacos y tamales, en donde cada actividad  unos años, y cometa que le va bien ya que con ello se ha estado apoyando  para tener ingresos  en su hogar y a sacado adelante a su pequeña familia.

    En esta actividad lo deicidio sola ya que su señora madre la en seño a laborarlo y aprendió por eso se dedica a lo mismo ya que ve que es una buena actividad que deja ingresos  y en la de antojitos lo aprendió sala  y es como ha estado  trabajando.

     Lo que más desea  es tener ingresos   para poder ahorrar, comenzar a comprar materiales para construir su taquería.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel Cristina is married to Señor Emilio with whom she engendered two children who are now married. 

She earns a living making breads and pastries and sought this loan to purchase ingredients for making the breads and pastries, as well as for making tacos and tamales. She has had each of these businesses several years and comments that it is going well since it has allowed her to bring in income for her home and support her small family.  

She decided herself to go into this business since her mother showed her how and she learned. Thus she does the same, as she sees that it is a good business that affords profits. Regarding the business of prepared foods she learned it on her own and that is how she goes about with the work. 

What she wishes for most is to make profits so that she may save and begin to buy materials for building her own taco stand.

loans.use: to purchase farm-raised chickens to sell them cut up, as well as ingredients for making breads, tamales and other prepared foods.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a son. She worked at a factory but was later downsized and forced to find new ways of providing for her family. Presently, Yelena is a small-scale entrepreneur from Pershotravensk. Yelena sells lingerie in a local market called Yuzhnyi. She owns a nice enclosed vending facility in a busy part of the market. Yelena has been in this business for six years. Her monthly income is over 14,000 Grivnyas.   

Yelena is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her assortment and purchase a variety of swimsuits for the upcoming vacation season in Ukraine. A nice selection of swimsuits at affordable prices and of good quality will boost her sales, bringing stable income to the family. Yelena is planning to add a display stand for this new type of merchandise. One of her future plans is to open a second vending location.

loans.use: to purchase assorted swimsuits for the upcoming summer season.

loans.name: Tatiana Emerida

texts.es: Tatiana Emerida,  D. 35 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su compañero D. vida y dos hijas una D. las cuales se encuentra estudiando. Durante mucho tiempo Tatiana ha trabajado para aportar un poco D. ingreso a su familia ya que su sueño es que sus hijas tengan una realidad diferente a la D. ella. Posee un puesto en el mercado Municipal del Municipio en que resiD.. Su negocio consiste en la venta D. piñatas y recuerdos usados en fiestas y ocasiones especiales. Sus productos son muy demandados ya que siempre cuanta con variedad, calidad y el mejor precio. Además es muy conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Últimamente ha notado que su clientela ha aumentado por lo que sus productos son muy demandados. Debido a esto ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en las materias primas necesarias para mantener abastecido el negocio y satisfacer la demanda D. los clientes. El crédito lo invertiría en: papel, alambre, pega, variedad D. recuerdos y otros artículos que ella ofrece en algunas ocasiones. Confía en Dios que esto le va a traer buenos resultados y logrará dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Tatiana Emerida, 35, lives in her own home with her life partner and 2 daughters, one of whom is in school.  For a long time Tatiana has worked to contribute to the family's income, since her dream is for her daughters to have a better life.  She has a stall in the municipal market in the town where she lives.  She has a business selling  piñatas and keepsakes used for parties and special occasions.  There is a lot of demand for her products, since she always has a variety of high quality products at the best price.  In addition, she is well known in her neighborhood for being a hardworking and responsible woman.  Lately she has noticed that her customer base has increased, since her products are very much in demand.  Because of this, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the raw materials she needs to keep her business well-supplied so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.  She will invest the proceeds of this loan in: paper, wire, glue and a variety of keepsakes and other items that she occasionally offers her customers.  She trusts in God that this will bring her good results, and that she will be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paper, wire, glue, and a variety of keepsakes and other items

loans.name: Las Viejas Amigas Group

texts.es: La señora Justa  es la presidenta D. la banca D. emprendimiento las viejas amigas ella formo el grupo con señoras que viven por la zona la señora es cuidadora D. la casa donD. habita y tiene un pequeño taller D. zapatería en el que su esposo trabaja, y también  ella teje buzos y chompas en el invierno, el trabajo D. ella y D. su esposo ella lo venD. D. forma ambulante por las ferias D. la ciudad D. el alto, sobre todo en las tardes venD. en la  ceja D. el Alto un lugar muy concurrido D. la ciudad, con el dinero del credito comprara lana y material para tejer ya que ella tambien realiza trabajos a pedido, es una señora muy responsable, ella tiene el sueño D. darles a sus hijos un techo propio por lo cual trabaja sin descanso para poder comprar su terrenito y poder hacer construir su casita, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Justa leads the group "las viejas amigas" which has members from the same region.  Justa works at home and has a small workshop where her husband works making and repairing shoes.  She also sews woven wraps and shawls, which she sells in local markets, including Ceja D. el Alto, one of the city's largest.  With this credit, she will buy wool and materiel for sewing, to satisfy growing demand for custom garments.  Justa is grateful for the access to credit and hopes eventually to proviD. for her children and to buy a small plot of land to constuct her own home.

loans.use: to buy wool and materials for sewing shawls

loans.name: Rincón De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Rincon de la Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias señoras de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, con el objetivo de sentirse utiles a si mismas y a su familia, cada una cuenta con sus pequeños emprendimientos, son personas muy optimistas y tratan por todos los medios de cumplir con sus compromisos con ellas mismas ya que de eso depende el progreso. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas de ropa interior, ropas, también son modistas.
La señora Esmilda, por ejemplo, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en materiales para su negocio, pues ella es modista y confecciona ropas de acuerdo al pedido de sus numerosos clientes, y utilizará el dinero para mejorar sus servicios, de esta forma Esmilda pretende seguir adelante y ayudar a su familia, siempre cooperando activamente con el comité.
texts.en:
The “Rincón de la Esperanza” (Corner of Hope) was formed thanks to the coming together of several women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso with the goal of feeling useful to themselves and their families.  Each of them has her own small enterprise.  They are very optimistic people who try by all means possible to keep their commitments to themselves since this is what progress depends on.  All the group members carry out independent activities like: underwear sales, clothing sales and they are also dressmakers.

Esmilda, for example, is asking for the loan to buy supplies for her business.  She’s a Dressmaker and makes clothes to order for her numerous customers.  She will use the loan to improve her service.  Esmilda intends to continue forward helping her family while always actively cooperating with the committee.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a small market entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov. She sells small fancy goods, i.e. hair clips, combs, ponios, headbands, hair pins and imitation jewelry, in the central marketplace of her hometown. Nataliya started the business 12 years ago. She makes about 4,000 Grivnyas of net profit each month. 

Nataliya is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase better quality merchandise and attract more customers to her vending kiosk. She is a widow and thus has to provide for herself. Nataliya is hoping to see her business grow and expand in the future through the opening of additional vending locations in Belaya Tserkov.

loans.use: to purchase better quality merchandise.

loans.name: Alvaro Eliecer

texts.es: Álvaro Eliecer, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son sus prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la  asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con la propiedad y la experiencia en este cultivo y lo que hará es asistirlo para así en la próxima cosecha que está por venir tener un alza en la producción y en la calidad. El lo que pretende es generar ganancias para seguir adelante con su café y también así ofrecerles a sus hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Álvaro Eliecer is 46 married and lives with his 4 children and wife. With this credit, he plans to buy fertilizer and other products to care for his coffee plantation. He has both the property and the necessary experience in raising coffee, and will use the needed products to increase his crop yield.  With better profits, he hopes to provide for his family's needs and assure a better quality of life in the future.  This is the second credit Alvaro has received from FUDECOSUR. Rather than seek credit from state-owned banks, he feels that FUDECOSUR offers him better terms of credit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La señora María Neófita, vive en unión libre con  el señor  Zenaido, con quien procreo   cinco hijos: Patricia Yurídia de diesi seis años, Britania Marisol  de trece años de trece años, Rocío de siete años,  Enrique Daniel de cuatro años y Anderson de  dos años.

    Ella se dedica a la  sastrería  y con esta actividad lleva siete años, en donde nos comenta que le va bien y solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de materiales  que utiliza en la  elaboración de las ropas, como son: botones, encajes, cierres, hilos, entre otros,   así con ellos podrá comprar mejor calidad y sus clientes estarán satisfechos con su trabajo que realiza.

      Su inspiración  comenzó por su  que su mama la enseño a la costura y cuando estudio la secundaria entro en el taller de corte y confección la cual la apoyo mucho para mejorar su calidad de trabajo, comenta que con esta actividad  se apoya mucho ya que  le deja un mejor ingresos en su hogar.

     Su más  grande deseo es que con esta actividad, pueda tener ahorro, para que con ello  logres salir adelante y apoye también a sus hijos que sigan estudiando.

    Quienes integra  en el grupo son las  señora: Reinalda, quien se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para salir a venderlo en la misma localidad, Lorena, en la compra  de cosméticos, como son: maquillaje, labiales, tintes, entre otros, María Magdalena, se dedica a comprar frutas y verduras para venderlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
María Neófita lives with her partner Zenaido, with whom she has five children: Patricia Yurídia, sixteen years old, Britania Marisol, thirteen years old, Rocío, seven years old, Enrique Daniel, four years old, and Anderson, who is two.

She has been a seamstress for seven years.  She tells us it is going well for her.  She is asking for the loan to purchase materials that she uses to make clothing, such as buttons, lace, closures, and thread, among other items.  She will be able to buy better quality, and her clients will be satisfied with the work that she does.

Her inspiration started because her mother taught her to sew.  When she was in secondary school, she started in a dressmaking workshop, which supported her a lot in improving the quality of her work.  She notes that this activity gives her a lot of support, since it brings in better earnings for her household.

Her greatest desire is that with this activity, she can save some money, so that with it she can succeed in moving forward and also in supporting her children, who are still in school.

The members of the group are: Reinalda, who makes tamales in order to sell them in her town; Lorena, who buys cosmetics such as makeup, lipstick, hair dye, among others; and María Magdalena, who buys fruits and vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as buttons, thread, and closures, among others, to make clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia,  D. 52 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero D. vida, dos hijos y su pequeña nieta. Como toda mujer emprendedora Rosa no quiso ser la excepción. Dentro D. su hogar ha instalado un pequeño negocio  el cual consiste en la venta D. productos personales como: lociones, variedad D. cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje, esmaltes, champo, etc. A pesar D. su avanzada edad no deja D. trabajar y soñar. Quiere surtir su negocio para ofrecer  mejor variedad D. productos a sus clientes. Para esto necesita contar con los recursos económicos necesarios que le permitan realizar su sueño, es por esta razón que solicita el préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar diferentes artículos como diferente tipos y marcas D.: lociones tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas para manos, cremas para el cabello, champo, maquillaje, esmaltes, jabón, etc. Con lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Lidia, 52 years old, lives in her own home with her partner, two children, and her small granddaughter.  Like all entrepreneurial women, Rosa refused to be the exception.  In her home, she has installed a small business which consists of the sale of personal products such as lotions, a variety of creams, deodorants, makeup, nail polish, shampoo, etc.  Despite her advanced age, she hasn't stopped working or dreaming.  She wants to stock her business in order to offer a better variety of products to her customers.  For this, she needs to rely on the necessary economic resources that will allow her to realize her dream.  That is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL so she can buy different types and brands of lotions for men and women, hand creams, hair creams, shampoo, makeup, nail polish, soap, etc.  With the loan, she hopes to earn more money, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions for men and women, hand cream, hair cream, shampoo, makeup, nail polish, soap, etc.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
L. señora L. señora CarmeL., vive en unión libre con el señor  Martín y con quien lleva trece años D. casado y tienen dos hijos Hugo Martín D. doce años D. edad en sexto D. primaria y Roxana cristel  D. cinco años en tercero D. preescolar.

    ElL. es las segunda vez que solicita el préstamo y es para invertirlo en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su negocio D. papelería, como son: cuadernos, lápices, sacapuntas, borradores, entre otros en donD. lleva  un año y seis meses y cementa que le va bien ya que con ellos está saliendo  adelante su familia.

    Comenta que cuando  era soltera elL. trabajo en una papelería y cuando se caso se tuvo que venir a vivir por este rumbo con su esposo, ya que elL. es originaria D. ostuacán y dejo D. trabajan, pero hace un  año decidió poner su propio negocio  y que mejor que una papelería ya que donD. elL. vive ahora no hay papelería cerca.

    Su más granD. sueño es que con el préstamo y su negocio pueda salir adelante y así  día con día su actividad crezca para apoyar a su hijo que esta estudiando.

     Así también están las  señoras Rosalinda: quien se dedica  a L. compra y venta D. ropas, doña María Vitalina quien se dedica a L. compra y venta  D. cosméticos por catalogo, L. señora Silvina, invierte el préstamo en L. compra D. hojas D. guineo, pinol y frutas D. L. región para luego venderlo en L. ciudad D. TuxtL., Teresa, en L. compra y venta  D. ropas y por último L. señora Hilda quien invierte el préstamo en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Señora CarmeL. cohabits with Señor Martín with whom she has been for thirteen years and they have two children, Hugo who is twelve and attends the sixth graD., and Roxana Cristel who is five and is in preschool. 

This is her second time seeking a loan and it is for investing in the purchase of merchandise to stock her stationery business, such as: notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, and erasers, among other items. She has had the business for a year and a half and comments that it is going well since by it she has been able to support her family. 

She comments that when she was single she worked in a stationery store and when she got married she had to come to live in this area with her husband, since originally she is from Ostuacán, and she stopped working. However, a year ago she decided to start her own business and what better than a stationery shop since there is not another one nearby where she lives now. 

Her greatest dream is that, with the loan and her business she would get ahead and thus, day by day, her business would grow in order for her to be able to support her son who is in school. 

In addition there are Señora Rosalinda who sells clothing, Doña María who sells cosmetics by catalog, Ms. Silvina who invests the loan in the purchase of banana leaves, pinol [a toasted corn flour and herb mixture], and regional fruits for sale in the city of TuxtL., Teresa who sells clothing, and finally, Hilda who will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for stocking their stationery shop.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two grown children. She lives and runs her business in a small town close to Kamenka. Oksana rents a facility that serves as a grocery store. There are a little over 100 houses in town, and Oksana’s store is the only one in this town. She sells food items, as well as household chemicals and other small items. Oksana worked as a salesperson in the store for 22 years. She decided to try her luck as a private entrepreneur four years ago and rented the facility for that purpose. Currently, she has about 25,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. Her net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Oksana is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase a batch of goods wholesale, i.e. tea, coffee, noodles, flour, sugar, etc. One of her long-term plans is to purchase the facility she is renting at the moment and own it.

loans.use: to purchase tea, coffee, noodles, flour and sugar.

loans.name: El Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo que presento se llama "El Cerrito", el grupo se encuentra en la comunidad de "San Miguel La Labor", aquí en la comunidad hay muchas necesidades y es donde hay mayor pobreza, la gente necesita tener trabajo, algo a que dedicarse para ganar dinero, los hombres por lo regular no tienen un trabajo y solo se dedican a ser albañiles y las mujeres se casan muy chicas, este grupo esta cerca de las oficinas de vision mundial, y los hijos de las señoras estan patrocinados por vision mundial, el grupo lo integran 8 mujeres y 1 hombre, El señor Alfredo es el representante de este grupo y el nos comenta como le va con su negocio.
Don Alfredo se dedica a la ganaderia, cria y engorda de borregos, tiene 20 años dedicandose al negocio de los animales y lo mas dificil ha sido que los animales se enfermen, ya que eso representa mucho gasto para poder salvar la vida de un borrego, por ahorita don Alfredo nos dice que no ha vuelto pasar por esos percanses y que al comprarlos el solo quiere que tengan crias y se espera hasta que la cria crezca para poderlos vender y no dejar que los borregos se hagan grandes de edad. El prestamo va beneficiar mucho a la familia del señor Alfredo porque ya vendiendo el borrego hay una ganancia y eso ayuda para que pueda llevar comida a su casa, Las metas que tiene en mente son no darse por vencido para que le vaya mejor e ir luchando para que sus hijos les toque una mejor vida y una mejor educación, mejores oportunidades de trabajo y sentirse orgulloso de sus hijos, don Alfredo tiene 8 hijos, los hijos que dependen de el son solo 2, pero el quiere que sigan la escuela y no la dejen por falta de dinero, el señor Alfredo va cumplir 18 años de casado, vive en casa propia y su esposa se dedica al hogar. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son las siguentes personas:
1.-Tomasa, ella se dedica a criar borregos
2.-Maria Guadalupe, se dedica a criar borregos
3.-Francisca, se dedica a criar borregos
4.-Natalia, se dedica a criar borregos y puercos
5.-Victoria, se dedica a criar borregos
6.-Manuela, se dedica a criar borregos y pollos
7.-Marcela, se dedica a criar pollos y guajolotes
8.-Leticia, se dedica a cuidar puercos.
texts.en:
The following group is called "El Cerrito" [The Little Hill], located in the community of San Miguel La Labor. Here in the community there are many needs and a great deal of poverty. The people need work, something to which they may apply themselves in order to earn some money. The men in general do not have work and only offer themselves as construction workers. The women get married very young. This group is near the offices of Vision Mundial [World Vision] and the women's children are sponsored by Vision Mundial. The group is made up of eight women and one man. 

Señor Alfredo is the group's representative and tells us how things are going in his business. Don Alfredo earns a living raising livestock, he raises and fattens sheep. He has been in the business for twenty years and the most difficult aspect has been when the animals get sick as that represents quite a bit of expense to be able to save the life of a sheep. For now Don Alfredo tells us, he has not had to deal with those mishaps, and when he buys them he only hopes they will bear young and he waits until the lambs are grown to be able to sell them and does not let the sheep get very large. The loan will be of great benefit to Señor Alfredo's family since there is a profit when selling the sheep and that helps him be able to bring home food to his family. 

The goals he has in mind are not to give up so that things may get getter and to keep struggling so that his children may have a better life and a better education, better work opportunities and to feel proud of his children. Don Alfredo has eight children of whom only two depend on him, but he wants them to stay in school and not leave school on account of no money. Señor Alfredo will soon celebrate his 18th wedding anniversary. He lives in his own home and his wife works in the home. 

The other members of the group are the following persons: 

1.-Tomsa, she raises sheep
2.-Maria Guadalupe, she raises sheep
3.-Francisca, she raises sheep
4.-Natalia, she raises sheep and pigs
5.-Victoria, she raises sheep
6.-Manuela, she raises sheep and chickens
7.-Marcela, she raises chicken and turkeys
8.-Leticia, she raises pigs.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Harold Enrique él posee un taxi. Brinda este servicio desde hace 16 años, el ha logrado aprender mucho en este negocio, a pesar de los diferentes problemas que ha enfrentado como es el tiempo ya que tiene dedicarse a su hijo que tiene 10 años de edad. Este crédito es para la compra llantas, caja de cambios, mantenimiento, vidrios entre otros. Harold tiene muchas necesidades pero sabe cómo educar a su hijo y enseñarles cosas de la vida para que sepa cómo ganarse la vida.
texts.en: Señor Harold Enrique is the owner of a taxi. He has offered this service for sixteen years. He has been able to learn a lot about this business, in spite of the various problems he has faced such as time, since he has had to raise his son who is ten years old. This loan is for the purchase of tires, a gear box, maintenance and window glass among other things. Harold has many needs, but he knows how to raise his son and teach him things so that he may know how to earn a living.

loans.use: to purchase tires, a gear box, maintenance and replacement glass, among other items.

loans.name: José Martín

texts.es: José Martín, habita en casa propia con su esposa, dos hijas y cuatro hijos. En un  hombre lleno de energía y sobre todo emprendedor. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado para dar a su familia una vida con lo suficiente para vivir dignamente. Posee una tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad. Para Don José lo más importante son los clientes  por  lo que siempre trata de complacerlos en lo que puede y es por esta razón es que se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas y cada vez lo prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de abastecer su negocio con variedad de mercadería de tienda para siempre estar un paso adelante de la competencia. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito y poder comprar variedad de artículos tales como: huevos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, pan dulce, café, bebidas, golosinas, detergente, papel higiénico, y de más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes.  De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que es lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
