José Martín lives in his own home with his wife, two daughters and four sons. He is a man who is full of energy and, above all, enterprising. His whole life he has worked in order to provide enough for his family so that they may live a life with dignity. He owns a shop in his place of residence in which he offers a diversity of basic staples. The most important thing to Don José are the customers so he always tries to keep them happy as best he can, which is why he has gained the trust of many and they prefer him more and more. 

He has made the decision to supply his business with a variety of shop merchandise in order to always be a step ahead of the competition. For that reason he decided to seek this loan so he may buy a variety of items such as eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, pastries, coffee, drinks, candy, detergent, toilet paper, and other items that may be attractive to the customers. In this way he hopes to improve his standard of living and that of his family which is the most important thing to him.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, pastries, coffee, drinks, candy, detergent, toilet paper, and other items that may be desirable to the customers.

loans.name: Las Piñitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia tiene 28 años D. edad ella es originaria D. la localidad llamada Lindero, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 13 años y dice que la puso para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos del hogar ya que son muy grandes D. edad y para que no trabajen ella les ayuda por que su mama es un gran apoyo para ella ya que Cecilia es madre soltera y sus mama le ayuda a cuidar a su hija D. 7 años D. edad la cual estudia el segundo año D. primaria. Ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra D. artículos para surtir su negocio como jabón, azúcar, aceite, fríjol, sardinas, chiles, atún etc. ella surte sus productos en la población D. Zitacuaro en diferentes tiendas para que al venderlos ella le queD. algo D. ganancia. Ella esta muy agradecida por el préstamo ya que su tienda la tendrá muy bien surtida, la meta que tiene para el negocio es tener muy bien surtido para que la gente no se traslaD. a otras localidades a comprar y que le compren a ella los artículos D. primera necesidad.
Los otros tres integrantes del grupo son Ma Ignacia, Artura y Cintya ellos invertiran sus prestamos uno D. ellos en la compra D. un becerro para criarlo y ponerlo en engorda para el trabajo en el campo, y los otros dos integrantes compraran borregos para criarlos y despues venderlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Señora Cecilia, 28, is from the town called Lindero. She has had a grocery store for thirteen years and says that she started it to be able to help her mom and dad with household expenses since they are now quite old, and so they will not have to work, she helps them, since her mother is a great support to her. Cecilia is a single mother and her mom helps her care for her seven-year-old daughter who is in the second graD.. She is asking for a loan from the financial institution in order to stock her business with soap, sugar, oil, beans, sardines, chile peppers, tuna fish, etc. She acquires her products in the population center of Zitacuaro in various shops so that, upon selling them, she may keep a bit of profit. She is very grateful for the loan since she will have a very well-stocked store. Her goal for her shop is to have it very well-stocked so that people may not switch to other locations to shop and that they would buy from her their basic staples. 

The other three group members are Ma Ignacia, Arturo and Cintya. One of them will invest his/her loan in the purchase of a sheep to raise and fatten to work in the fields, and the other two members will buy sheep to raise for sale in their town.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with soap, sugar, oil, beans, sardines, chile peppers, tuna fish, etc.

loans.name: Chilamate Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chilamate II está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Leila de 40 años quien desde joven se dedica a la costura ya que su madre era costurera ella aprendió el negocio y cuando se independizo puso su taller.
Ella invertirá el crédito en materiales (tela, hilo…etc.) y su meta es tener un gran taller.
Las otras integrantes son Nereida de 36 años realiza delantales desde hace 5 años y Isolda también se dedica a realizar delantales.
texts.en:
The group Chilamate II is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women from Masaya. The group's coordinator is Señora Leila, 40, who has worked since she was very young in dress-making since her mother was a tailor. She learned the business and when she became independent she set up her workshop. 

She will invest the loan in materials (cloth, thread, etc.) and her goal is to have a large workshop. 

The other members are Nereida, 36, who has made aprons for five years, and Isolda who also earns a living making aprons.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Elba Eugenia

texts.es: Elba Eugenia, de 26 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su madre y su pequeño hijo que se encuentra cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Elba es una mujer emprendedora, se dedica en su misma casa a la venta de bebidas heladas tales como jugos y variedad de licuados. Sus bebidas son muy demandadas ya que siempre llevan un toque especial que hace que cada cliente regrese por otro jugo o licuado. Últimamente ha visto florecer su negocio y muchas veces la materia prima no le alcanza para satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes. Pero como Elba es una mujer muy trabajadora y creativa no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad y ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para poder satisfacer la necesidad de todos sus clientes y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en  materia prima como: frutas, azúcar, leche, desechables, agua, jugos, etc. Tiene la confianza que de esta manera lograra incrementar sus ventas y podrá tener acceso a mejores de ingresos que le lleven a mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elba Eugenia is 26 years old.  She lives in her own home with her mother and her young son who is in his first years of school.  Elba is an entrepreneurial woman who sells chilled drinks from her home such as juice and smoothies.  Her drinks are very much in demand since she always adds a special touch which means that every customer comes back for another juice or smoothie. 

Lately, Elba has seen her business flourish but often her supplies do not stretch far enough to fulfil the demand she has from all her customers.  Elba is a very hard-working and creative woman who doesn't want to let this opportunity pass her by.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL so that she could satisfy her customer demand and thereby improve her quality of life.

Elba will invest the loan that she has requested in buying supplies such as fruit, sugar, milk, disposable cups, water, juice, etc.  She is confident that she will manage to increase her sales and make better income which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruit, sugar, milk, disposable cups, water, juice, etc.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has a daughter, Darya. She lives in Zaporozhye. 

Svetlana sells women’s lingerie in a local market called "Krytyi" ("Covered"). She offers her merchandise at reasonable prices, which attracts customers to her vending location. Svetlana has been in the market for 11 years. She has invested about 65,000 UAH in merchandise. Her net profit amounts to 8,000 UAH a month. 

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 13,000 UAH to purchase seasonal merchandise for her kiosk. She is planning to stock seasonal tank tops, tube tops and underwear. Svetlana is hoping to expand her business and open a new vending location in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase women’s lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis, tiene la edad de 56 años, está casado  y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son su prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra del abono para la fertilización de su cafetal. El cuanta con el terreno sembrado y en producción. El quiere aumentar la cosecha este año por lo cual lo asistirá de esa manera. El quiere seguir creciendo como caficultor y fortalecer su proyecto aun mas cada día para llegar a ser un buen caficultor de la zona y a su vez generar las ganancias para su bienestar familiar. 

Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexis is 56 years old and married.  He lives with his son and wife who are his main priorities in life.  He intends to use this loan to buy manure with which to fertilize his coffee plantation.  He has land which is currently sown and producing crops.  Alexis would like to increase his harvest this year and this will help him to do that.  He would like to continue growing as a coffee farmer and continually strengthen his project of becoming a good regional coffee producer.  He would also like to make good profits for the well-being of his family.

This is the first loan that Alexis has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any prior loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 43 años, vive en compañía de su hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, sus padres le enseñaron ambas actividades y hoy se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Los extensos capos que posee le fueron heredados por parte de sus padres, ahí siembra maíz, papa entre otros productos, y luego de varios meses, espera con ansias la cosecha, por que sabe que estos productos una vez vendidos podrán obtener las ganancias que espera y recuperar la inversión. Adicionalmente cría ovejas, burro y vacas, consideradas como capital de trabajo, y en varias oportunidades le ha salvado de apuros económicos. Por otro lado manifiesta, que también se dedica al tejido de manera artesanal, y que son vendidas estas prendas en algún mercado de su ciudad, por lo que se genera ingresos extras para la economía de su familia. Pero su mayor prioridad es incrementar su capital de trabajo, por lo que espera comprar animales de buena raza, ya que lo considera más rentables. Es su tercer crédito con MFP,  considera que ser parte de su banco comunal es una buena experiencia que le permite crecer como persona sobre todo en el aspecto de distribuir bien su presupuesto por lo que esta agradecida y comprometida en seguir  siendo responsable en sus pagos para este nuevo ciclo
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: Alejandra is 43 years old and she lives with her son in a house of her own. She has dedicated herself to agriculture and farming since her childhood. Her parents taught her both businesses and today it has become her primary source of income. The extensive farm land that she owns was inherited by her parents. She cultivates corn and potatoes and other products. She anxiously waits several months for the harvest because she knows that the sale of these products will help her to recover her investment and to earn a profit.  She also raises sheep, donkeys, and cows. They are considered as working capital and in various occasions it has helped her out of some financial difficulties. Additionally she is also an artisan who knits items that are sold at markets in the city. This generates an extra income for her family. But her greatest priority is to increase her working capital with the purchase of a good breed of livestock, which is more profitable. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She considers that being part of her communal bank is a positive experience because it helps her grow as a person and above all it helps her adequately distribute her loan. She is thankful and she is committed to continue to be responsible with her payments, during this, her ninth loan cycle. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Georgette Dédé

texts.fr: Mère au foyer de trois enfants, Madame vend des produits de premières nécessités (sardines, sucre, huile végétale, lait…) et des liqueurs depuis 4 ans à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle à 48 ans  et partage les charges familiales  avec son conjoint depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité.
texts.en: Georgette is a mother of three, and has been selling everyday staple items (sardines, sugar, vegetable oil and milk etc) and alcoholic drinks from Lomé for the past four years. She sources her goods from the Lomé market. She is 48 years old and works so that she can help her partner to see to the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase everyday items

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her late 30s, is married and has five children who are still going to school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's fifth motisha loan from Tujijenge. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock and has paid back all the loans successfully. 

She wishes for a loan to again increase the fruits and vegetables stock. 

Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group, "Uvumilivu," which has a total of 13 members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwajuma is in the middle with a light blue dress.

loans.use: To increase the stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: G.s. Bendicion Y Gloria Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Bendición Y Gloria está conformado por Maria Alejandra y Mirna Del Pilar. Maria Alejandra se dedica a la venta de ropa, es una persona muy inteligente ya que siempre está demostrando interés con sus clientes de lo que ellos le solicitan. Ella sabe que tiene que salir a vender todos los días para brindarles el pan de cada día a sus dos hijos que están a su cargo. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas, entre otros productos.
texts.en: The 'Bendición y Gloria' (Blessing and Glory) community bank is made up of María Alejandra and Mirna Del Pilar.  María Alejandra sells clothes.  She is a very intelligent person as she always shows interest in her customers and what they are requesting.  She knows that she must go out and sell her products every day in order to provide for her two children who are in her care.  She will use this loan to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and other products.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Ddmashen village, an area of Sevan, where he has his own farm. On that farm he grows potatoes and breeds farm animals such as cows, calves, sheep, pigs and chickens. Thanks to his farming profit, Armen supports his big family, which consists of his parents, his wife and his three children.
 
Armen is 34 years old and he has been engaged in farming for over 12 years. 

This is his second loan from Nor Horizon, and now he needs a 600,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans,  4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Boumoutou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, de savon, de gâteaux et d’oignon.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
La cliente KIATOU  compte acheter de l’arachide avec les grossistes de Fana et les revendeurs du village. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married, are of an average age of 33, have four children each and live in large extended families in the village of Boumoutou  in the municipality of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family and friends, and sell peanuts, soap, cakes and onions for a living. This is the first loan that they have sought. 
Kiatou is seeking to purchase peanuts from the wholesalers of Fana and the village. She sells her goods in the village for cash and credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 5,000 CFA which she will use to pay the loan interest and for social occasions, and the rest will be reinvested into the business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Cristina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristina lo conforman cinco mujeres trabajadora y esforzadas ellas son Miriam Cristina, Johana Liseth , María Cristina, Yamileth  y Martha Ligia. La coordinadora del grupo es Miriam Cristina  quien es comerciante de tiste, pozol y tamales rellenos desde hace 15 años. Ella inicio su negocio con unos pocos tamales  y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio.

Ella tiene 5 hijos  de los cuales solo uno es menor de edad.

Las otras integrantes Johana Liseth  se dedica a la venta de comida como chanco con yuca, pollo y carne asada desde hace 7 años, María Cristina  desde hace 8 años vende ropa, Yamileth de 38 años tiene una mini pulpería desde hace 5 años y Martha Ligia tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The Cristina group is made up of five hard-working women: Miriam Cristina, Johana Liseth, María Cristina, Yamileth and Martha Ligia.  The group's coordinator is Miriam Cristina who sells tiste and pozol (both types of drink) and stuffed tamales.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She started out selling just a few tamales and gradually grew the business.  She has five children, four of whom are grown up.

The other members of the group are Johana Liseth, who has been selling meals such as pork with cassava, chicken and roast meat for seven years; María Cristina, who has been selling clothes for eight years; 38 year-old Yamileth, who has owned a small grocery store for five years, and Martha Ligia who has owned a grocery store for ten years.

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Rose est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Roger et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Depuis huit ans, Rose vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Rose  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Rose vend de façon ambulante, de la bouillie de maïs et de la bouillie de tapioca, accompagnée d’arachide grillée. Rose s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rose sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Rose was born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to a mechanic called Roger and has three children in her care, all of whom attend school. Rose has lived with her husband and children for eight years, and the couple see to the family's needs together. Rose did not go to school. In order to meet the family's needs, Rose sells corn and 'tapioca' (cassava) broth, with grilled peanuts. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to boost her business and to better meet her customers' needs she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. She successfully repaid her first two loans.

loans.use: To purchase corn, 'tapioca' and peanuts

loans.name: Maweza Group

texts.en:
Richard, who is in his mid 60s, is married and has five grown children. Only one is still schooling. 

He has a general store that he has been running for five years now. He works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Richard's second motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loan to fill in the missing stock at the store and has paid back his loan successfully. He wishes for a loan to increase the general store inventory. His dream is to one day open another general store.

Richard will share this loan with his loan group, "Mawela," which has a total of six members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Richard is first on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Edy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su suegra. Hace más de 11 años se dedica a elaborar telares artesanales en casa de su madre, lugar donde tiene un taller. Ella es muy exigente en su trabajo, pone todo su empeño para obtener una prenda de calidad, a fin de que su clientela se sienta satisfecha del servicio que le solicitaron. Actualmente hace telares de pequeñas cintas que se utilizan como accesorios en los trajes típicos de su zona, de esta manera logra tener ingresos para su hogar. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la agricultura y  crianza de animales, ambos obtiene ingresos que le ayudan en la manutención de su familia. Su gran deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y modernizar sus herramientas de trabajo. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, tiene tranquilidad de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana de diversas calidades y colores y también renovar su maquina telar
texts.en:
Edy, 31, lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house.  For over 11 years she’s been weaving textiles in her mother’s house where she has a workshop.  She is very exacting with her work and puts all her efforts into obtaining a quality item so that her customers will be satisfied with the service they requested.

She’s currently weaving small strips that are used as accessories on the traditional costumes in her area; this is how she earns income for her household.  In addition to this activity, she also farms and raises animals; both activities provide support for her family.  Her great wish is to improve and modernize her work tools.

This is loan #3 with MFP.  She has the peace of mind of knowing that she can count on financial support from her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive.  

She thanks all those who will fund the requested loan which will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy wool in a variety of qualities and colors and also to repair her loom.

loans.use: to buy wool and to have her loom repaired.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de six femmes, toutes mariées,  qui ont en moyenne 38 ans,  3 enfants et  qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dinkoro, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des articles divers de boutique.                                                                        
La cliente LALA compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs du marché de fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of six women, all married, who are on average 38 years old with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of N’Dinkoro, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They got to know each other through family, neighbors and friends. They retail condiments and various grocery articles.
The women of the Benkadi group are requesting their first solidarity loan, to be used to purchase condiments and various grocery articles.
One of the clients, LALA, is planning on purchasing condiments from the resellers on the Fana market. She sells in the village, for cash or credit, to a clientele comprising men and women.
She foresees an average monthly benefit of 20,000 CFA, which will be used to pay back the loan and pay her contribution to social ceremonies, with the remainder to be reinvested in her retail activity.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Asunción Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Carmen  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 39 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras hace 13 años inicio vendiendo cosechas de jocotes, mangos, aguacates según la temporada. En la actualidad ella vende de todo lo que es verduras y frutas en lo que invertirá el crédito  y cuenta con dos trabajadores.

Asunción tiene seis hijos de 20, 18, 15, 11, 4 y 2 años los cuales estudian menos la menor.
texts.en:
Asunción del Carmen is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman of 39 who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 13 years.  She started out selling harvests of jocotes (a native fruit), mangos and avocados, according to the season.  She currently sells all types of fruit and vegetables and this is what she will spend her loan money on.  She has two employees.

Asunción has six children aged 20, 18, 15, 11, 4 and 2.  They are all in school except the youngest.

loans.use: to buy harvests of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento " LUNA  " se encuentra en su segundo ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8  personas en la cual 6 son mujeres y dos varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida,  promotora  de cosméticos , venta  de ropa  ,  panadería, venta de cuadros, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Aida es la presidenta del banco, se dedica a la panadería ya lleva en esta actividad varios años, vive en casa alquilada  hace 3  años, se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para la elaboración de pan y después lo comercializa entregando a tiendas del barrio ella es muy conocida por las vecinas es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan como harina, manteca levadura, etc., su deseo de la Sra. Aida es la de comprarse su casita propia y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “LUNA” (Moon) communal bank is in its second cycle within the Institution.  It has 8 members, 6 women and 2 men.  Among their activities are: food sales, cosmetics sales, clothing sales, bakery, picture sales.  They are all from the Plan 3000 zone.  The group formed through the initiative of three members.

Aida is bank President.  She has had a bakery for several years.  She’s lived in a leased house for the last three years.  She rises very early in the morning to bake bread which she later sells to neighborhood stores.  She is very well known by her neighbors because of her kindness and hard work.

She will use the money from the loan to buy baking supplies like flour, lard, yeast, etc.  Aida’s wish is to buy her own little house to provide her family with more comfort. She is grateful for the support the institution has provided her.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es casado, su esposa trabaja como afanadora, sus hijos estudian y que se preparen es su mayor prioridad. Sus planes mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda poco a poco. Trabaja como operador de maquinas desde hace un tiempo. Agradece a la financiera por el préstamo ya que requiere cambiar el techo de la casa antes de los tiempos de lluvia. Comprara materiales como laminas de zinc, perlines, golosa, bloques, cemento, arena y piedrines entre otros materiales ya que sus planes es cambiar el techo y levantarlo un poco más. Obtener mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Miguel is married. His wife works and his children study. Miguel's main priority is that his children get an education. He plans to improve the infrastructure of his house little by little. Miguel has worked as a machine operator for a long time. He is grateful for the loan because he needs to get a new roof before the rainy season. He will buy materials like sheets of zinc, beams, bolts, blocks, cement, sand and bricks. His plan is to change his roof and raise it a little higher. His goal is to have a more secure house.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new roof

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dinkoro, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, de céréales, des savons et des articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’ arachide, des céréales, des savons et des articles divers  de boutique.                                                                        
NANA compte acheter des graines d’arachide avec les revendeurs du village et le plus souvent au marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group, all married, average 31 years of age and 3 children each, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of N'Dinkoro, Fana subprefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell groundnuts, grains, soap and miscellaneous boutique items.

The women of the Djekafo group are on their first group loan, which will be used to buy groundnuts, grains, soap and miscellaneous boutique items.
                                                                                                                              
Nana plans to buy groundnuts with the village retailers and most often at the market in Fana. She makes her sales in the village, for cash and on credit, to a group of customers made up of both men and women.

Nana expects to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be used to make the loan repayments and to pay her portion of social ceremonies; the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Léontine est mariée à un greffier du nom de Epiphane. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Léontine et son mari subviennent ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Léontine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses charges diverses, Léontine mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année la vente de produits divers (tomates fraiches, oignons, piments, gombo, poissons fumés, conserves de tomate et de sardine, savons, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Léontine achète ses produits. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Léontine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Léontine a bien remboursé le crédit obtenu précédemment.
texts.en: Born in 1964 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, Léontine is married to a clerk named Epiphane. The couple has three children, who all attend school; two depend on them financially. Léontine and her husband provide together for the family's various needs. Léontine never went to school. To pay for her various expenses, Léontine has been active for about fifteen years selling various products out of her house (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra, smoked fish, canned tomatoes and sardines, soaps, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to increase her activity and better satisfy her customers, Léontine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Léontine paid back her previous loan correctly.

loans.use: to purchase various products (boxes of canned food and soap as well as baskets of tomatoes and onions).

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
DESCRIPTION	Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dinkoro, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de savons, d’arachide et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, des savons, d’arachide et des condiments.                                                                        
YAMA  compte acheter des prêts-à-porter avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group, all married, are on average 27 years old with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of N’Dinkoro, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They got to know each other through family, neighbors and friends. They retail clothing, soap, peanuts and condiments.
This is the first solidarity loan for the women of the Djiguisseme group. It will be used to purchase clothing, soap, peanuts and condiments.                                                                        
YAMA is planning on purchasing ready-to-wear clothes from resellers at the Fana market. She retails in the village, for cash or credit, to a clientele comprising men and women.
She foresees an average monthly benefit of 15,000F CFA which will be used to pay back the loan and pay her contribution to social ceremonies, with the remainder to be reinvested in her retail activity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Miurell Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Miurell Vanessa  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 24 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años al inicio compraba la paca ahora compra por pieza. El sueño de L. es tener una mega butique donde venda de todo un poco.
Ella tiene una niña de 4 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y compañero de vida en el negocio.
texts.en: Señora Miurell Vanessa is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman. She is 24 years old and has been selling used clothing for three years. In the beginning she bought in bulk but now she buys by the piece. Her dream is to have a mega boutique one day where she sells a little bit of everything. She has a 4 year old daughter and receives help in the business from her mother and her life partner.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: G.s. Los Mismos Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario Los Mismos está conformado por Víctor, Maria Concepción y Susana. Víctor tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, su actividad es una carpintería. Tiene más de  8 años en este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes, llegan a solicitarle diferentes encargos el siempre está buscando como brindarles la mejor atención y el mejor servicio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de madera, cepillos, lijas, entre otras herramientas. Todos son personas responsables trabajadores que en muchos casos sacan adelante a su familia, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The group Los Mismos is made up of Victor, Maria Concepción and Susana. Victor has 4 young children and he works as a carpenter. He has been doing this work for more than 8 years. Most of his clients come to him with different projects and he is always looking to give them the best attention and service. The loan he is requesting is to buy wood, brushes, sandpaper and other tools. All of the group members are responsible and hard-working. They are very grateful to the Leon Foundation for the support it has given them, which has helped them to take care of their families.

loans.use: to buy wood, brushes, sandpaper and other tools.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 27 años, vive con sus hijos y su madre en casa de sus padres. Hace más 12 años se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad en una tienda que posee, en este negocio su madre la ayuda en la atención hacia el cliente, mientras trabaja en algún trabajo temporal que se le presente. Desde entonces, cada mañana abre su establecimiento, que se encuentra en casa de sus padres, ellos la apoyan en todo para poder salir adelante. Parte de su trabajo consiste en  administrar su tienda, y procurar abastecerse de los productos que tiene mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes.  A lo largo de todo este tiempo, su negocio se ha establecido y por tal espera continuar invirtiendo en la compra de más productos y ampliar su tienda. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia en todos estos ciclos de  trabajo con el banco comunal que integra que a pesar de dificultades que han existido han sido superadas por lo  que renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo de una actitud responsable ante este nuevo préstamo que tiene. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar productos y poder abastecer su negocio. Asimismo desea comprar de sacos de abono ya que sembrará maíz en el terreno de cultivo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Isabel is 27 years old and she lives with her children and her mother in her parents' home. For more than 12 years she has sold basic necessities in her store. Her mother helps her out by waiting on customers so that Isabel can take other temporary work when it is available. She opens her store every morning. It is located in her parents' home and they have supported her in everything they can in order for her to get ahead. 

Part of her job is administering her store and stocking up on the products that are most in demand. Over the years, her store has become well-established and she expects to continue investing in more products and expanding her offerings. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has had a good experience with the communal bank that she belongs to despite difficulties, which she has been able to overcome. Isabel is renewing her commitment to responsibility as she requests this new loan. With the loan, she will buy new products and stock her store. She would also like to buy fertilizer because she will be planting corn on the land that her parents farm.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Aracely del Carmen de 27 años se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años  en sus comienzos vendía solo ropa interior luego con los prestamos empezó a surtir su negocio.  Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial para el día de las madres.
Ella es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 6 años quien es su motivación.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen, 27, has been selling clothes for the last three years.  At the beginning, she only sold underwear but with the loans she began to stock her business.  She will use the loan to buy special merchandise for Mother’s Day.

She is a single mother of a 6-year-old daughter who is her motivation.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Eugenio began working for a friend cleaning a small kindergarten at night. After seeing the success of this small venture, he decided to build his own cleaning service. For the last three years he has struggled to build contracts with various business offices. Recently he signed a large contract with a medical office and hopes to sign another large client soon. Eugenio relishes owning his own business and having the means to support his growing family. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Eugenio will be purchasing two new floor buffers. As his contracts have grown, he wants to be able to clean floors in the most efficient way. These will also allow him more time to focus on building new client relations. In the future, Eugenio wants to continue to build his reputation as a cleaning service. More importantly, he wants to improve his family’s quality of life through his continued successes.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment.

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es:
A sus 24 años de edad, Diana es una joven emprendedora que se desempeña como madre comunitaria del Instituto de Bienestar Familiar, oficio que desempeña desde su casa pero que no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y hacerse cargo de su madre. 

Debido a la necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, Diana empezó desde hace algunos días con la venta de productos por catálogo con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, pues en el futuro espera estudiar para convertirse en profesional. 

Actualmente, Diana necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido propio de la revista que en oportunidades viene en promoción y así lograr incrementar sus ganancias, así mismo requiere de algunos videos y material demostrativo con el que mostrará los beneficios de dichos productos y así llegar cada vez a más clientes y acreditar su negocio.
texts.en:
At the age of 24, Diana is a young and enterprising woman who works as a day care worker at the Instituto de Bienestar Familiar. She carries out her activities from her house but the wages are not enough to cover her household expenses and to support her mother.

Given her need to increase her income and to improve the quality of her life, Diana started to sell products through a catalogue a few days a go. Her goal is to improve the quality of her life and in the future to go to school to earn a career.

Currently, Diana needs a loan to purchase a variety of products from the catalogue when they come up for sale to increase her profits. She also requires a few videos and samples to display the benefits of the products and to earn more clients and to establish a reputation for her business.

loans.use: to purchase products from a catalogue and samples to display.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nieta, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Boumoutou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de beurre de karité, d’oignons, de galettes, d’habits et des articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Nieta sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
La cliente AWA compte acheter de l’oignon avec les grossistes du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Nieta group, all married, are on average 45 years old with 5 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Boumoutou in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They got to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They retail Shea butter, onions, patties, clothing and various store articles.
This is the first solidarity group for the women of the Nieta group.
The client named AWA intends to purchase onions from the wholesalers at the Fana market. She retails in the village, for cash or credit, to a clientele mostly comprised of women.
She is planning on an average monthly benefit of 10,000 CFA, to be used to repay the loan, contribute to social ceremonies, with the remainder to be reinvested in her retail activity.

loans.use: to purchase onions.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is a policeman and he has worked with the police as a dog expert since 1995. 

At the same time, he, his wife and his mother are engaged in farming. They raise cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. They also grow potatoes on their farm. With profit from farming they are able to meet their family’s needs and develop their farm.
   
Vardan is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer. 

Vardan is 38 years old and he has three children who are pupils. Vardan and his family live in Zovaber village in the Sevan area.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
El señor Segundo José es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor de 53 años quien desde hace más de 25 años se dedica al comercio de perecederos en sus inicios vendía la fruta o verdura de temporada. En la actualidad vende de todo un poco desde tomate, chayote, chilote, cebolla, chiltoma, ayote, melón, plátano, sandilla, hojas para tamales...etc.

El señor Segundo con el crédito comprará las frutas y verduras para surtir su negocio el cual se encuentra en Tipitapa.
texts.en:
Segundo José is a 53-year-old, hard working, enterprising man who has sold perishables for the last 25 years.  When he started out he only sold seasonal fruit or vegetables.  Currently, he sells a little bit of everything: tomatoes, chayote, garlic, onion, peppers, pumpkin, melons, bananas, watermelon, leaves to wrap tamales, etc.

Segundo will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables to stock his business which is located in Tipitapa.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Boumoutou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de  pâte arachide, de savon, de gâteaux et de galettes.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, des savons, de la farine de blé et du mil.                                                                   
AMI compte acheter de l’arachide avec les revendeurs du village, qui sera transformé en pâte d’arachide, qu’elle revendra au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Yeredeme are all married, and they average 28 years of age and four children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Boumoutou, sub-prefecture of Fana; Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in peanut butter, soap, cakes, and pancakes.

The group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy peanuts, soaps, wheat flour, and some millet.

AMI intends to use her loan to buy peanuts from the retailers in the village. She will process them into peanut butter. Accepting cash or credit, she will sell her product in the village to a customer base composed mostly of women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to contribute to societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her commerce.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Foussena

texts.fr: Mère de 30ans, Foussena  a une vie de famille épanouie, malgré son statut de femme mariée elle se bat au quotidien pour partager les charges du foyer. Revendeuse d’épices depuis 05 ans dans un marché de la capitale elle fait ses provisions à Lomé.
texts.en: The 30-year old Foussena is married and has her hands full taking care of her family. Nevertheless, she also struggles to provide for part of the family budget. She has been selling spices at a market in the capital. She stocks up in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Daniel le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior. 
Esta solicitando un presta para poder comprar el material que es pintura, cemento y para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como cocinero de un restaurante en la vecina ciudad. Ya que su esposa la señora Ana Cecilia se encarga del cuidado de los tres hijos que tiene. 
Desean que el patrimonio de sus hijos este en buenas condiciones y seguro para ellos.
texts.en: José Daniel needs to finish off some work to the outside of his home.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials: paint and cement, and pay the person who will carry out the improvements.  He plans to repay his loan with the wage that he earns as a cook in a restaurant in a neighboring town.  His wife, Ana Cecilia, looks after their three children.  They would like their children's inheritance to be in a good and safe condition.

loans.use: to finish off some work to the outside of his home

loans.name: Semassa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEMASSA est formé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Marie est mariée à Norbert un cultivateur. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois sont encore à leur charge. Marie assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y arriver, Marie vend des graines de soja à Agbamé dans le département de l’Atlantique. Parallèlement à cette activité, marie vend du maïs et du fromage au soja. Marie s’approvisionne au marché de Houègbo dans le département de l'Atlantique. C’est la première fois que Marie et son groupe sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Semassa Group is composed of 13 individuals living in the same area. The group’s representative, by the name of Marie, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Marie is married to Norbert, a farmer. They have five children, all of whom are in school and three of whom are still in their care. Marie provides for the household needs on her own. In order to do so, she sells soy beans in Agbamé, in the Atlantic Department. In addition, Marie also sells corn and soy cheese. Marie stocks up at the Houègbo market in the Atlantic Department. It is is the first time that Marie and her group are seeking a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy three bags of corn and three bags of soy beans

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Magda es comerciante con más de diez años en la venta y la compra de cerdo, que junto con su esposo trabajan para el bienestar de la familia, inicio comprando de uno a dos cerdos, atreves de la ganancia y luego con préstamos en Afodenic, incrementan la variedad y compra de más de ocho cerdo.
El cual destazan y venden por libra, como los de engorde que los venden a mejor precio al cliente. Es un trabajo pesado, ya que la alimentación es importante para el desarrollo del cerdo, lográndole mejor carne, como manteca, también hay que haciarlos  todos los días, manteniendo la higiene en el hogar. Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara: varios cerdos, el cual viajan a los departamentos para encontrar mejor calidad como a mejor precio.
texts.en: Magda has been working for over 10 years buying and selling pork. Together with her husband she works for the well-being of her family. She began buying one or two pigs at a time. Through her earnings and later through loans with  Afodenic, she added to her selection and started to buy more than eight pigs at a time. She slices up the meat and sells it buy the pound; that of the pork calves sells sells for a higher price. It’s a tough job. Proper food is important for the pigs’ development, if you want to get the best meat. You also have to keep their living quarters clean every day. With this new loan Magda will buy several pigs; she will travel to different towns to find the best quality for the best price.

loans.use: To buy pigs in order to grow her business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 65 años, es viuda y vive con uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 21 años D. experiencia elaborando telares y actualmente lo  practica como fuente principal D. ingresos. Es así que desD. la comodidad D. su casa y con ayuda D. su rudimentaria maquina D. madera pueD. elaborar hermosos telares D. calidad. Una D. sus hijas la apoya en este trabajo, pues tiene muchos clientes que le solicitan este arte que elabora con mucha dedicación, por lo que le ha dado prestigio en su oficio, además D. obtener buenos ingresos económicos. Por otro lado, se dedica también a la agricultura, por lo que cultiva maíz y papa; dedicándole mayor parte D. su tiempo en temporada D. siembra y cosecha. Es su crédito número 4  con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar más lana y también en la compra D. sacos D. abono para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Paulina, 65, is a widow living with one of her children in her own house.  She has 21 years experience weaving textiles and she currently practices this occupation as her main source of income. This is how she’s able from the comfort of her home and with the help of a rudimentary wooden loom to create beautiful, quality textiles.  One of her daughters helps her with this work because she has a lot of customers that request this art that she produces with so much dedication.  AsiD. from producing good income it has given her occupation prestige. On the other hand, she’s also a corn and potato farmer.  She dedicates most of her time to farming during planting and harvesting.

This is her loan #4 with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s always been responsible with her payments.  In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more wool and also to buy some sacks of manure to her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy wool and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame cooks and sells rice and tomato sauce at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a prison officer. Maame has been selling cooked rice for 8 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy rice, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, oil and other ingredients. She hopes to grow her business further and so plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy rice, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, oil and other ingredients to cook food to sell.

loans.name: Ervin Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Ervin Santiago  de 35 años es propietario de un taller artesanal de calzado. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años cuando decidió independizarse este tipo de negocio se trabaja diario según comento diario realiza calzado y diario entrega el producto.
Él con el crédito comprará materia prima como  pega, cuero, cuerina, brasil, plantillas, suelas…etc.
texts.en:
Ervin Santiago, 35, owns an artisanal shoemaking shop.  He started this business 8 years ago when he decided to become independent.  This type of business requires daily work, he commented.  He makes and sells shoes daily.

He will use the loan to buy raw materials like: adhesive, leather, naugahyde, imitation leather, soles, etc.

loans.use: to buy shoemaking supplies.

loans.name: Hede

texts.en: For the past 12 years, Hede has been selling corn dough, cloth and cooking utensils at Elmina near Ntranoa, a village in Cape Coast. She is married to a prison officer and together they live with their two children. Hede wants to expand her cloth business and so needs a loan  to buy cloth on a larger scale so she can supply her customers. The profit that will be realized from the sale of the cloth will be used to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth on a larger scale so she can supply her customers.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José es un cliente de 68 años de edad, que vive en casa propia con su esposa. La casa está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito Tambogrande  en Piura. 

La actividad que desarrolla José es la crianza de ganado ovino y agricultura, cuenta con una experiencia de 10 años en este rubro. José comercializa a los ovinos, una vez que han alcanzado  tamaño y peso ideal, en el mercado local. Además, cuenta con una pacerla  donde cosecha limón semanalmente.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles  que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado.

José es un cliente conocido para nuestra entidad cancelo puntual y responsablemente su crédito anterior que también fue  un préstamo KIVA.

José es un señor trabajador que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 68 years old and he lives in a house of his own together with his wife. The house is located in the rural region of the district of Tambogrande in Piura.

Jose's business activity to raise sheep and agriculture. He has 10 years' experience in the field. He sells his sheep once they have reached an ideal size and weight in the local market. Additionally, he also has a parcel of farm land where he harvests lemons weekly.

Jose requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

Jose is a known client to our organization and he has repaid his past loan, also acquired through Kiva, on time and in a responsible manner. 

Jose is a hardworking person who wants to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Juana Cruz

texts.es:
Juana  es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Monsefú en Chiclayo. Juana es conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora y devota a sus hijos.

Monsefú es una zona D. artesanos, allí se encuentran los mejores souvenirs D. Lambayeque. Juana pertenece a ese grupo. Ella confecciona  sombreros D. palma en su propio domicilio y se dedica hace más D.  15 años a  esto.  Juana venD. sus sombreros como pan caliente y cuenta con clientela establecida.

Juana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar palma, que es el insumo principal D. la confección D. sombreros.

A Juana le encanta su trabajo y es feliz porque pueD. ganar dinero haciendo lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Juana is the mother of a family, 52 years old, and she lives with her husband and two children in the district of Monsefu in Chiclayo. Juana is a known to be a hardworking woman who is devoted to her children.

Monsefu is a community of artisans. The best souvenirs of Lambayeque can be found here. Juana is a member of this community. She makes straw hats from her own home and she has been in business for more than 15 years. Juana's hats are sold fast like fresh bread and she has an established clientele.

Juana requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1800 nuevos soles to purchase straw. It is the primary products that she uses to make her hats.

Juana loves her work and she is happy because she is able to earn an income doing what she loves best.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hats.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame sells wakye (rice and beans cooked together), cooked rice, biscuits, toffees and other goods in Elmina. She is divorced and has three children. Having to take care of her children has not been easy.  She needs a loan to expand her business so she can properly take care of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients that will enable her cook wakye and rice for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a food stall and further educate her children. 

Maame is standing by the table on which she displays rice, wakye and biscuits for sale.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients that will enable her cook wakye and rice for sale.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de  premières nécessités (riz, sardine,….) depuis 2004, Akossiwa  est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Ses provisions se font au Grand marché de Lomé et ses environs et la revente dans sa boutique dénommée ‘’AMEGBEDJI’’. Elle se défend journalière ment pour ramener sa croûte à la maison. Ce second lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu qu'elle n'a plus de stock.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a vender selling basic needs products (rice, sardines, etc) since 2004. She married and the mother of three. She stocks up at the Grand market of Lomé and in the nearby areas and resells in a store called “Amegbedji.” Day to day, she struggles to bring an income home. This second loan will allow her to replenish the stock of products she has run out of.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 44 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city with her husband (who has seasonal work), his daughter and her father-in-law.  Eleven years ago Jemma rented the shop where she runs her business. She sells women’s and children’s clothing, underclothes, shoes and slippers at her shop. Jemma buys merchandise from Yerevan and resells it in Vanadzor city to raise money and support her family.  
  
Jemma needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy summer seasonal clothes and sandals for her business.

loans.use: To buy summer seasonal clothes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Aida Francisca

texts.es:
Aida tiene 55 años de edad, ella vive en una casa alquilada junto con su hija, en la ciudad de Chiclayo – Lambayeque.

Aida tiene un negocio de venta de comida, desde hace 2 años. Su negocio esta ubicado en una esquina estratégica de la ciudad de Chiclayo y cuenta con bastante afluencia. Aida esta feliz con esto y es por ello que quiere brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrecerles nuevos productos.

Aida solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar gaseosas, agua mineral e hidratantes. Además, otra parte del crédito será invertida en remodelar un poco su negocio. Con esto Aida busca mantener contenta a su clientela y por lo tanto crecer económicamente.

Aida ha solicitado préstamos a nuestra entidad que ha cancelado con responsabilidad, estos préstamos le ayudaron a desarrollar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aida is 55 years old and she lives in a rented house together with her daughter. It is located in the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque.

Aida has had a food sales business for two years. Her business is strategically located at a corner in the city of Chiclayo and she enjoys a great affluence of customers. Aida is happy because she wants to provide her clients with a better level of service and to provide them new products.

Aida requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva field Partner) a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase soft drinks, mineral water, and juices. A part of her loan will be invested in the remodeling of her business. Through this Aida hopes to keep her clientele happy and to grow financially.

Aida has requested past loans from our organization and she has repaid them responsibly. These loans have helped her develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and to remodel her business.

loans.name: Frank Arley

texts.es:
Frank Arley es un joven que se ha rebuscado la forma de generar ingresos, pues de él depende su esposa y sus 4 hijos a los cuales espera sacar adelante y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Es así como desde hace dos años decidió pararse en una calle de Itagüí, municipio del Área Metropolitana de Medellín, donde empezó a  darle indicaciones a los conductores para el parqueo de sus vehículos, fue allí donde descubrió otra oportunidad de negocio, una venta de chiqules, cigarrillos y dulces. 

Frank sueña con convertir su negocio en un minimercado, pero para ello es consciente que debe trabajar duramente y esforzarse cada vez más; por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de dulces y snaks que le permitan ofrecerle mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Frank Arley is a young man who has consistently searched for a way to generate an income. His wife and their 4 children depend on him and he wants to support him and to offer them a better future. Two years ago he decided to stand at a street in Itagui, a municipality of the metropolitan region of Medellin, and he started to help drivers find parking spots. This is how he discovered another business opportunity: the sale of gum, cigarettes, and sweets.

Frank dreams of converting his business into a mini-market. But to achieve his goal he knows that he needs to work very hard and to increasingly expend a greater effort. He currently needs a loan to purchase a greater variety of sweets and snacks which will give him the ability to offer a better variety to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a hairdresser at Elmina in the village of Ntranoa in Cape Coast. She is divorced and currently taking care of three children.  She has been a hairdresser for some time now and has not been able to purchase a dryer. A loan from Kiva will help her buy a dryer to use in the salon. She would also like to buy attachments to use on her customers' hair. She anticipates buying a hand dryer in addition, as a result of her increased capital.

loans.use: To buy a dryer to use in the salon.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE est formé de quatorze personnes qui habitent toutes dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cathérine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Cathérine est mariée à Pierre un soudeur. Le couple à deux enfants dont un à charge et scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y arriver Cathérine vend des friperies. Parallèlement à cela, Cathérine vend d’Akassa (une  pâte préparée à base de la farine de maïs). Cathérine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Cathérine et son groupe sollicite auprès de ALIDé pour une première fois son aide financier. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The AYIDOTE group is composed of fourteen persons, who all live in the same town. The group's representative, whose name is Cathérine, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. Cathérine is married to Pierre, a welder. The couple has two children, one of whom depends on them and attends school. The couple takes care of the various duties of their household together. To this effect, Cathérine sells second-hand clothing. In parallel, she sells "akassa" (corn flour-based dough). Cathérine gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to develop their business and to better meet their customers' needs, Cathérine and her group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time. This loan will allow them to strengthen their activity to better satisfy their customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes and corn to prepare '"akassa".

loans.name: Marina Natividad

texts.es:
Doña Marina Natividad, es casada, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la confección de tejidos, especificamente a la confeccion de delantales típicos, lleva 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició siendo operaria y ahora hace sus propios trabajos en la casa, cuenta con el apoyo economico de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Decide acercarse a ASDIR para solictar un prestamos que le servirá para compra de telas tipicas y adornos, para que esta forma pueda seguir con el trabajo que realiza actualmente. Espera ver su negocio superado y con mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Marina Natividad is married and 32 years old.  She completed 6 years of primary education.  She has 3 children who are in school.  She makes fabric items, specifically, traditional aprons.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  She began as a machine operator, and now she does her own work at home.  She counts on the financial support of her husband, who is a bricklayer.  

She decided to approach ASDIR to ask for a loan that will help her buy typical cloth and decorations, so that she can continue with the work she is doing now.  She hopes to see her business succeed and bring in better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and decorations

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She sells eggs and bread at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast, which she has done for 12 years. Cecilia assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional crates of eggs and to bake extra quantities of bread for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to save toward building a snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase additional crates of eggs and to bake extra quantities of bread for sale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 31 años de edad y  es una mujer trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo- Lambayeque.

Alicia tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el exterior del mercado Modelo (el mercado más popular de la ciudad de Chiclayo), esto beneficia el negocio de Alicia pues el lugar donde se encuentra ubicada tiene gran concurrencia y por lo tanto Alicia tiene gran demanda en su negocio. Ella cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en este rubro. 

Alicia desea mejorar la calidad del servicio de su negocio y ampliarlo por eso es que quiere invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas para este. Esto la ha llevado a solicitar un crédito de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para comprar las sillas y mesas.

Alicia es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is 31 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in the city of Chiclayo - Lambayeque.

Alicia has a business selling food outside the Modelo Market (the most popular market in the city of Chiclayo).  This location benefits Alicia's business since it is a very busy spot and so Alicia has a lot of demand in her business.  She has eight years experience in this line of work.

Alicia would like to improve the quality of the service she provides in her business and also expand it.  She would like to invest in buying tables and chairs.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy tables and chairs.

Alicia is an entrepreneurial woman who has a great desire to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y hielo. Tiene más de  9 años en su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora. Inicio este medio de vida con la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo no ha sido fácil ya que estar pendiente de sus hijos y de su trabajo. El crédito es para la compra de leche, cremas, queso y cuajada, también bolsas para sus hielos. Sueña con ampliar su negocio, proporcionar más ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Yulisa Del Carmen sells milk products and ice.  She has had her business for more than 9 years.  She is a very hard-working person.  She started doing this for a living because she needed to defray household costs.  She has 3 children in her charge, and it has not been easy, since she has to keep an eye on both her children and her work.  The loan is for the purchase of milk, cream, cheese, and cuajada (cheese curd), as well as bags for her ice.  She dreams of expanding her business and bringing in more earnings for her household.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cream, cheese, and cuajada (cheese curd), as well as bags for her ice

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Elba del Carmen  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 49 años quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con unos ahorros con la venta de gaseosa, chiverías…etc. con el préstamo ha ido surtiendo su negocio. Además ella vende ropa, zapatos, plata etc. en lo cual invertirá el crédito.

Elba tiene seis hijos mores de edad de los cuales su hija Iveth es quien le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elba del Carmen is a hard working, enterprising, 49-year-old woman who has a grocery store that she started out with some savings from selling soft drinks, snacks, etc.  With the loan she’s been stocking her store.  She also sells clothes, shoes, silver, etc. which is what she’ll invest the loan in.  

She has six minor children.  Her daughter Iveth is the one that helps her in the business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, clothes, shoes and silver.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es joven trabajador de 23 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Chiclayo, su casa está ubicada en una comunidad  urbana en vías de crecimiento.

Alexander se dedica, desde hace 2 años,  a la venta de productos textiles que realiza en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle de comerciantes de la ciudad. Alexander goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de  1500 nuevos soles con los que desea comprar una moto para poder movilizarse sin gastar tanto. Alexander desea ahorrar dinero para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. También tiene pensado utilizar su moto, como herramienta de trabajo, para llevar pedidos a domicilio y así tener un mejor servicio. 

Alexander es un joven con muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Alexander is a hard-working young man of 23 who lives in his parents' home in Chiclayo district.  Their home is located in a developing urban community.

Alexander has been selling textile products for two years.  He carries out his business in rented premises which are located in a commercial street in the city.  Alexander has good personal and work references.

Alexander is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he would like to use to buy a motorcycle so that he can get around without it costing so much.  Alexander would like to save some money so that he can help his parents with their household expenses.  He is also planning to use the motorcycle as a work tool, to provide home deliveries, thereby offering his customers a better service.

Alexander is a young man who has a great desire to improve himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Catherine est née le 14 Janvier 1984 à Aplahoué au Bénin. Mariée à un soudeur du nom de Olivier, Catherine a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux représentent ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Catherine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Catherine a très peu fréquenté l’école.
