Depuis six ans, Catherine vend du maïs, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer une bonne partie des besoins de ses enfants. Catherine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroitre son revenu et son chiffre d’affaire, Catherine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Catherine was born on 14th January 1984 in Aplahoué in Benin. She is married to a welder called Olivier. Catherine has three children in her care, all of whom go to school and two of whom are her own children. The couple covers the various family expenses between them. Catherine and her husband live together with their children. Catherine went to school very little. For the past six years she has been selling corn and this enables her to provide for her needs and for a large part of her children's needs. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Catherine is requesting a loan from Alidé in order to expand her business and her turnover. Her previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to purchase 19 bags of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical appliances for her home

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sol y Luna lo conforman Álvaro , Yolanda  y Maricela del Carmen tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor Ávaro de 38 años quien es taxista desde hace 2 años y hace 9 meses se dedica al destace de cerdo negocio en el que invertirá el crédito.

La señora Yolanda de 38 años vende fresco y repostería hace 8 meses y Maricela del Carmen de 29 años tiene una fritanga hace tres años.
texts.en:
The “Sol y Luna” (Sun and Moon) group’s members are Álvaro, Yolanda and Maricela del Carmen, three hard working, enterprising people.  The group Coordinator is Álvaro, 38, who’s a Taxi Driver.  For the last two years and nine months he’s been butchering pigs and this is what he’ll invest the loan in.

Yolanda, 38, has sold fruit drinks and pastry for the last 8 months and Maricela del Carmen, 29, has sold a fast food for the last three years.

loans.use: to invest in his pig butchering business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer de 53 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de papelería, juguetería, ropa, medicamentos y delantales en general, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 16 a 34 años. Lilia es una mujer con mucha capacidad de riesgo  en cuando a emprendimiento se refiere y desde  el año 1992 ha estado trabajando en diversos negocios,  primero vendió gallina en los restaurantes, en el 1993 ya había arrendado un restaurante y se dedicó  a la venta de comidas y en el 1994 comenzó con un negocio de comercialización de mercancía especialmente calzado que traía desde Bucaramanga y  cuando su esposo comenzó a trabajar en una empresa, emprendieron un punto comercial , compraron poco a poco vitrinas que surtieron y diversificaron la mercancía haciendo una buena exhibición de ella,  negocio que en el día de hoy maneja una rentabilidad no menor de un 7% vendiendo papelería, útiles escolares, medicina natural, juguetería, accesorios y detalles para el hogar. Sus clientes son principalmente sus vecinos a quienes vende de contado y tiene una cartera de clientes selectos a los cuales vende a crédito. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hizo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con él comprará de contado y en mayor volumen, papelería que es la mercancía de mayor rotación y adquirida en mayor cantidad, le representará una utilidad adicional por los descuentos que trae este sistema.
Desde que recibió su primer financiamiento ha logrado legalizar su negocio en la Cámara de Comercio del Municipio, ahora su meta más adelante es adicionar a su negocio un restaurante de comida Santandereana y seguir apoyando la gestión de su hogar,  con el que sueña verlo prosperar cada día.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 53-year-old woman who sells stationery, toys, clothes, medicine and aprons in general.  She’s married and has five children ranging in ages from 16 to 34.  Lilia is a woman with much risk capacity in business, she says.  Since 1992 she’s been working in various businesses.  First she sold chicken in restaurants.  In 1993 she had rented a restaurant and went into food sales.  In 1994 she started a business selling merchandise, especially shoes that she’d bring from Bucaramanga and when her husband started working for a firm they opened a store.  They bought display cases that they stocked with a variety of products displaying them well, a business that today she runs with a profit margin no less than 7% selling paper goods, school supplies, natural remedies, toys, accessories and home decorations.  Her customers are primarily her neighbors that she sells to for cash.  She also has a select group of customers that she sells to on credit.

Her Kiva loan is the second loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to pay cash for a large volume of stationery supplies, which is the merchandise with the highest turnover rate.  This will mean a higher profit margin for her thanks to the discounts she’ll get paying cash.

Since getting her first loan she’s managed to regularize her business in the municipal Chamber of Commerce.  Now her goal for later on is to add a restaurant specializing in the food of Santander to her store and to continue running her household with the dream of seeing it prosper more each day.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies for cash and in larger volume.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, natural D. L. ciudad D. Quimbiri D. 32 años, convive con María D. 30 años D. edad y fruto D. esa relación concibieron 02 hijas, Erika D. 10 años y Naomi D. 04 años a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar y a ganarse el dinero con el esfuerzo D. si mismo y creció con esas enseñanzas. Hoy su actividad principal es el comercio y se dedica a acopiar productos D. L. zona tales como: café, cacao, achiote y palillo, productos oriundos D. L. zona selvática. En su negocio cuenta con el apoyo D. sus trabajadores quienes se encargan D. cargar y pesar los kilogramos D. cada producto. Con su carro recorren varias comunidades en busca D. productos, una vez acumulado una buena cantidad D. mercadería lo trasfieren a las empresas acopiadoras D. gran renombre quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo D. carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable aparte D. entregar L. mercadería las empresas acopiadoras que le pagan con una buena cantidad D. dinero anualmente. Las épocas invierno son D. lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, propias D. L. naturaleza, para Julián son meses D. atraso, porque obstruyen los caminos y perjudican el traslado D. L. carga. Los planes para el futuro D. su negocio es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y esta comprometido en pagar sus aportes puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otro aporte posteriormente. El crédito solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar productos como: café, cacao y achiote a los campesinos.
texts.en:
Julián is from the city of Quimbiri.  He is 32 years old and lives with 30 year-old María with whom he has two daughters: 10 year-old Erika and 4 year-old Naomi, who he would like to proviD. with a better quality of life.

Julián's parents taught him to work and earn money through his own efforts from a very early age.  He grew up with these lessons.  Today, his main business activity is buying and selling.  He buys and stockpiles produce from his region such as coffee, cacao, annatto and turmeric which are all native to the rainforest.  In his business, he has the support of his workers who take charge of loading and weighing each product by the kilogram.  They use his vehicle to travel to different communities in search of produce.  Once he has amassed a good quantity of produce, he transfers it to well-known trading companies who pay him a good quantity of money annually.

Winter brings rainy periods and landslides on the roads.  For Julián, these are months of delay because when the roads are blocked, it becomes difficult for him to transport his cargo.  Julián's plan for the future of his business is to continue working with the same determination that he is noted for.  This is his first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time since he would like to access another loan in the future.  He will use the loan he has requested as capital with which to buy products from farmers such as coffee, cacao and annatto.

loans.use: to buy coffee, cacao and annatto from farmers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced feed for sheep

loans.name: Rosalie S.

texts.fr: Née le 04 Septembre 1972 à Abomey dans le département du Zou, Rosalie est mariée à un électricien nommé Pierre. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois représentent leurs propres enfants. Rosalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Rosalie a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Rosalie prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce, et des boissons), qu'elle vend à sa clientèle ; ce qui l’aide à assurer ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants. La demande de la clientèle de Rosalie se fait de plus en plus grande et elle n’arrive plus à couvrir toute la demande. C’est donc dans le but d’augmenter sa production journalière afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Rosalie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Rosalie was born on 4th September 1972 in Abomey, which lies in the Zou "département". She is married to an electrician called Pierre. The couple has four children in its care, all of whom are at school and three of whom are their own children. Rosalie lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various family expenses between them. Rosalie stopped going to school at secondary level. For around ten years she has been preparing food (rice, corn dough accompagnied by sauce, and drinks) which she sells to her customers; this allows her to provide for her needs as well as for those of her children. Rosalie's customer demand is increasing and she can no longer meet this demand. She is thus requesting a loan from Alidé in order to increase her daily production and better satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, rice, condiments for sauces and drinks

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lluvia lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Lorena , Flor de María  y Zoyla . Ellas han sido beneficiadas tanto por el crédito como por los talleres de capacitación en los cuales aprendieron de autoestima y cómo manejar su negocio. 

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lorena de 38 años quien desde hace 10 años tiene una tortillería la cual inicio al suave. Ella tiene 5 hijos de 21, 18,15, 13 y 11 años los cuales estudian y le ayudan en el negocio.

Las otras integrantes son Flor de María  de 42 años quien vende leña, hielo y chocobanano y Zoyla  de 39 años se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The Lluvia group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women: Lorena, Flor de María and Zoyla.  They have benefited from loans and also training workshops in which they have learned self esteem and how to run their businesses.

The group's coordinator is 38 year-old Lorena who has owned a tortilla bakery for 10 years.  She has five children aged 21, 18, 15, 13 and 11 who are in school and help her in her business.

The other members of the group are 42 year-old Flor de María who sells firewood, ice and chocolate-covered bananas, and 39 year-old Zoyla who has been selling clothes for six years.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 32 años de edad, él vive con su esposa y 2 hijos en una comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Miguel es conocido por ser un hombre de buenos modales, honrado y trabajador.

La actividad a la que se dedica Miguel, es la agricultura. Él cuenta con un terreno agrícola, que su madre le heredó, en el cual siembra dos tipos de mango, que actualmente se encuentran en producción. Miguel tiene 5 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ha sabido cosechar muy bien sus productos lo que le ha traído consigo una gran demanda.  

Adicionalmente, Miguel cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina en la parte trasera para transportar pasajeros) con la cual brinda un servicio de transporte público y esto sumado a sus cosechas le ayuda a mantener su familia. 

Miguel solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y agroquímicos para su cultivo de Mango. Además, le servirá para la inducción de dicho cultivo con la finalidad de asegurar una buena floración y fructificación.

Miguel estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues tiene muchos deseos de darles a sus clientes una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a rural community of Tambogrande district - Piura.  He is known as a well-mannered, honest and hard-working man.

Miguel is a farmer.  He owns farmland, which he inherited from his mother, where he grows two types of mango that he currently has in production.  Miguel has five years experience in farming and he has known how to grow his products very well which has led to a great demand for his produce.

Miguel also owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers) which he uses to provide a public transport service.  Combined with the money he makes from his crops, this helps him to support his family.

Miguel is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will invest in buying fertilizers and agrochemicals for his mango crop.  It will help him to ensure good flowering and fruiting.

Miguel is very grateful for this loan since he has a great desire to provide his customers with a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for growing mangos

loans.name: Jessica Vianey

texts.es:
Jessica de profesión modista, iniciando hace seis años con iniciativa de su suegra el cual trabajan juntas para el bienestar de la familia, luego comienza  a invertir en tela con el fin de vender más ropa, así como reparación y ajuste de los vestidos de los clientes.
También vende zapatos, para ayudarse más, ya que soy muchos los gastos que pagar, en estos últimos meses ha producido más en ropa, a si como la demanda de sus clientes, todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara dos rollos de tela satinada, cien adornos para pegar en los vestidos, treinta yardas para hacer vestido, botones, zipper, hilos. Lo que espera hacer buenas prendas para que se vendan rápido a precios bajos.
texts.en:
Jessica, a seamstress, began sewing with her mother in law six years ago to provide for her family.  Then she began to invest in cloth with the goal of selling more clothing, and also doing repairs and alterations on her clients' garments. She also sells shoes, to further help herself, since there are many expenses to cover. 

In the last few months she has produced more clothes to meet the demand of her clients, thanks to the financing provided by Afodenic. With this new loan she will buy two rolls of satin finish cloth, one hundred adornments to put on the clothing, thirty yards of cloth for dresses and suits, buttons, zippers, and thread. She wants to make good quality items so they sell rapidly at reasonable prices.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cloth to continue making clothing and to sell better quality, resulting in more income.

loans.name: Aliadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Aliadas lo conforman Elena Francisca, Amada y Esther, tres mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras originarias de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Elena de 45 años quien inicio haciendo y vendiendo cajetas, frijoles cocidos, donas… etc. con las ganancias invirtió en la venta de cosméticos negocio en el que lleva 4 años.  Además ella los fines de semana pone su fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita.
Elena tiene 5 hijos pero solo la menor de 9 años está a su cargo e invertirá el crédito 

Las otras integrantes del grupo Amanda de 59 años quien vende gaseosa, pan, helado y realiza costura, y Esther de 26 años comercializa enchiladas, repocheta, fresco y sandillas.
texts.en:
The 'Las Aliadas' (Allies) group is made up of Elena Francisca, Amada and Esther, three entrepreneurial and determined women from Managua.  The group's coordinator is 45 year-old Elena who started out making and selling 'cajetas' (a traditional sweet treat), baked beans, doughnuts, etc. She invested her profits in selling cosmetics, a business she has been in for four years now.  In addition, at weekends she sets up her 'fritanga' (a restaurant that sells fried food).  Elena has five children but only her youngest, who is 9, is still in her care.

The other members of the group are 59 year-old Amanda, who sells soda, bread and iced treats, and sews, and 26 year-old Esther who sells enchiladas, repocheta (filled corn tortillas), soft drinks and watermelon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and basic grains for making fried food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Antoinette est née le 07 Mai 1966 à Natitingou dans le Nord du Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à un électricien nommé Gilbert et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois encore à sa charge. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Depuis treize ans, Antoinette a une boutique où elle vend divers produits (conserves de tomate, des mèches, des tissus, etc.). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Antoinette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite à nouveau un crédit afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Antoinette was born on May 7, 1966 in Natitingou in the north of Benin.  She is married to an electrician named Gilbert and has four children, all in school, three of whom are still under her care.  Antoinette lives with her children and husband, and the couple shares the household expenses.  For thirteen years, Antoinette has run a store where she sells various products (canned tomatoes, hair extensions, fabric, etc.).  This business generates income that helps her meet her family’s needs without too much difficulty.  Antoinette buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is an old client of ALIDé, having already obtained three loans, which have all been repaid.  Facing a growing customer base, Antoinette is requesting another loan in order to increase her business activity and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetic products, and fabrics.

loans.name: Yuli Maribel

texts.es:
Yuli es una madre joven de 24 años de edad, ella vive junto a su  novio e hijo en  una comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla Yuli  es la crianza de aves de corral (de pavos y gallinas). Actualmente cuenta con 40 pavos y 25 gallinas las cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.  Su novio es agricultor y la apoya en las actividades que realiza, existe una buena relación familiar. 

Yuli solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar  alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus pavos y gallinas para que estos tengan un mejor peso y tamaño  que le permita venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Yuli is a young 24 year-old mother who lives together with her boyfriend and son in a rural community in Tambogrande district – Piura.

Yuli's business activity is raising poultry (turkeys and hens).  She currently has 40 turkeys and 25 hens which she raises and fattens, and then sells in her local market.  Her boyfriend is a farmer and supports her in her business activities.  They have a good family relationship.

Yuli is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed with which to fatten her turkeys and hens so that they reach a better weight and size which will allow her to sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de nécessités (riz, sardine,….) depuis 1997, Aline est mariée et mère de deux enfants.ses provisions se font au Grant marché de Lomé et la revente dans un autre marché de la capitale. Ce pret lui servira à acheter des produits de premieres nécessités(riz, huile végétale, sucre...) pour avoir plus de benefices et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Aline is married and the mother of two children.  She has been selling staple items (rice, sardines, etc.) since 1997.  She obtains her supplies at Lomé’s Grand Market and sells them in another market in the capital.  This loan will enable her to buy staple products (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, etc.) in order to increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy staple items

loans.name: Maria Cleotilde

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cleotilde tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la colonia Maria Pastora Rodriguez de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos. sus comidas las vende en el mercado de San Marcos de Colon. Maria todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar sus alimentos y asi poder cubrir con todos los pedidos que le hacen diariamente sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, arroz, frijoles, manteca, aceite, chorizos, mortadela, verduras, tortillas, refrescos, cafe, jugos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Cleotilde is 49 years old.  She lives in Maria Pastora Rodriguez district, in the city of Choluteca and her business is selling sweet treats, breakfasts and lunches.  She sells her meals in San Marcos de Colon market.  Every day, Maria gets up at 5.00am to prepare her food so that she can cover all the orders that her customers make each day.

Maria will use her loan to buy beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, butter, oil, chorizo, bologna, vegetables, tortillas, soft drinks, coffee and juice.  She needs the profits from her business to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, butter, oil, chorizo, bologna, vegetables, tortillas, soft drinks, coffee and juice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, pitchers and place settings for her business

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est née en 1968 et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Julienne vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Julienne vend de l’«akassa » (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) et des poissons frits à son domicile, mais également de façon ambulante. Julienne s’approvisionne au marché de Cocotomey. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les charges de ses enfants. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Julienne avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Julienne was born in 1968 and has three children.  All the children are in school; Julienne is still financially responsible for two of them.   Julienne lives alone with her children and takes care of the household expenses by herself.  For the past ten years, Julienne has been selling “akassa “ (a local food made with corn starch) and fried fish from her home and also as an itinerant vendor.  Julienne obtains her supplies at the Cocotomey market.  This business generates revenue that helps her cover her children’s expenses.  Julienne is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to meet her goals of expanding her business and increasing her profit.   The first two loans that Julienne received have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy three bags of corn and three bags of fish

loans.name: Margelina

texts.es:
Margelina es una mujer trabajadora D. 43 años D. edad. Ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la comunidad rural D. Guaraguaos ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. 

Margelina se dedica hace 7 años a la crianza D. ganado ovino y vacuno que luego comercializa a la clientela establecida con la que cuenta. Margelina tiene  corrales apropiados y espaciosos que le permiten darle una buena crianza a sus animales.  Además D. comercializar sus animales, Margelina venD. diariamente la leche que le producen sus vacas.

Su esposo es agricultor y cuenta  con parcela propia donD. siembra mango y maíz.  Esta pareja se ayuda mutuamente para contribuir con los gastos del hogar

Margelina ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles, para comprar alimento balanceado a sus animales e implementar un  nuevo corral pequeño. Esto la ayudará a seguir desarrollando satisfactoriamente sus ventas.
texts.en:
Margelina is a hard-working 43 year-old woman who is married and has three children in her care.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and children in the rural community of Guaraguaos which is located in TambogranD. district - Piura.

Margelina has been raising sheep and cattle for seven years.  She sells her animals to established customers.  Margelina has suitable and spacious pens which allow her to raise her animals well.  In addition to selling her animals, she also sells the milk that her cows produce daily.

Margelina's husband is a farmer and he has his own plot of land where he grows mangos and corn.  This couple help each other in covering their household expenses.

Margelina has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her animals and to set up a new small pen.  This will help her to continue developing her sales in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda es una señora D. 50 años D.  edad, es viuda y mantiene a un solo hijo pues los demás ya son independientes. Ella vive en una comunidad rural ubicada a 8km del distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Su casa es D. material rústico (adobe) y no cuenta con los servicios básicos D. luz, agua y desagüe.

Teolinda tiene un terreno agrícola en el que cultiva mango y limón semanalmente y esto le genera algunos ingresos. Sin embargo su actividad principal es la crianza D. aves D. corral (pavos y  gallinas) que luego comercializa a los pobladores D. su comunidad.

Teolinda solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus aves y para mejorar el corral donD. las cría. 

Teolinda tiene muchos deseos D. superarse para tener una mejor calidad D. vida y por lo pronto contar con los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Teolinda is a 50 year-old widow who supports just one of her children as the others already live independently.  Teolinda lives in a rural community which is located 8km from TambogranD. district - Piura.  Her home is maD. from coarse building materials (adobe) and doesn't have the basic services of piped water, electricity and sewerage.

Teolinda owns a plot of farmland where she grows mangos and lemons every week.  This makes her some income.  However, her main business activity is raising poultry (turkeys and hens) which she then sells to the residents of her community.

Teolinda is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy balanced feed for her birds and improve the pen where she raises them.

Teolinda has a great desire to improve herself so that she can enjoy a better quality of life and have access to basic services.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her poultry

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Visión hacia el Futuro lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedora una de ellas es Bety coordinadora del grupo. Esta señora de 42 años desde 1980 se ha desempeñado como maestra y hace tres años inicio un preescolar que poco a poco con lo que los padres dan ha ido creciendo. 

Ella con el crédito comprará sillas, mesas, juegos didácticos, libros y materiales que necita para las clases.

Las otras dos integrantes son Lisbeth Carina de 30 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, zapatos y juguetes usados, y Carol de 30 años comercializa ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The 'Visión hacia el Futuro' (Looking to the Future) community bank is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  One of them is Bety, the group coordinator.  This 42 year-old lady has been working as a teacher since 1980.  Three years ago, she set up a pre-school which has been gradually growing.

Bety will use her loan to buy chairs, tables, educational games and materials that she needs for her classes.

The other two members of the group are 30 year-old Lisbeth Carina who sells used clothes, shoes and toys, and 30 year-old Carol who sells clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy pre-school materials such as chairs, tables, educational toys, books, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está conformado por María Concepción, Rosalía, Degsy Scarleth mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Managua. Este grupo tiene ocho ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han tenido tres préstamos en kiva en los cuales sus negocios han ido creciendo.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Concepción de 64 años se dedica a la decoración y las artes manuales actividad que realiza desde joven y con el tiempo ha perfeccionado. Ella por más de 32 años tiene un pequeño negocio de costura y decoración en los cuales los últimos dos años emprendió un nuevo reto que es la realización de piñatas en la cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de materiales como hoya de barro, papel de periódico, pegamento blanco, palillo, papel crepe, palos…etc.
Mientras Rosalía de 30 años se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y nueva y cosméticos, y Degsy de 29 años también comercializa ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The members of the Concepción group are María Concepción, Rosalía and Degsy Scarleth who are hard-working, entrepreneurial women from Managua.  This group has been working with Adim for eight loan cycles and they have had three Kiva loans which they have used to grow their businesses.

The group's coordinator is 64 year-old Concepción who decorates and makes handicrafts.  She has been doing this since she was young and, over time, she has perfected her skills.  For more than 32 years, she has owned a small sewing and decorations business.  Over the last two years, she has taken on a new challenge, making piñatas.  She will invest her loan money in this business, buying materials such as clay pots, newspaper, white glue, crepe paper, piñata sticks, etc.

30 year-old Rosalía sells new and used clothes and cosmetics and 29 year-old Degsy also sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to make piñatas

loans.name: Fenou Group

texts.fr: FENOU est un groupement composé de quatorze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Laéticia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laéticia est née le 03 Janvier 1980 à Covè au Bénin. Mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Gilbert, Laéticia est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble  les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis huit ans, Laéticia vend des produits vivriers (maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Laéticia achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché de Glo au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Laéticia et son groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en: FENOU is a group of 14 women from the same neighborhood.  This is their first time requesting a loan through ALIDé, in order to increase their business activity and better meet their customers’ needs.  The group representative, named Laéticia, has her hand raised in the photo.  Laéticia was born on January 3, 1980 in Covè in Benin.  Married to a chauffeur named Gilbert, she has two children, both in school.  The couple live together with their children and share the family’s expenses.  For eight years, Laéticia has been selling food products (corn, etc.) at her home.  She buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and at the Glo market in Benin.  This is the first time that Laéticia and her group are requesting a loan through ALIDé, which will help them to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial, de 29 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, esta casado con Jenny de 28 años y juntos viven en su propia casa  al lado de sus dos queridos hijos a quien desean brindarle un mejor porvenir. La labor que realiza Marcial es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva cacao, café y frutas cítricas, sobre las 03 hectáreas de terreno que posee. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra desde muy niño, y a la edad de 20 años compró su propia parcela desde entonces viene trabajando en sus propias tierras. Marcial en tiempos de cosecha y limpieza de sus terrenos necesita apoyo, es por ello que contrata jornaleros  para realizarlo en el menor tiempo dicha actividades. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas generándole ganancias considerables. Cuenta que la  estación de invierno, hay más precipitaciones de lluvia logrando así perjudicar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, porque posteriormente desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle tal aporte. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono y semillas de cacao para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar mayor cantidad de frutos en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Marcial, age 29, is a native of the city of San Francisco. He is married to Jenny, age 28, and they live in their own house with their two dear children to whom they want to offer a better future. Marcial works at tilling the soil. He grows cacao, coffee, and citrus fruits on the 3 hectares of land that he owns. When he was a young child, his parents taught him to farm, and at the age of 20 he purchased his own land. Ever since then he has worked his own land.

At harvest time or when clearing his land Marcial needs help. That’s why he contracts with day laborers in order to carry out these activities quickly. He feels very committed to his work because, thanks to his daily effort, he enjoys seeing very productive crops which generate respectable earnings. He tells us that during the winter there was a lot of rain which hurt his crops.

This is his first loan with MFP. He is obligated to make his payments on time, and he is determined to do so. He is thankful to the institution for giving him so much support. With the loan applied for he will buy sacks of fertilizer and cacao seed so that he can plant it and have a bigger harvest in a short time.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and cacao seed.

loans.name: Dorkas 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Ana runs a small business selling meals. In her food stall, she sells dinner and snacks like empanadas (rounds of flour dough filled with meat or vegetables), barbecued sausages, and fried food such as meat and plantains. This loan will allow her to increase her products by introducing different meals. She plans to use this loan to buy sausages, ketchup, flour, meat, and cooking oil.

She is excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza. Ana has three grown children and she is a married woman. She wants to continue to increase her business by investing her profits and saving. Her most difficult challenges are to finish studying at the university and to build her house.

Ana is the group coordinator of her group Dorkas 4 & 5 (a biblical name). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients, many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR. The group is based in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town.

loans.use: to buy sausages, ketchup, flour, meat and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lago Ness Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Lago Ness", por el lago ubicado en Escocia en el Reino unido (tierras altas). L. historia cuenta que hay indicios del abistamiento D. un monstruo (Nessi) que aparece frecuentemente a los pobladores D. L. localiadad, motivo por el cual el grupo pretenD. ser inovador en su forma D. trabajo, original y esforzarse todos los dias para alcanzar los objetivos D. todos los integrantes. Esta ubicado en el Estado D. PuebL. en México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. L. señora Maria es L. presidenta del grupo. Estudio L. primaria es ama D. casa y cuenta con una pequeña papeleria y merceria. ElL. quiere el prestamo para invertir en mercancia para su negocio, su objetivo es tener mas variedad D. producto, porque en mayoreo elL. obtiene mas utiliades. Al solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente contenta, con las ganancias del negocio, con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para poder comprar una computadora para L. escueL. D. sus hijos. Observaciones, las personas que no se ven bien en L. foto son: Eufemia y Patricia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Lago Ness” (Loch Ness) after the lake in the Scottish highlands of the United Kingdom. The story is that there is evidence of a monster (Nessie) that frequently appears to people in the area. Inspired by this, the group aspires to be innovative in their way of working. Each day they strive to be creative so that they can reach the goals of all the members.

The group is located in the state of PuebL. in Mexico and is maD. up of 11 members. Señora Maria is the president of the group. She completed primary school, is a housewife, and has a small stationary and dry goods shop. She wants the loan in order to invest in inventory for her business. She wants to sell a greater variety of products because this will allow her to obtain better wholesale prices.

Maria is happy with the income from her business. With the earnings she obtains she wants to save in order to purchase a computer for her children’s school. Two people who aren’t seen well in the photo are Eufemia and Patricia.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a stationary and dry goods business.

loans.name: Jesugnon 1 Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Jocelyne. Les membres du groupe sont des amies et vivent ensemble dans le même quartier. Née le 20 Mars 1974 à Zinvié, Jocelyne est mariée à un certain Gilbert et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Jocelyne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Jocelyne a très peu fréquenté l’école. Afin de satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Jocelyne achète divers produits vivriers (conserves, des vivres, des œufs, etc.) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les revend à son domicile. Jocelyne exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année. C’est la deuxième fois que Jocelyne et son groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en: JESUGNON 1 is a group composed of three people. Its representative (whose hand is raised on the picture) is named Jocelyne. The group members are friends and live in the same neighborhood. Born on March 20, 1974 in Zinvie, Jocelyne is married to Gilbert and the mother of five children, who all go to school. Jocelyne and her husband live together with their children. The couple provides together for the various needs of their family. Jocelyne did not go to school much. To supply for her and her children's needs, Jocelyne purchases various food products (cans, foodstuffs, eggs, etc.) in Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and resells them from her home. Jocelyne has been in this business for about ten years. This is the second time that Jocelyne and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to grow their business, increase their sales, and raise their revenues.

loans.use: to purchase canned and fresh food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a metal roof on her workshop and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Oumè Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Oumè Pauline est née en 1970. Oumè Pauline est mariée à un infirmier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec eux. Oumè Pauline vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges de la maison, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Oumè Pauline n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Oumè Pauline  vend des produits divers (savons, conserves, huile végétale, épices, etc.) à son domicile. Oumè Pauline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Oumè Pauline sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The group God Is Great is composed of three individuals who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that the group is seeking the financial assistance of Alidé, in order to increase their commercial activity. Oumè Pauline, the representative of the group, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Oumè Pauline was born in 1970 and is married to a nurse named Joseph. The couple has five children who have all gone to school and live with them. Oumè Pauline helps her husband with household expenses, thanks to the revenues from her work. Oumè Pauline has never gone to school. For twenty years, she has been selling a variety of products (soap, canned food, vegetable oil, spices, etc.) from her home. Oumè Pauline buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her income, she is seeking a loan along with the other members of her group.

loans.use: Buy canned food, vegetable oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “LAS VECINASS”, está integrado por 10 clientas, en este grupo se encuentra la señora Noemi de 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 14, 12 años y una hija de 10 años, nos platica que hace aproximadamente 7 años decidió poner su negocio de dulces que inició en la comunidad en el Estado de México, y gracias al apoyo de su familia su negocio ha ido creciendo, ya que desafortunadamente se separó de su esposo; ahora que sus ganancias le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia por lo cual ya no se siente tan preocupada por sacar adelante a sus hijos y espera en un futuro brindarles una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Vecinas" (The Neighbors). It is made up of 10 customers.

One member of this group is Noemí. She is 37 years old and has two sons, who are 14 and 12, and a 10-year-old daughter. She tells us that about seven years ago she decided to start her business selling sweets. She began it in the State of Mexico, and thanks to her family's support her business has grown. Unfortunately she and her husband separated, but now her earnings help her to cover the family's expenses, so she is not as worried about providing for her children and hopes to help them go to college in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling sweets.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 2 Group

texts.fr: JESUTOGBE 2 est un groupe de dix personnes, dont les membres habitent ensemble dans la même agglomération. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un crédit. La représentante du groupe, Suzanne (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est née en 1968 à Aguégué au Bénin. Suzanne est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Théodore et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Suzanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Suzanne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de se prendre en charge et de contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Suzanne vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs) accompagnée de beignets (à base de farine de blé) et du sucre à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Suzanne vend des nattes. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Suzanne achète ses produits. Ce crédit permettra à Suzanne et à son groupe d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et d’accroître leur profit.
texts.en: JESUTOGBE 2 is a group of ten individuals, whose members live in the same village. To increase their commercial activity and to better meet the demands of their customers, this group has approached ALIDé to obtain a loan. The representative of the group, Suzanne (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born in 1968 in Aguégués, Benin. Suzanne is married to a fisherman named Theodore and is the mother of three children, all attending school. Suzanne lives with her ​​husband and children. The couple works together to pay off household expenses. Suzanne did not attend school. In order to support the family and contribute to domestic expenses, Suzanne sells porridge (made ​​from corn) with fritters (made from wheat flour) and sugar at home. Secondarily, Suzanne sells mats. Suzanne buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This loan will allow Susan and her group to increase their sales and profit.

loans.use: Purchase corn, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a new store sign.

loans.name: Salinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes tienen nueve ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han tenido dos préstamos Kiva. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Raquel del Socorro de 33 años desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. Ella inicio vendiendo leche en Managua y ahora además de la leche vende queso, crema, cuajada etc. y ropa usada.

Las otras integrantes son Reyna de 30 años se dedica al comercio de ropa en su casa y en Tisma desde hace 3 años y Andrea Asunción de 24 años tiene un puesto de verduras.
texts.en:
This group is composed by three hard working, enterprising women who have been working with Admin for nine cycles and have had two Kiva loans.  The group Coordinator is Raquel del Socorro, 33.  She’s been selling dairy products for about 10 years.  She started out selling milk in Managua and now, besides milk, she also sells cheese, cream, cottage cheese, etc. and used clothes.

The other members are Reyna, 30, who has been selling clothes at home and in Tisma for the last three years and Andrea Asunción, 24, who has a vegetable stand.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Los Alfa 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilio has a wife and 7 children, only 5 of them live together. He belongs to the Los Alfa (The Alpha) 1, 2 & 3 group. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town. 

Emilio will use this loan to buy different medical products, especially natural products. He started this business 1 month ago, after he was using these medicines and having great results.  He became a partner to sell them with a catalog.  Now he will buy the most common products for inventory and sale.  He is excited about his first loan with Kiva's partner Esperanza. 

Emilio will use the profits to invest in his business and save, also he would like to help build his community church. He is a pastor and his favorite thing is to serve others.  His dreams are to serve the Lord forever and teach others the Love of God. 

His most important challenges are to help build the church and to help his family to live better.

There are two group pictures to show all of the members of the group.

loans.use: to buy different medical products

loans.name: Levi Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Levi Vanesse  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 30 años es propietaria de un tienda de variedades la cual inicio con su liquidación y el apoyo de su esposo hace año y medio. Ella trabaja junto a su hermana quien le ayuda en el negocio e invertirá el crédito en ropa y zapatos.

Levi tiene un niño de 4 años y espera la llegada de su segundo hijo y su meta es tener una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Levi Vanessa is a 30-year-old, hard working, enterprising woman.  She owns a novelty shop that she started with her severance pay and with help from her husband a year and a half ago.  She works alongside her sister who helps her with the business.  She will invest the loan in shoes and clothes.

Levi has a 4-year-old son and is expecting the birth of her second child.  Her goal is to have a larger store.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador desde hace 28 años se dedica a la venta de periódicos de una empresa muy conocida que ofrece en una de las avenidas mas transitadas de la ciudad. A el se le denomina en esta institución un cliente con distinguido ya que sus créditos los ha pagado con puntualidad  y se encuentra agradecido por el apoyo brindado ya que de esta manera ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Francisco desea terminar la construcción de su cuarto en la planta alta necesita poner en la paredes un material que la protegiera de las inclemencias del tiempo y se encontré mas reforzada para esto necesita capital para terminar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Franciso is a very hard working man who has been selling very well known newspapers for 28 years on one of the city’s busiest avenues.  In this institution he’s known as a client with distinction because he’s repaid all his loans on time and he is grateful for the support provided because he’s been able to complete his projects thanks to it.

Francisco wants to finish building his bedroom on the second floor; he needs to attach material to the walls that will protect them from the weather inclemency and strengthen them.  To do so, he needs capital.

loans.use: to finish building his bedroom.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo y su esposa son una familia de comerciantes que desde hace 2 años cuenta con su negocio de venta de tacos y gringas denominado “Betos`s” que es una comida típica de la región, que es  carne con condimento rojo puesta en un trompo y se pone en tortilla maíz pequeña y la Gringa es con la misma carne y queso pero con tortilla de harina  y son  acompañados con cilantro, cebolla y salsa. El negocio se ubica en una avenida muy transitada, donde hay variedad de negocios de venta de ropa usada y los clientes después de sus compras van a comer a este lugar.
 Esta pareja es quien prepara esta comida para ofrecer a sus clientes a un bajo precio y esta es su única fuente de ingresos por lo que desean comprar remodelar el local para que se encuentre en mejores condiciones para que haya fluidez de clientes y sus ventas se incrementen para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Eduardo and his wife are a family of merchants who have had a business for the last two years consisting of the sale of tacos and “gringas” called “Beto’s”.  Tacos are a typical dish of the region which are made from meat treated with a red sauce placed on a vertical grill called a “trompo” that is served in a small corn tortilla.  Gringas are made with the same meat and cheese but the tortilla is a flour tortilla and they are garnished with cilantro, onion and salsa.  The business is located on a very busy avenue where there are a variety of used clothes sales shops and when the customers finish shopping they come to eat at his place.

Eduardo and his wife prepare the food themselves to offer it to their customers at a low price and this is their only source of income.  They’d like to remodel their stand so that it will be in better condition so that they can have more customer traffic and sales will increase in order to cover their household expenses.

loans.use: to remodel his food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room upstairs.

loans.name: Cinthia Carolina

texts.es:
La joven Cinthia Carolina es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio, el cual es venta de abarroteria en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años, abastece de productos a toda la colonia en donde reside, es la unica pulperia y la misma se encuentra en un punto estrategico en donde transitan personas en grandes cantidades.
Cinthia se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.\
El creditio lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir su negocio.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Cinthia is an enterprising young woman and has owned her own business, a grocery store, for five years.  She provides products for the entire neighborhood where she lives.  Hers is the only grocery store and it is located at a strategic point where people pass by in large amounts.  Cinthia arises very early to attend to her clients.  She plans to use the loan to purchase grocery supplies in order to stock her shelves.  The earnings will help her provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, butter, oil, margarine, salt, soft drinks, churros, ham, leche, bologna, cheese, coffee, bread, biscuits, flour, tortillas, beef, pork, chicken, candles, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora de 43 años quien labora en el aeropuerto y tiene una pequeña licorería la cual inicio hace poco con la ayuda de su esposo e hija de 17 años quienes administran el negocio. 
Ella tiene la meta de que su negocio crezca y llegar a tener un bar.
texts.en: The client is a very hard working, enterprising, 43-year-old woman who works at the airport and has a small liquor store that she started a short time ago with help from her husband and 17-year-old daughter who run the business.  Her goal is that her business grows and eventually have a bar.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Sergio Manuel

texts.es:
Sergio Manuel es padre de familia de 2 pequeños por quien sale adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. El trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad como soldador y en ocasiones se queda tiempo extra para tener un ingreso más por que es el único sostén de la casa ya que su esposa se dedica al hogar para estar al cuidado de sus hijos. 
El señor Sergio desea construir una barda al frente de su casa para que en algún futuro levantar un cuarto en la planta alta de su casa, la barda que se observa en la imagen es la del vecino por ello mismo necesita construir su propia pared para disponer de ella sin tener algún problema en un fututo, para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material y para mano de obra.
texts.en:
Sergio Manuel is a father of two little ones for whom he wants to get ahead and provide a better quality of life.  He’s employed as a Welder at an assembly plant in the city and sometimes stays on extra hours to earn additional income because he’s the only source of support for his home since his wife is dedicated to the home and to caring for the children.

Sergio wants to build a wall in front of his house so that in the future he can build a room on the upstairs of his house.  The wall that can be seen in the photo is the neighbor’s and this is precisely why he needs to build his own wall to be able to dispose of it problem free in the future.  To do this project, he needs to buy building materials and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to erect a wall.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 38 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, esta casado con Pastora de 36 años y juntos viven en su propia casa  al lado de sus 03 querido hijos a quienes desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Luis, es un hombre muy responsable, por ello trabaja con mucho esmero. Los productos que siembra y cosecha son: el cacao, café y maíz, y que son comercializados en la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya cuenta con diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus frutos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras para evitar la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. El crédito solicitado le servirá para contratar jornaleros para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, como: la poda de sus plantas, sacar la maleza de sus campos y fumigar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luis, 38, is from the city of San Francisco and is married to Pastora, 36.  They live together in their own house alongside their beloved three children for whom they want to provide a better quality of life.  Luis is a very responsible man so he works with much dedication.

The products he plants and harvests are:  cocoa beans, coffee and corn which are sold in the city of San Francisco where he already has several buyers who, knowing the quality of his fruit, don’t hesitate to wait for him to buy all his products.  What he most enjoys about his work is planting and making his land fertile and productive.  He’s been doing this for 13 years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigating his fields to avoid insect infestations.  In the future he hopes to continue to save his income because he wants to buy more land.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial for his work’s development.  He is grateful to the institution for granting him the loan.

The requested loan will be used to hire day laborers to do crop maintenance:  pruning, weeding and fumigating.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 8 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social como es sabido este tipo de casas son muy pequeñas y no tienen la suficiente protección en la parte de enfrente, por lo que ella se ve en la necesidad de construir en la parte frontal una barda para ofrecer a sus 2 hijos mayor seguridad al momento de que salen jugar al patio. Para poder levantar la barda en su vivienda necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
Sonia y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora y algunas ocasiones se quedan tiempo extra para ganar más dinero para el sostén familiar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hard working woman.  She and her husband work in a factory and sometimes work extra hours to earn more money to take care of their family.  Eight years ago she acquired subsidized housing, and as is known, these types of houses are very small and they are not well protected in the front.  For that reason, she feels that it is necessary to construct a fence in front of her house in order to offer greater protection to her 2 children when they are playing in the yard.  

In order to build the fence in front of her house, she needs to buy construction materials and pay for the labor.

loans.use: build a protective fence for her home.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is married with 3 children. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Andriy offers transportation services in the territory of Ukraine. He started this business 2 and a half years ago. Andriy works 12-14 hours a day to make sure his family has everything they need. Presently, Andriy receives about 9,000 Grivnyas of gross income. His net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Andriy is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to repay the car loan he took to purchase a newer vehicle for his business. Andriy’s business is the main source of income for the family. One day, Andriy hopes to purchase a newer car that will work on compressed gas.

loans.use: to repay his car loan

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es una persona que siempre a buscado el bienestar de su familia. Ella todas las mañanas sale a trabajar en 2 casas particulares como empleada domestica; para poder ganar un poco mas de dinero para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar aunque labora como guardia  en un pollo frito y albañil en sus horas libres.
Margarita piensa en darle una buena educación a sus hijos y dejarles mejor patrimonio, es por ello que quiere construir un baño completo con todos los servicios para esto necesita comprar material ya que su esposo es quien se encargaría de la construcción.
texts.en:
Margarita is a person who has always sought her family’s wellbeing.  She goes out every morning to work in two private homes as a Domestic Employee to earn a bit more money to help her husband, who works as a Security Guard and as a Bricklayer in his free time, cover household expenses.

Margarita wants to give her children a good education and leave them a better patrimony so she wants to build a full bathroom.  To do so, she needs building materials and supplies since her husband will take care of doing the construction.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia forma parte del banco comunal “Belén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, vendiendo ropa para adultos y niños. Su mercadería es ropa nueva y la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Valparaíso, ya que los precios son a bajo costo. Julia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 26 años. Su horario laboral es de lunes a sábado de 8ºº a 18ºº horas y su puesto está ubicado afuera de una fuente de soda.
Con el préstamo comprará ropa de hombre, mujer y niño. Además  invertirá en materiales de construcción para la reparación de su casa, ya que ésta fue asolada por el terremoto del 27 de febrero del año 2010.
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, para esto Julia ya está realizando los trámites y gestionando un terreno. Sus motivaciones son principalmente por su salud, debido al sacrificio que se debe realizar al  trabajar en la calle durante la temporada de invierno, sobretodo Julia quien sufre de malestares en el brazo y el frío le afecta sus dolencias, es por esto que además se someterá a una intervención quirúrgica.
Julia vive junto a su esposo y tiene 2 hijos quienes están casados.
Ella está agradecida del crédito y la oportunidad que le ha entregado Fondo Esperanza para emprender en su negocio.
Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy amenas y comparte con las demás socias.  
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Belén” (Bethlehem) communal bank belonging to the city of Valparaíso.  She is a street vendor; she sells clothes for adults and for children.  Her merchandise consists of new clothes that she buys from distributors in the city of Valparaíso because the prices are low.  Julia has been in this occupation for 26 years.  Her work schedule is Monday through Saturday, 8-6 and her stand is located outside a soda fountain.

She will use the loan to buy men’s, women’s and children’s clothes.  Also, she’ll buy building materials and supplies to do some home repairs because it was damaged by the February 27, 2010 earthquake.

Her goals are to set up a business in an established locale and Julia is already doing the paperwork and negotiating for the land to do so.  Her motivations are primarily her health because going out to sell in the streets in the winter requires quite a sacrifice and Julia has problems with an arm and the cold exacerbates her condition.  Because of this she will be having surgery.  Julia lives with her husband and she has two married children.

She is grateful for the loan and the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has delivered to start her business.  With respect to the meetings, they are quite pleasant and she shares with the other members.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is a regional capital and the seat of the national legislature.  It is the nation’s main port and it has a variety of beautiful and picturesque places like, for example, Nobel Prize winning poet Pablo Neruda’s house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juana Aura

texts.es:
Doña Juana Aura, es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, sudaderos, pants, playeras, etc. lleva 11 años de experiencia, inició siendo operaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al comercio.

Quiere ampliar su producción, para lo cual acude ASDIR pra solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que esta vez va a comprar: telas, hilos, correas, etiquetas, etc, las cuales son materiales necesarios e importantes en la producción de su negocio, ya que sin este material no tendría forma de producir mas prendas. Espera alcanzar su objetivo con el préstamo que esta realizando.
texts.en:
Juana Aura is married, 48 years old and has 4 children, two of which are students.  She has 11 years of experience making knitted fabrics, sweaters, pants, t-shirts etc.  Initially, she worked as a machine operator.  She has the support of her husband who works in business. 

Juana wishes to increase her production, and in order to achieve this she requesting a loan that she will use as capital to buy fabric, thread, ribbon, labels, etc, which are all important, necessary items for her business.  Without these items she would not have a way of making more clothing.  She hopes to reach her goals through the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: buy materials to make clothing

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is married with two grown children. She lives in Novomoskovsk. Lidiya sells fancy women’s lingerie in the central marketplace of her hometown. She has set high quality standards to meet the most demanding of her clients. Lidiya has been in this business for 10 years. Her gross income amounts to 27,000 Grivnyas.  

Lidiya is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase new samples of seasonal lingerie items for her female customers. She has good taste and knows how to please her clients and find exactly what they are looking for. Lidiya’s business is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women’s lingerie

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a single mother. She is raising a teenage daughter. 

Tatyana runs a children's clothing sales business in the central market of her home town of Novomoskovsk. Her vending facility is located in a busy part of the market that is always active with customers. Tatyana is very energetic. She likes to find an individual approach to each of her clients. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Her gross income amounts to 32,000 UAH a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase summer tunics and pinafore dresses for children, as well as uniforms for the next school year. She believes a diversified assortment of clothing for different age groups of children will help her improve her sales and increase her income as a result. 

One of Tatyana’s plans is to help her daughter through college. She will enter college this summer and Tatyana is willing to help her financially.

loans.use: to purchase summer tunics and pinafore dresses.

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maura del Socorro  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 39 años quien es propietaria de una Floristería. Ella inicio vendiendo flores en pequeñas cantidades, por unidad  y luego fue surtiendo su negocio empezó a realizar arreglos florales actualmente tiene dos trabajadores.

Maura con el crédito lo invertirá para comprar material para el día de las madres, ya que tiene muchos encargos y hay mucha demanda para ese día.
texts.en:
Maura del Socorro is a hardworking and enterprising woman of 39 who owns a florist's.  She began selling small quantities of flowers, by unit, and then started to provide flower arrangements.  She now has two employees.  
  
Maura invested this loan in buying supplies for Mother's Day, as she already has many orders, and there is a lot of demand for flowers for this day.

loans.use: buy flowers.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 41 años,  es viuda, es una mujer trabajadora y vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 queridos hijos, por quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Dina, es una mujer muy laboriosa, su fin es sobresalir, el oficio que tiene es de ser comerciante y tiene una tienda, que se llama “La bodega de Dina”, establecimiento que es muy concurrido por sus compradores. Es así que cada mañana abre su tienda para recibir a sus clientes, quienes gustan de la variedad que productos que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 05 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias y ampliar su puesto de ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos.
Con el crédito solicitado comprará más productos para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dina, 41, is a widow.  She’s a very hard working woman living in her own house with her four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education.  Dina is a very hard working woman; her goal is to stand out.  The occupation she has is being a merchant.   She has a store called “La Bodega de Dina” that is quite patronized by her buyers.  Every morning she opens the store to receive her customers who like the variety of products she sells.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers because this is one of the skills she uses to win over a larger number of consumers.  She’s been in business for 5 years and considers the most difficult part having to stand almost all day.  In time she hopes to increase profits and enlarge her sales stand.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels that it will be very helpful for her store’s progress and is willing to repay in a timely fashion.  She will use the requested loan to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marcelino Group

texts.es:
el grupo Marcelino esta integrago por tres mujeres que son vecinas y muy amigas, decidieron formar este grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las actividades de cada una de ellas:
la joven  Wendy se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, es madre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela, tiene dicho negocio desde hace mas 5 años. cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. sus tiempos libres los deica a visitar la iglesia. 
la sra. Maria Eufemia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de 
habitacion, Maria se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para hacer sus ricas tortillas.
La sra. Maria Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace 4 años. Maria Juana es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de ropa, leña, cal, maiz, frijoles, arroz, azucar, manteca, aceite, margarina, papel higienico, cafe, pan, galletas, salsas, pastas, sal, churros, refrescos, jugos.
las ganancias las necesitan para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Marcelino group consists of three women who are neighbors and close friends.  They decided to start this group to get ahead in their businesses and with their families.  Here are their activities:

Wendy sells products for everyday use; she runs a store from her home.  She has 4 children, who are in school.  She has been trading for more than 5 years, and can count on her husband's support.  In her spare time, she goes to church.

Maria Eufemia makes and sells tortillas from her home.  She wakes up at 4 am every day to make her delicious tortillas.  

Maria Juana has been selling American-style clothes for the last 4 years. She is a single mother and has 3 children.  

The loan will be used to buy clothing, firewood, lime, corn, rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, toilet paper, coffee, bread, biscuits, sauces, pasta, salt, churros, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.use: to buy clothing, firewood, lime, corn, rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, toilet paper, coffee, bread, biscuits, sauces, pasta, salt, churros, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Dalgi Esther

texts.es:
Dalgi mujer de 38 años, casada y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 10 años, vive con su familia en un barrio muy tradicional de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde la música, el folclor,  los carnavales y su gente trabajadora generadora de ingresos,  forman parte de la cultura  de sus habitantes.  En este ambiente ella tiene un negocio llamado “Confecciones y Variedades Lunna” allí exhibe ropa que ella misma fabrica y también vende muchos productos que requieren las familias cercanas a su vivienda, como cosméticos, perfumes, accesorios, papelería etc.
 Su experiencia de negocio data desde cuando tenía 15 años de edad y su mamá la puso a estudiar modistería  y le compró su primera  máquina con la cual inició la fabricación de blusas muy a la moda, que vendía en chazas del mercado, continuó perfeccionando su arte con capacitación en el servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA   y posteriormente se trasladó a la Isla de San Andrés , donde le fue muy bien con su actividad, pues le agregó el estampado de camisetas ; así fue como vivió allí durante 4 años;  una vez regresó a la Ciudad de Barranquilla aprovechó toda su experiencia y nuevamente emprendió el negocio que aún tiene,  pues confecciona y alquila vestidos de novia, de primera comunión, disfraces; ella gradualmente ha ido creciendo y adquiriendo sus activos fijos. Últimamente  tiene sus vitrinas y empezó a vender cuadernos, dulces, ropa, accesorios femeninos, colonias, y en la actualidad está estudiando artes plásticas y ya esta produciendo cuadros que ha vendido, porque considera que cada persona debe perfeccionar su arte, mediante el estudio y la experimentación para poder abrir nuevas líneas de negocios y sostenerse en un mercado tan cambiante como el actual.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materia prima, materiales e insumos para la fabricación de ropa encargada haciendo de esta una inversión exitosa, porque su experiencia atrae siempre nuevos clientes por el acabado que ella da a sus prendas y el servicio amable que ofrece e a sus clientes reales y potenciales. Su sueño es tener una boutique y también una galería donde exhibir sus cuadros, además de adquirir su propia casa, siendo esta es su máxima motivación para el trabajo persistente que Dalgi realiza día a día.
texts.en:
Dalgi, 38, is married and has two children who are 4 and 10 years of age.  She lives with her family in a very traditional neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla where music, folklore, carnivals and hard working, income generating people, form part of the culture of its residents.  In this environment she has a business called “Confecciones y Variedades Lunna” where she displays clothes that she, herself manufactures and she also sells many other products that the nearby families need like cosmetics, perfume, accessories, stationery items, etc.

Her experience in this business goes back to when she was 15 years old and her mother started her studying dressmaking and bought her her first sewing machine that she used to start making up-to-date blouses that she’d sell in the market.  She continued getting better skilled taking courses at SENA, Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (National Vocational Education Services) where she did quite well with her activity because she added t-shirt printing.  She lived there for four years.

Once she returned to the city of Barranquilla she used all her skills to relearn her business which she has to this day.  She makes and rents wedding gowns, first communion dresses, and costumes.  She’s been gradually growing acquiring fixed assets.  Lately she got display cases and started to sell notebooks, candy, clothes, women’s accessories, and cologne.  She is currently studying art and is producing paintings that she’s sold.  She considers that everyone should perfect their art through study and experimentation to open new lines of business to stay in a market like the present one that is so changeable.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials, materials and supplies to make clothes she has on order thus making this a successful investment because her experience attracts new customers thanks to the finishing touches she gives to her garments and the kind service she provides to actual and potential customers.

Her dream is to have a boutique and also a gallery to display her paintings.  She’d also like to have her own house.  This is the maximum motivation for Dalgi to keep working every day.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia de 27 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora, con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Delia se esmera por sobresalir en la vida y agradece a sus padres por brindarle educación superior, ella práctica la profesión de enfermera, trabaja en el centro de Salud San Francisco y en sus horas libres aprovecha para trabajar en las farmacias. Ella se entrega por completo a su trabajo, por que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano pudo comprarse un lote de terreno que con mucho sacrificio trata de levantar los cimientos de su vivienda. Le gusta su trabajo y estar pendiente de sus pacientes quienes la agradecen por su paciencia y trato hacia ellos. Delia con el crédito solicitado mejorará las fachadas de su vivienda.
