Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo y ahorrando sus ingresos económicos ya que tiene planificado abrir un centro medico dentro de la ciudad de San Francisco. Este es su primer crédito de Delia con MFP, se siente muy comprometida en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente por que desea acceder a otros créditos mas adelante. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados mejorará la fachada de su casa, ya que desea vivir cómodamente.
texts.en: Delia, 27, is a cheerful and hard working single woman who wants to succeed in life. she lives at home and what she wants the most is achieve a greater income in order to provide economic stability for her future family. Delia strives to excel in life and thanks her parents for providing her with the opportunity to go to college. She works as a nurse in the San Francisco Medical Center. In her free time, she works pharmacies. She is completely dedicated to her work. Thanks to her daily effort she was able to buy a plot of land. Now she is sacrificing greatly in order to build a house there. She enjoys her work treating patients who appreciate her for her patience and medical attention. With the loan she is requesting, Delia will improve her home. The plan she has in mind is to continue to grow her savings until she can open a medical center in the city of San Francisco. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very committed to make all of the payments on time so that she can receive other loans in the future. With the requested $725 she will improve the outside of her home, in order to live more comfortably.

loans.use: make home improvements

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita tiene un puesto de venta de periódicos, cd`s y peluches cerca de un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más CD`s de música de diversos estilos y películas, pues su venta ha mejorado notablemente y tiene pedidos. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciada  y tiene cuatro hijos. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Benita has a stall selling newspapers and magazines, CDs, and soft toys near a market in La Paz.  She needs this loan to increase the variety of her stock of CDs and DVDs, as her sales have been improving greatly and she has orders to fill.  She lives in her parent's house, which is located in the Achachicala zone of La Paz.  She is divorced and has four children.  This is her first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El señor Walter es maestro y los fines de semana viaja al interior el país ya que el comercializa chamarras. Estas actividades son  su fuente de ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para  el aumento de capital para comprar más chamarras de invierno debido a que la temporada de invierno ya está por comenzar en Bolivia. Vive en anticretico con su madre en una casa ubicada en la zona de San José de Yunguyo  de la ciudad de El Alto; es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en Impro.
texts.en: Mr. Walter is a teacher who travels to the interior of the country on weekends to sell jackets. These are his two sources of income. Because winter is beginning in Bolivia, he needs this loan to increase his capital in order to buy more winter jackets. He lives in an anticrético housing arrangement with his mother, in a house located in the San José de Yunguyo zone of the city of El Alto [anticrético is a common rental arrangement in Bolivia where the renter gives a lump sum loan to a property owner in exchange for housing for a specified length of time]. He is single and does not have children. This is the first time he has taken out a loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy winter jackets to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Don Domingo, tiene 66 años de edad, es originario de la comarca el Jicarito localizada en el departamento de León, el es casado, padre de 8 hijos, el se comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos pero también vende pescado.  El empezó en este negocio junto con su mama cuando el tenia 16 años de edad, su madre le regalo un cerdo para que lo reprodujera, aprendiera a criarlos y a comercializarlos después fue la venta de pescado el vende en la comarcas cercanas tales como Telica, Malpaisillo, San Antonio. Aunque el tiene muy buenos clientes en las comunidades le gustaría tener un local en el mercado de León para vender mas.
El solicito el préstamo para comprar cerdos ya que es un mes excelente para ventas.  El espera que esta inversión le ayude a obtener ganancias que le permitan seguir invirtiendo, pues desea diversificar su negocio, quiere vender maíz también. 
El tiene como planes futuros comprar mas cerdos, gallinas y  comprar cosechas de maíz y frijol. Su próxima meta es ahorrar lo suficiente y ser  comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo is 66 years old. He is originally from the district of Jicarito, located in the department of León. He is married and the father of eight children. He is a businessman who works buying and selling pigs. He also sells fish. He started this business together with his mother, when he was 16 years old. His mother gave him a pig so that he could breed it and learn to raise animals for sale. He started selling fish later.

He sells in nearby districts like Telica, Malpaisillo, and San Antonio. Although he has very good customers in these communities, he would like to have a spot at the market in León in order to sell more.

He is requesting this loan to buy pigs, as it is a very good time for sales. He hopes that this investment will help him to earn profits so that he can keep investing. He would like to diversify his business by selling corn as well. His future plans are to buy more pigs, hens, and to expand his crops to include corn and beans. After that, his goal is to save enough to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene un puesto D. venta D. comida donD. venD. almuerzos y su esposo trabaja en una empresa D. comida rápida. El crédito lo requiere para la construcción D. dos nuevas  habitaciones para vivir más confortablemente con su esposo y sus hijos. Vive en casa D. sus padres ubicada en la zona D.  Pasankeri  en la ciudad D. La Paz; es casada, tiene cuatro hijos. Es cliente D. Impro desD. el año 2009 con un excelente historial D. pagos.
texts.en: Ms. Lourdes has a food stand where she sells lunches and her husband works for a fast food business. She needs this loan to construct two new rooms so that she, her husband, and their children can live more comfortably. She lives in her parents' house, which is located in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has four children. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and has an excellent repayment history.

loans.use: to build two rooms onto her house so her four children will be more comfortable

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: Bernardino, de 35 años de edad, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, convive con Gloria de 33 años de edad y fruto de esa relación tienen 02 hijos donde viven juntos en su propia casa donde reina la paz y armonía del hogar. La labor que realiza Bernardino es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café, palillo y achiote, en total cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo. Tiene 15 años trabajando sobre sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos hasta los tendales. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas, generándole ganancias. Manifiesta además que el invierno perjudica su negocio pues abundan los insectos impidiendo el desarrollo de los frutos.  Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos. Con el crédito solicitado realizara el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como la poda y el desmonte de malezas y con el resto del dinero comprara sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Bernardino, 35, is originally from the city of San Francisco. He lives with Gloria, 33, and they have two sons from their relationship. They live together in peace and harmony in their own house. Bernardino works the land, where he grows cocoa plants, coffee, turmeric, and squash. In total, he owns four hectares of land. He is known for his hard work in the fields and has been working his own land for 15 years.

During harvest periods, he counts on the help of laborers who harvest and transport the crops to a certain point, after which they are moved by vehicle to  drying areas. He feels very satisfied with his work because thanks to his daily efforts, today he enjoys seeing that his plants are very productive and profitable. He also says that in the winter, his business suffers because there are many insects that impede the plants' development.

This is his first loan through MFP and he is grateful to the institution for allowing him this credit. He is ready to make all of his repayments punctually because he wishes to have access to more loans in the future.

He will use some of this loan to perform maintenance on his fields, such as cutting and clearing brush. He will use the rest of the money to buy sacks of fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es: Gloria Judith: de 41 años es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos los tres estudian el mayor de ellos trabaja y estudia, ella se dedica a la venta de pan ella tiene su local en la entrada de su comunidad donde vive inicio su negocio hace tres años ella nos cuenta que solicita este credito para la compra de arina para elavorar pan ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar,el sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca y en un futuro con la ayuda de Dios poder vender pollo frito y que sus hijos todos sean unos profecionales y que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Gloria Judith is 41 and a single mother of 3 children, who are students.  She makes and sells bread out of a shop in the community where she lives.  She began her bakery three years ago and seeks credit to buy flour to increase her production and profits.  Her dream is to see her business grow and expand, perhaps to include other food items such as fried chicken.  She also hopes that her children develop professional skills to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy flour for bakery production

loans.name: Karina Norma

texts.es: La señora Karina nació en el país del Perú, pero actualmente radica en Bolivia desde sus catorce años. Vive con su madre en un departamento en la zona Miraflores que se encuentra a quince minutos del centro de la cuidad de la paz. Karina se dedica a la venta de dulces, chocolates, golosinas, sándwiches y hamburguesas en un kiosco dentro de un  colegio desde hace dos años. Ella dice que se siente muy contenta de trabajar dentro el colegio ya que sus clientes son todos los estudiantes del colegio debido a que ella vende sola en el único kiosco dentro del colegio. Karina solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital en el kiosco comprando mercadería para surtir su kiosco, como ser dulces, galletas, refrescos, etc., es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Karina was born in Perú, but has lived in Bolivia since she was 14. She lives with her mother in Miraflores, just 15 mins. outside of La Paz.  For the past few years, Karina has run a shop selling sweets, chocolates, sandwiches and hamburgers from a kiosk inside a school compound. She has an ample clientele, and is the only shop selling snacks to students in the school. Karina seeks credit to buy more inventory of snacks, sweets and soft drinks.  She is a very hardworking woman and is very grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: to buy inventory of sweets and snacks such as cookies and chocolate

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Margarita de Jesus tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la colonia Victor Argeñal de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Concepcion de la ciudad de Choluteca.
Margarita es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estan adolescentes.  
Margarita se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias para irse a abrir su negocio y asi atender sus clientes ya que muchas personas comen frutas de desayuno.
Margarita cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que es motorista para cubrir los gastos del hogar y en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Margarita de Jesus is 42 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Victor Argeñal in Choluteca. She earns her living by selling fruit and vegetables at the Concepcion market in Choluteca.
Margarita has two adolescent children. 
Margarita gets up at 5 every morning to open her stall and attend to her customers, since there are many people who eat fruit for breakfast. 
Margarita relies on her husband, who is a [taxi] driver, to cover their household costs. In their free time, they go to church. 
The loan will be used to purchase fruit and vegetables for Margarita's business.

loans.use: to buy mangos, apples, grapes, minimos (guinea bananas), avocados, garlic and onions.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, de 36 años de edad, vive en el departamento de León, esta casada , es madre de familia ,tiene un hijo ella se dedica a vender , es dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Inicio en la cuando ella estaba en la universidad estudiando el tercer año, ella vendía cosméticos en la universidad y con eso pagaba sus estudios , su papa desde un inicio la ha apoyado , después poco a poco fue vendiendo ropa , jugos así  fue creciendo su negocio hasta lograr tener su Pulperia la cual esta ubicada en su casa .
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería como ropa en ocasión del día de las madres ya que es una buena temporada para mejorar sus ventas. Con esta inversión espera poder aumentar sus ganancias, hacer nuevos clientes, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Uno de sus objetivos es terminar de construir su casa, ampliar su negocio, aunque también le gustaría algún día tener su finca con  reses(vacas) para criar .
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old and lives in the department of León. She is married, with one child. She is the owner of a small local store. She began her career in sales during her third year at university, where she sold cosmetics. She used the money she earned to pay for her studies. She has been helped by her father since the beginning. Over time, she began selling clothes and games. She steadily built up her business until she was able to open the shop, which is located in her house. 
She has requested the loan to buy new merchandise, such as occasion wear for mother's day, which is a good sales period. With this investment, she hopes to increase her profits, gain new customers and improve the quality of life for her family. One of her goals is to finish the construction of her house and develop her business. One day she would love to have her own farm where she would raise cows.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise, such as occasion wear for mother's day, which is a good sales period.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos, negocio que inicio para ayudarse económicamente en el hogar, ya que tiene sus tres hijos estudiando, anteriormente trabajaba en servicio domestico, logrando dedicar todo su tiempo  a las ventas, lo que ha captado la clientela, productos que vende al contado y al crédito por catálogos.
Isabel espera poder vender más productos es por eso con este préstamo comprara: ropa variada, pantalones, camisas, trajes de niñas, y sandalias ya que tiene cosmético y invertirá solo en ropa para mejorar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias y poder cubrir sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Isabel sells clothing and cosmetics for a living, a  business she started in order to help with the household expenses.  She used to work as a domestic employee. Since her three children are in school she is able to dedicate all her time to her sales. This has helped her to build her customer base.  She sells her products on a cash and credit basis through catalogs.  

Isabel hopes to sell more products and it is for this reason that with this loan she will buy: assorted clothing, pants, shirts, girl's dresses and sandals.   Since she already has cosmetics, she will invest only in clothing to improve her sales, increase her income and be able to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing for men and women as well as sandals.

loans.name: Las Insaciables Group

texts.es:
El grupo 'Las Insaciables' está iniciando su primer ciclo en CREDITUYO y está formado por 6 vecinas que viven en la colonia Mirasol de la ciudad de Monterrey. El nombre de las Insaciables lo escogieron ya que siempre quieren superarse, nunca están conformes y siempre quieren más. La mayoría de ellas se dedican al comercio de comidas y ropa.

Tenemos el ejemplo de María Esmeralda, una de las integrantes del grupo; tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 17 años y otro de 10. María Esmeralda hace manualidades y además tiene un puesto de tacos de barbacoa en su casa con el cual saca adelante a su familia. Con el dinero del préstamo, Esmeralda quiere empezar un pequeño negocio donde pueda vender bolsitas con dulces para fiestas infantiles. Asimismo, una de sus metas a largo plazo, le gustaría recuperar su negocio de compra y venta de chatarra; el cual tuvo que abandonar por la crisis económica que afectó al país.
texts.en:
The 'Las Insaciables' (Insatiable Women) group is beginning its first loan cycle with Credituyo and is made up of six neighbors who live in Mirasol district, in the city of Monterrey.  They chose the name 'Las Insaciables' because they always want to improve themselves, they are never satisfied and they always want more.  Most of them sell food and clothes.

One of the group's members, María Esmeralda, is a good example.  She is 40 years old, married, and has two children aged 17 and 10.  María Esmeralda makes handicrafts and also has a place in her home where she sells 'tacos de barbacoa' (spicy, shredded beef tacos).  Through these businesses she gets her family ahead in life.  Esmeralda would like to use her loan money to set up a small business selling candy bags for children's parties.  One of her long-term goals is to restart her business buying and selling scrap metal which she had to abandon due to the economic crisis which hit the country.

loans.use: to invest in a new business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aminata. She is married to a businessman and has two children, aged 13 and 11 years. She has one additional dependent,  her husband’s niece, who is living with them to make it possible for her to attend a good school.  

In 2006, Aminata established her provision, drinks and toiletries business. Aminata started her business as a means of getting enough income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about 1,700,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more food and drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Aminata plans to send her children to the University of Sierra Leone. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying sand, cement and fine sand to plaster her walls and continue improving the condition of her home

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 24 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Desde muy niña aprendió las tácticas del negocio, pues trabajaba en el puesto de venta de sus padres. La educación que le dieron y algunos ahorros decidió independizarse y forjarse por si sola en el ámbito comercial. Hoy tiene su propio negocio, que consiste en comprar productos a los campesinos tales como: café, cacao, achiote, maíz y palillo, oriundos de la zona selvática; además cuenta con el apoyo de 02 trabajadores quienes se encargan de cargar y pesar los kilogramos de cada producto. Es así que con su carro recorren varias comunidades en busca de productos, una vez almacenado una buena cantidad lo vende a las empresas acopiadoras quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo de carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable, por que al margen de lo que vende las empresas le dan incentivos cada año. Las épocas de lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, son el impedimento porque obstruyen el camino y perjudican el traslado de la carga. Los planes para el futuro es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP  y esta apta a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. El  crédito solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar café, caco, maíz y achiote a los campesinos.
texts.en:
Edith is 24 years old.  She is a happy, single, hard-working, young woman that is eager to succeed in life.  She lives in her own house and what she would like most is to earn a good living so that she can give her future family financial stability.  

She started learning business strategies at a young age since she worked for her parents at their sales stand.  With the education they gave her and some savings she decided to become independent and forge ahead alone in the business sector.  Today she has her own business.  She buys products from farmers in the jungle such as coffee, cocoa, achiote [the natural pigment annatto is derived from this shrub], corn and palillo [a condiment].  She also has the help of 2 workers who are responsible for packing and weighing each product, thus allowing her to drive her car around to the various communities in search of products.  When she has a good quantity stored she sells it to middlemen who pay her a large percentage for each kilogram of product.  Her business is very profitable because apart from what she sells the middlemen give her incentives every year.  The rainy season and the landslides on the roads are a challenge because they block the roads and make delivery of the products difficult.  Her plans for the future are to continue working with the same zeal that is characteristic of her.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she is capable of making her payments on time since she wants to be able to access more credit in the future.  The loan she is requesting will give her capital to buy coffee, cocoa, corn and achiote from farmers.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, cocoa, corn and achiote from farmers.

loans.name: Puka Pukayoq Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PUKA PUKAYOQ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el Distrito de Ollantaytambo Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento del Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Genara; La socia tiene 58 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales la socia solo está con dos de sus hijos a su lado apoyándolos en sus estudios, la socia se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingreso económico en su hogar, la socia también cría animales menores y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha hecha a base de maíz amarillo; la socia lleva 30 años con este su negocio de chicha en Ollantaytambo el bellísimo y tradicional poblado; La socia  en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de maíz amarillo para la elaboración de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo. La socia Felicia no aparece en la foto porque pidio permiso para no ser fotografiada ella tuvo un pequeño accidente en carro hace tres días y está aún con ematomas en el rostro, en cuanto a las socias Lucy y Susan Ruth tienen permiso también por salud pero vinieron a la oficina en Cusco en horarios diferentes para firmar el contrato de socios. 
 
Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales menores, a la docencia, a la enfermería.
texts.en:
Genara is a member of the “Puka Pukayoq" community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Genara is 58 years old, married, and has eight children.  She currently lives with two of her children and is supporting them in their studies.  Genara's main source of income for her household is farming.  She also raises animals and makes and sells 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She has been in the chicha business for 30 years in the beautiful and traditional town of Ollantaytambo. Genara is requesting a loan to invest in buying yellow corn to make chica.  The other members of the group farm, raise animals and work as teachers and nurses.  Genara appreciates the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

Felicia does not appear in the photo because she had a small car accident three days ago and still has hematomas on her face. Lucy and Susan Ruth also asked not to be photographed for health reasons, but did come into the office in Cusco during different hours to sign the contract.

The other members work in agriculture, farming, teaching, and nursing.

loans.use: to invest in buying corn

loans.name: Duo El Praiso Group

texts.es:
Duo el Paraiso: este Grupo esta conformado Doña Margarita 45 años ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos a mano tiene ya barios años de dicarse a esta actividad, ella nos cuenta que se siente muy contento ya que pues ultimamaente sus ventas han aumentado por lo mismo solicita este credito para la compra de hilo para la confeccion de tejidos ya que tiene nuchos pedidos de sus clilentes y nececita comprar mas hilo para la confeccion de los mismos.
el otro socio se dedica a la venta de flores en la comunidad donde vive el tambien solicita este credito para la compra de flores y de la misma manera aumentar su capital,el sueño de ellos es agrandar mas su local y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Duo el Paraiso.
The first member of this group is 45 year-old Margarita who weaves products by hand.  She has been in this business for several years.  She tells us that she feels very happy because lately her sales have increased.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy thread for her weaving since she has a lot of orders from her customers and she needs to buy more thread so that she can fill them.

The other member of this group sells flowers in his community.  He is requesting a loan to buy flowers and increase his capital.  His dream is to extend his premises and enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving and to buy flowers to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El sr. Edgar, vive en alquiler  en la zona del  abra, es casado tiene 1 hijo, el Sr. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas, el lleva su mercadería a santa cruz y sucre los fines de semana, su esposa realiza también la  costura de los pantalones con dos ayudantes que tienen, trabajan juntos en la confección de prendas de vestir, el préstamo lo invertirán para la compra de telas ya que tienen un pedido que entregar, es una familia muy trabajadora con el deseo de poder tener su propia casa, ese es el deseo del Sr. Edgar para así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Edgar is married with one son and rents in the town of Abra. He works making items of clothing such as pants and shirts, and on weekends he takes his clothing to Santa Cruz and Sucre. His wife also helps to sew the pants together with two assistants who work alongside the family to make the clothing.
 
Edgar will use this loan to puchase fabric since he already has an order pending. Edgar's family are very hard working and they would like to own their own house so they could live more comfortably. Edgar is grateful to Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make jeans

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es:
Haydee, es originaria del departamento de León, tiene 58 años de edad ,esta casada , es madre de dos hijos los cuales ya son profesionales . Antes de dedicaba  a trabajar como secretaria ejecutiva ,pero después decidió dedicarse  al negocio de ventas,  cuando tenia 27 años ella tenia una tienda de zapatos, ropa y carteras. Después con ayuda de su esposo decidió vender libros ,como biblias, posters religiosos,cuadros religiosos. Con el tiempo fue creciendo su clientela poco a poco , sus libro son vendidos alrederdor de todo el departamento de Leon incluso fuera de La misma ciudad.    
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar libros, articulos religiosos. Esta inversión le ayudara a satisfacer la demanda de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, hacer nuevos clientes, ampliar su negocio. Su meta próxima es vender 5,000 unidades de libros.
texts.en:
Haydee lives in the department of León. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of two children who are already working. She had a prior job as a secretary and management assistant, but then she decided to become a store owner. She had already a store when she was 27, where she sold shoes, clothes and handbags. Later, with the help of her husband, she decided to sell books, mainly bibles, and religious posters and framed pictures. Over time, her clientele gradually grew and she sold books not only to clients living in her city, but anywhere in the department of León.

Haydee applies for a loan to buy religious books and articles. This investment will help her to meet her customers' demand, acquire new clients and expand her store. Her next goal is to sell 5,000 books.

loans.use: to buy religious books and articles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a new room for rental purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Expresso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EXPRESSO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mercedes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra de ladrillo, confección de sombreros, transporte público, venta de CD’s, trabajo de edredones, abarrotes, ropita de bebe.
 
La señora Mercedes,  indica que hace tres años que compone Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por preguntando a cerca de financieras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones, que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de su tía..

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de edredones), este material lo compra de la cuidad de Oruro y los vende a facilidad de.. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación
texts.en:
The “EXPRESSO” community bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors headed by Mercedes. The community bank's members' businesses are varied. Among them we have: purchasing bricks, making hats. public transport, selling CD’s, and selling comforters, groceries, and baby clothes. 
 
Mercedes indicates that she has been in Pro Mujer for three years, and she entered by asking about financial institutions. At this time, she has a business selling comforters. She has been doing this for two years, learning from her aunt.   The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital by buying comforters. She buys them in the city of Oruro and sells them with easy payment plans. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has four children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her answer is the trainings.

loans.use: to increase capital by buying comforters.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es un cliente antiguo de la institución  y  ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,  El Sr. Alberto cuenta con su propio taller de costura en el domicilio en el que vive, la  conyugue es quien le ayuda junto con su dos hijos a la confección de Chamarras a pedido o para la venta, la pequeña empresa empieza sus labores a las 8:00 am y la termina a  las 22:00 pm, las ventas las realizan en la cuidad de Oruro-Bolivia por tener un mercado concurrido y que la competencia no es tan reñida,  con el dinero del crédito comprara telas y forros para la confección de Chamarras, el mayor sueño de la familia es llegar a tener un  patrimonio estable y que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerzan en lograrlo día a día, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Alberto is an old client of this institution, and has a good record for repayments and a kind demeanor. Mr. Alberto has his own dressmaking workshop in his home. He works with the help of his wife and two children, and they make jackets to order or for sale. They begin working in their small workshop at 8:00 am, and finish their work at 10:00 pm. They sell their goods in the city of Oruro-Bolivia because it has a busy market and there is little competition. With the money from the loan, he will buy fabric and lining to make jackets. The family’s biggest dream is to have stable assets, and to have their children have professional careers. Because of this, they work hard every day. Mr. Alberto is thankful that the institution offers them support.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and lining to make jackets

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri de 49 años de edad, esta casada con Esteban de 51 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicado en el distrito de  Kimbiri. Julia, se dedica al negocio, en su puesto de ventas vende refrescos de fruta, propias de la zona de donde vive, del mismo modo vende frutas variadas como: plátano, mango, piña, pacay y frutos cítricos. Por otro lado percibe ingresos en la venta de panes, en donde los expende en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Kimbiri con la ayuda de sus hijos. Julia, sabe administrar su tiempo, empieza desde la madruga, a las 04 de la mañana se  dirige a la panadería a recoger los panes,  para luego ser vendidos en la calle, donde se establece en alguna esquina para expenderlos. Luego se dirige a su puesto de venta de frutas, donde vende también sus refrescos. Han transcurrido 15 años, y gracias a estos trabajos pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y completar con su educación Sus planes para el futuro es abrir una fuente de soda, y poder ganar más dinero. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y asegura que no dejará de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente agradece a la institución por cederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará frutas variadas para su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Julia, a native of the city of Kimbiri, is 49 years old. She is married to Esteban, age 51, and they have 3 children. They live in their own house located in the district of Kimbiri.

Julia has a business. In her stall she sells fruit drinks made from fruit grown in the area where she lives. She also sells local fruits such as bananas, mangos, pineapples, and citrus fruits. In addition, she receives income from selling breads. With help from her children she sells in the central zone of the city of Kimbiri.

Julia knows how to manage her time. She begins her day very early in the morning. At 4:00 a.m. she goes to the bakery to collect bread which she will later sell in the street on a corner where establishes herself for making these sales. Later, she goes to her fruit selling stall where she also sells drinks. She has been doing this for 15 years, and, thanks to these jobs, her children have progressed and finished their education. Her plans for the future are to open a soda fountain and to earn more money.

This is Julia’s sixth loan with MFP and she will be sure to make her payments on time. She is grateful to the institution for giving her the loan. With the loan applied for she will purchase various fruits to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Johana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Johana, habita en el municipio de San Ignacio , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una compañía privada para poder compartir los gastos del hogar ya que tienen   dos hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder darles un mejor bienestar a su pequeños y apoyarlos siempre en sus estudios , doña Johana desde hace doce años se dedica a  la agricultura , especialmente en la siembra de piña , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas de roedores teniendo un 10 % de pérdida .

Ella necesita un financiamiento para poder brindar un mantenimiento al cultivo y no cuenta con un capital suficiente para realizar la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para poder aplicar , teniendo como resultado una fruta de muy buena maduración , color y sabor .
texts.en:
Mrs. Johana lives in the town of San Ignacio together with her husband who works for a private firm.  They share household expenses and have two children in their care.  Their future plans include providing a better wellbeing for the little ones and always support their schooling.

Johana has farmed for over 12 years, especially pineapples.  The greatest difficulty she faces is rodent infestations that produce a 10% loss.

She needs financing to provide care for the crops and lacks sufficient capital to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to them that will result in a very good, ripe fruit with good color and flavor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming supplies.

loans.name: Ccori Chuspa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “CCORI CHUSPA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mabel; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda de abarrotes en el bello valle sagrado de los inkas, la socia tiene una tienda en la parte baja de sus casa y ella vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y los complementa con algunos útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, reglas, cartulinas, papeles entre otros. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales menores, a la docencia, a la enfermería. 
La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mabel, 42, is a member of the “CCORI CHUSPA” communal bank located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  She is married and has three children.  She alternates her household chores with tending to her grocery store in the beautiful Sacred Valley of the Incas.  She has a store on the ground floor of her house where she sells all sorts of basic need items to which she’s added such things as school supplies like notebooks, mechanical pencils, erasers, rulers, construction paper and paper, among others.  She wants the loan to buy basic need items.

The other members are farmers, raise small farm animals, teach or are in nursing.

Mabel appreciates the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and work tools.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, es originaria del departamento de León , esta casada , es madre de 4 hijos , ella es dueña de un negocio de un auto lavado, lleva 8 años en este negocio. Inicio en esta actividad por sugerencia de uno de sus hijos ya el trabajo en Costa Rica en un negocio de auto lavados y vio que era rentable para ponerlo en casa , la necesidad económica y las pocas oportunidades de trabajo llevo a doña Juana a decidirse a poner este negocio con el apoyo de sus hijos que trabajan en Costa Rica y los ingresos de su esposo en conjunto lograron iniciar este negocio. Anteriormente doña Juana se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios  estos productos los compraba en Honduras, su segundo negocio fue una comideria, la cual no continúo por problemas de salud. Su otra fue de ingresos es el salario de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil.  
Ella solicito préstamo para comprar material de construcción como cemento, zinc, perlin, otros materiales que le permitan reparar y mejorar su negocio. Con este crédito espera mejorar las condiciones del local, atención al cliente  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Tiene entre sus planes instalar un televisor para entretenimiento del cliente mientas le lavan el vehículo, también colocar un exhibidor de bebidas así ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su meta próxima es comprar un taxi  ,para ponerlo a trabajar ,tener otra fuente de ingresos ,mejorar la condiciones económicas de su familia .
texts.en:
Juana lives in the department of León. She is married and the mother of four children. She has owned a car wash business for the past eight years. She started this activity because a child of hers, who lived in Costa Rica and worked there in a car wash business, saw that it was a profitable activity to have at home and suggested it to her. Due to economic hardship and scarce job opportunities, Juana decided to launch this business with the help of her children who worked in Costa Rica. Her husband invested some money from his salary in the business.

Previously, Juana had a general store, where she sold clothes, shoes and other accessories which she imported from Honduras. Her second business was a snack bar, which she could not keep due to health issues. The other family income was the salary of her husband who is a bricklayer.

Juana applies for this loan to buy construction materials, such as cement, zinc sheets, purlins etc., to renovate and improve her premises. Thanks to this loan, she hopes to offer better service to her customers and improve the quality of life of her family.

She has a few plans to improve client service: a TV to keep her customers entertained while they wait to have their car washed, and a showcase for drinks. Her next goal is to buy a taxi and thus get another source of income to improve the economic situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, zinc sheets, purlins etc., to repair and improve her car wash business.

loans.name: Duo Panminab'ey Group

texts.es: Duo Panminab'ey:este grupo esta formado por dos señoras las cuales se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos y fajas, nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque le ha hido bien en su negocio y le pide a Dios que fape le pueda ayudar con este credito ya que pues nececita mas capital para trabajar esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos y de la misma manera aumentar su ganancias,Vilma yolanda tambien se dedica a la Cofeccion de guipiles y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima, el sueño de ellas es tener un local y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Duo Panminab'ey
This group is made up of two ladies who make woven products and belts.  One of the ladies tells us that she is very happy because she has done well in her business and she asks God that FAPE be able to help her with this loan since she needs more capital to carry out her work.  She is requesting the loan to buy raw materials for making her woven products.  In this way, she will increase her profits.  Vilma Yolanda also makes 'guipiles' (traditional blouses or tunics) and she is requesting this loan to buy raw materials.  Her dream is to own business premises and to sell her products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Fortaleza Cruz Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA CRUZ DEL SUR” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Marivel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Maribel,  indica que es la primera vez que participa en asociaciones comunales en Pro Mujer, ingresando por la promoción que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que aprendió de su abuela.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería para su tienda (aceite, azúcar, arroz, etc.) artículos que comprará de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones por que aprendo.
texts.en:
The “FORTALEZA CRUZ DEL SUR” (Strength Southern Cross) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing body headed by Maribel.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses.  Among them are: neighborhood store, commerce, production and service.

Maribel indicates that this is the first time she’s participated in communal associations in Pro Mujer.  She joined thanks to promotional activities that took place in her area.  She currently has a neighborhood store that she learned from her grandmother.

The loan she will take out now is to buy merchandise for her store (oil, sugar, rice, etc.)  She will buy these items in La Ceja (commercial zone of the city of El Alto).  This way of working allows her to earn income to support her family someway since she’s single and has a son.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training because she learned.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ruth tiene su pequeño negocio una mini pulpería, así como la venta de leña y frijoles cocidos, pues lleva siete años apoyando  a su familia, su esposo trabaja la tierra, trabajando en la agricultura.
Inicio con pocos productos, lo que ha mantenido rotando que es los granos básicos que más se venden, lo que busca alternativa para la inversión y es mediante el préstamo que comienza a invertir a si como pequeñas mejora  a su vivienda.
Con el préstamo anterior logro reparar la mitad del techo poniendo zinc nuevo y la otra parte la invirtió en productos.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo será destinado únicamente en la terminación completa del techo, comprando láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, y hacer la mejora.
texts.en:
Ruth has run a small grocery store selling wood and cooked beans for seven years to support her family. Her husband works on the land in agriculture.

Ruth began her store with just a few products and a constant turn over of staple grains and pulses, the items that she sells the most. Now she is looking for another way to supplement her income through this loan so she can make some small home improvements.

With her previous loan Ruth was able to repair half of her roof by applying a new layer of zinc and spending the other half of the loan on products for her store. She will use this new loan to completely finish her roof by purchasing sheets of zinc, timber and nails to carry out the renovation.

loans.use: to completely replace her roof by purchasing sheets of zinc, timber and nails to carry out the renovation

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí de 25 años, es una joven soltera y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Ella es comerciante y tiene un puesto de ventas donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su establecimiento es muy concurrido por sus clientes, es así que lo abre desde muy temprano para recibir a sus compradores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 05 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias y ampliar su puesto de ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Noemí, 25, is a hard-working young woman, on her own and struggling to get ahead in the world.  She lives in a house that she owns and what she most wants is a steady income so that she can help to provide for the family she hopes to have one day.  She operates a corner shop where she sells everyday necessities.  Her customers come to the shop over and over and she opens early to meet them.  Talking to her customers is what she likes most about the business.  She's operated the shop for 5 years and says that the thing she likes least about running it is being on her feet all day.  She wants to expand the range of products she sells and increase her income.  This is Noemi's first MFP loan and she knows that it will help her develop her business.  She is grateful to the bank for extending the loan and she will use it to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Patricia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Patricia M. , tiene la edad de 32 años , habitante del municipio de Nindiri, junto a su compañero de vida el cual trabaja para apoyarla con  los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos que estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejor las condiciones de vida ,y construir en su totalidad su vivienda de bloques para poder vivir  mejor , doña Fátima desde hace doce años labora como agricultura , en la siembra de Yuca , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es la falta de agua  , el crédito lo quiere para materiales de siembra tales como , postes , madera de yuca para el cultivo , fertilizantes e insumos .Principalmente la preparación de la tierra .
texts.en: Sra. Patricia M., 32, lives in the town of Nindiri with her partner, a worker, with whom she shares the family's expenses.  They have two children, both still in elementary school.  Sra. Patricia wants to improve the lives of her family and, among other plans, wants to build a better, more solid house.  She has made her living from farming for twelve years.  Her biggest challenge is a lack of water.  She is applying for a loan now so that she can buy supplies for her next crop: wooden posts, fertilizers and the other supplies that she needs to prepare her farm for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Ingrid Janeth

texts.es:
INGRID JANETH 
La señora   Ingrid   tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. se  dedica a la venta de sandalias  y joyas de fantasía  ella inicio hace 2 años  de manera ambulante en el mercado Local de su comunidad  ahora ella tiene el deseo de seguir superando en su negocio  con la ayuda de su esposo   han tratado de colocar un local donde ella vive pero aun falta todavía el techo para su local, y algunas cosas para  variar su mercadería y tener  más tipos  de numeración y estilo de sandalias  su mayor sueño ahora es  poder terminar su local   para poder atender a su clientela en su localidad    y con mayor comodidad   y así ya no salir a vender  de  manera ambulante.
texts.en:
INGRID JANETH 
Ingrid has two dependent children.  Her business is selling sandals and costume jewelry.  She started her business two years ago, making her sales as an itinerant street vendor in the local market in her community.  Ingrid would like to continue making progress in her business.  With the help of her husband, she has tried to set up sales premises where she lives.  However, she is still lacking a roof for her premises and some more products so that she can vary her merchandise and have different sizes and styles of sandals available.

Ingrid's biggest dream is to finish building her premises so that she can serve her customers in her town more comfortably.  This will mean that she will no longer have to go out and sell her products on the streets.

loans.use: to buy sandals to sell

loans.name: Betania Liset

texts.es:
Betania, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, madres de dos hijos, ella es originaria de la comarca Telica ubicada en el departamento de León, de oficio comerciante ella se dedica a vender ropa, es dueña de una pulpería también. Ella empezó vendiendo dulces con el dinero que su esposo el daba, así fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr obtener su pulpería, esta fuente de ingreso le ha sido de mucha ayuda, mantiene a sus hijos, paga sus gastos ayuda su esposo para mantener el hogar.
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, granos básicos y productos nuevos para abastecer su pulpería. Con esta inversión espera poder atraer mas clientes, mejorar sus ventas, incrementar sus ganancias. Pues ella desea convertir su pulpería en una gran distribuidora en su localidad esta sera su principal meta así como, reparar su casa.
texts.en:
Betania, 39, is a native of Telica in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon.  She is married and has two children.  She sells clothing for a living and also owns a general store.  She only sold candy at first, using money that she got from her husband, but she slowly built the store, investing her savings and adding new products when she could.  The store has become an important source of income for the family, helping Betania and her husband provide for their children and pay for everday expenses.  
Betania is applying for a loan now to buy merchandise that she will resell: clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and products to stock her general store.  She expects the investment to help her attract more customers and, in turn, increase her sales and income.  She would like to build a wholesale business one day.  She also wants to fix up her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her general store.

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Brunilda, tiene la edad de 58 años habita en el municipio Nindiri, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tienen nueve hijos todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Brunilda desde hace veinte años se dedica al cultivo de yuca, la mayor afectación son las plagas que invaden el cultivo ya que este careces de  fertilizantes,  ella con el  financiamiento quiere comprar materiales vegetativos, fertilizantes e insumos para lograr una producción de calidad y puedan pagar un buen precio .
texts.en: Brunilda is 58 years old and lives in the municipality of Nindiri with her husband who helps her with the farming tasks.  They have nine children, all of whom are independent.  Her plan for her family is to be able to improve their living conditions.  Brunilda has worked growing yucca for the past twenty years.  The greatest difficulty is the pests that invade her crops as they lack fertilizer.  With the loan, she wants to buy vegetative materials, fertilizers and supplies in order to have a good-quality production and sell the crops at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosalbina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene  46  años  y es madre de 04  hijos,  una  mujer  y tres varones. Tres  de ellos cursan estudios superiores  y una  secundaria.

Con seguridad y gran entrega decide desde muy pequeña  iniciarse   en la venta  de abarrotes, actividad que le impedía dedicar más tiempo a sus hijos siendo aun estos pequeños por lo que decide cambiar por la venta de refrigerios siendo  su capital de inicio fue de S/ 100.00  nuevos soles, actualmente la atención a su clientela lo comparte con sus hijos,  quienes asisten diariamente a consumir los productos que ofrece preparados con muy buena sazón.   

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como maíz choclo, mote, aceite, carne de pollo y de cerdo, huevos, aceitunas, sal y especies que utiliza en la preparación de tamales y humitas que prepara diariamente para su venta.    Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de  verduras y frutas de la región para la preparación de ensaladas, jugos y refrescos para acompañar el refrigerio. 

Rosalbina,  siempre está contenta y con ganas de seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y su familia  hasta convertir su  hogar en un gran restaurant  para poder vender comida tipo menú  a diario. Está Agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir  con el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is a member of the ‘Las Margaritas II’ Communal Bank located in the District of La Banda de Shilcayo within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, single, and is the mother of four children – one daughter and three sons. Three of her children are completing post-secondary studies and one is in high school.

With confidence and great dedication, she decided to start selling groceries at a young age, a job that prevented her from spending more time with her children when they were young. As a result, she decided to change to selling refreshments, starting with 100 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. She currently works with her children tending to her customers who come to eat her good flavored products on a daily basis.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will buy supplies such as corn, boiled wheat, oil, chicken and pork, eggs, olives, salt and spices that she uses to make tamales and humitas (a dish similar to the tamale) to sell on a daily basis. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of regional vegetables and fruits to make salads, juices and refreshments to accompany the food.

Rosalbina is always happy and wants to continue working in order to get her children and family ahead in life. She wants to make her home into a large restaurant in order to be able to sell a daily set menu. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support provided to help her fulfill her dream.

loans.use: buy supplies such as corn, boiled wheat, oil, chicken and pork, eggs, olives, salt and spices, as well as regional vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Sussy

texts.es:
La Sra. Sussy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años y dos  hijos en edad escolar  

Estudió alta costura y diseño de modas, por  iniciativa propia y con el apoyo de sus cónyuge   hace 13 años se dedica a la costura, su capital de inicio fue  de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles. Sus clientes son los trabajadores de  instituciones públicas, privadas,  vecinos, amigos y familiares.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  telas en fardos de diferentes colores y diseños variados,   hilos de coser, agujas, entre otros materiales  para continuar dando un servicio  de calidad a sus clientes. 

Sussy  se considera una mujer emprendedora, su sueño es contar con una empresa de la alta costura.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sussy is a member of the ‘Virgen de la Inmaculada’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 32 years old, single, and has two school-aged children.

She studied haute couture and fashion design. As a result of her own initiative and the support of her husband, she has worked in sewing for 13 years, starting with 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. Her customers are employees of public and private institutions, neighbors, friends and relatives.

With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase bundles of fabrics in different colors and designs, sewing thread, needles, and other materials to continue providing quality service to her customers.

Sussy considers herself to be an enterprising woman and her dream is to have a high fashion business. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to improve and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fabrics in different colors and designs, sewing thread, needles, and other materials.

loans.name: Rofelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Rofelia  , pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 43  años, tiene tres pequeños hijos que estudian en la Escuela Primaria a quienes ella brinda todo su amor. 
.   
Su  negocio lo inicio hace  tres años con la venta de  DVDs  (Discos con películas)   con un capital de inicio de  S/ 300.00 nuevos soles,   acondicionándolos en su propia casa a la que acuden diariamente sus  clientes quienes gustas de las últimas películas de ficción, de artes marciales, de acción, románticas entre otros. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00, comprara  DVDs al por mayor, además  tiene pensado comprar ropa para damas y caballeros  para ofrecer a sus clientes que asisten a su negocio.

Rofelia   se considera una mujer muy trabajadora  es por eso que tiene como sueño contar con un local grande y bien bonito en su propia casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Rofelia is a member of the ‘Las Margaritas II’ Communal Bank, located in the District of La Banda de Shilcayo within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 43 years old and has three young children who are in elementary school and to whom she provides all of her love.

She started her business three years ago selling DVDs with 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. She set up her business in her house, where her customers interested in the latest movies in fiction, martial arts, action, romance, etc. come daily.

With this loan of 1,400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase DVDs at wholesale. In addition, she plans to buy women’s and men’s clothing to sell to the customers that come to her business.

Rofelia considers herself to be a very hardworking woman. As a result, she dreams of having a large and attractive store in her house. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to improve in the area in which they work.

loans.use: to buy DVDs at wholesale.

loans.name: Duo Esmeraldas De Tecpan Group

texts.es: Duo Esmeraldas de Tecpan: Este grupo esta formado por dos señoras,Maria Rosa se dedica al fabricacion de chocolates desde ahce  ya barios años ella tiene tres hijos mayores de edad que aun no se han graduado ella fabrica chocolates y jaleas de diferentes frutas naturales ella entraga pedidos en diferentes municipios ella nos cuenta que su negocio ha mejorado desde que le dieron el credito anterior ella nos cuenta que sus ganacias mejoraron y que ella se siente realizada ya que es un gran apoyo para su familia esta muy agradecida con Dios por las bendiciones que el le a concedido y tambien muy agradecida con Fape por el apoyo brindado atravez de los creditos ella solicita este credito para la compra de frutas para elavorar jalea y chocolates el sueño mas grande de ella es agr4andar su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean personas de bien,la siguiente socia solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para dama ya que ella tabien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y nececita capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
This group, “Duo Esmeraldas de Tecpan”, is composed of two women. Maria Rosa has been making chocolates for several years. She has 3 older children who have not graduated as yet. She makes chocolates and jelly from different natural fruits. Maria Rosa fulfills orders from several municipalities. She reports that her business has improved since receiving her last loan. She is sure that her earnings will continue to improve and she feels fulfilled since this is a real help for her family. Maria Rosa is very grateful to God for the blessings she has received and also, very grateful to Fape for the help it offers by means of these loans. 

The loan will be used to buy fruits for making jellies as well as chocolates. Rosa Maria's greatest dreams are to expand her business and for her children to continue their studies and become good people.

The second group member solicits this loan to purchase ladies' cosmetics. In addition to working with Maria Rosa, she sells cosmetics and needs to invest in order to work.

loans.use: to buy fruits for making jelly, and chocolates,and to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Creativas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 31años y dos hijas que estudian en un colegio primario. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche, (comida preparada a base de pescado fresco, limón, ají y sal) que ofrece los días domingos de cada semana con el apoyo de su pareja y sus hijas; su capital de inicio fue de S/ 200.00  nuevos soles, el  trabajo que desarrolla le brinda muchas satisfacciones, siendo sus   principales consumidores  transeúntes, vecinos y amigos.

Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación del cebiche como: pescado fresco  de la costa,  limón, sal, ají, cebolla, entre otras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de cebada y frutas de la región para la preparación de refrescos que acompañan a este sabroso plato. 

Lucila es muy alegre y trabajadora, su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida al paso) para vender por las noches en su localidad. Está agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir con la realización de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the ‘Las Creativas II’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 31 years old, single, and has two children in elementary school.

She works selling ceviche (a dish prepared using raw fish, lemon, hot pepper and salt) every Sunday with her partner and her daughters. She started with 200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. Her work is very satisfying for her and her main customers are people passing by, neighbors and friends.

With this loan of 800 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase supplies for making ceviche such as fresh fish from the coast, lemon, salt, hot pepper, onion, and other items. She will also invest part of the loan in barley and regional fruit to make drinks to accompany the delicious ceviche.

Lucila is very happy and hardworking. Her dream is to have a business selling hot dogs at night in her area. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support provided so that she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fresh fish from the coast, lemons, salt, hot peppers, onions, toasted corn, yucca and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La Sra. Diomith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen  de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada y tiene 02 hijos en edad escolar.

La idea  del negocio nace  con la ayuda  de su hermana, ella le inserta en  la venta de cosméticos.  Su préstamo inicial fue  de S / 600.00 nuevos soles, buscando con ello   generar sus propios ingresos y así  apoyar en la economía de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00, comprará más cosméticos tales como lápiz labiales, talcos de cuerpo, perfumes, colonias y además de ello joyería sortijas, gargantillas, relojes, pulseras, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes  que son a su vez amigos, familiares y trabajadores de diversas instituciones públicas y privadas,  
 
Diomith, mujer  trabajadora,  se siente muy  contenta  por la realización de sus ideas y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Diomith is a member of the ‘Virgen de la Inmaculada’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is married and has two school-aged children.

The idea for her business came from the help of her sister, who got her into cosmetics sales. Her first loan was for 600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) so that she could generate her own earnings and contribute to her household’s finances.

With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase more cosmetics like lip liner, body powder, perfume, sprays and jewelry like rings, necklaces, watches, and bracelets in order to provide better service to her customers who include friends, relatives and employees of various public and private institutions.

Diomith is a hardworking woman and she is happy for making her ideas a reality. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to grow.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like lip liner, body powder, perfume, sprays and jewelry like rings, necklaces, watches, and bracelets.

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
La Sra.  Dona pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 57 años y tiene tres hijos; todos ya cuentan con familia propia.

Inicia su pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad  con un capital de S/200.00 nuevos soles; haciéndose muy rápidamente de muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención,  lo que le permitió ampliar su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1 500.00, comprará  y surtirá con mas  productos su negocio, comprará racimos de plátanos, sacos de azúcar, arroz, paquetes de fideos, jabas de huevos así como insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.


Dona es una mujer emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un Mini Market está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella, a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dona is a member of the ‘Virgen de la Inmaculada’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 57 years old, married, and has three children who all have their own family now.

She started her small business selling groceries and basic needs items with 200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. She created a very good customer base quickly due to her charisma and good service, thus allowing her to expand her business.

With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase more products for her business such as bunches of bananas, sacks of sugar, rice, packages of pasta, crates of eggs, as well as supplies for personal hygiene and household cleaning, packs of soda and other products in order to provide good service to her customers.

Dona is an enterprising woman and her dream is to have a mini-market. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy bunches of bananas, sacks of sugar, rice, packages of pasta, crates of eggs, personal hygiene and household cleaning supplies, packs of soda and other products.

loans.name: Gema Consuelo

texts.es:
La Sra. Gema Consuelo pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada y tiene 52 años. 

Desde  muy joven su afición hacia la costura le lleva a estudiar alta costura y diseño de modas. En el año de 1991 cesa de laborar como docente y se dedica de lleno como a trabajar como modista, se inicio con la confección de ropa interior para damas y caballeros y salía a vender en las tiendas del Distrito del Tarapoto haciéndose conocida y de esta forma ella logra establecer su negocio en su domicilio donde elabora uniformes  para trabajadores de entidades públicas y privadas por pedido. Actualmente su actividad está más dirigida a la elaboración de ropa de cama como: sábanas, cubrecamas y fundas de almohadas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  telas especiales para el diseño de los juegos de sábanas y cubrecama, hilos de coser, agujas, para continuar dando un servicio  de calidad a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Gema se considera una mujer exitosa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gema Consuelo is a member of the ‘Virgen de la Inmaculada’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old and divorced.

At a young age, her love for sewing brought her to study haute couture and fashion design. In 1991, she stopped working as a teacher and completely dedicated herself to working as a stylist. She started by making underwear for men and women and sold them to stores in the District of Tarapoto, making herself well-known. As a result, she was able to establish a business at her house where she makes uniforms by request for employees of public and private institutions. Currently, her work is more oriented towards making bed linens like sheets, bedspreads and pillowcases.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase special fabrics for making sheet sets and bedpsreads, thread and needles to continue providing quality service to her customers.

Gema considers herself to be a successful woman and she is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy special fabrics for making sheet sets and bedpsreads, thread and needles.

loans.name: Arturo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Arturo, tiene la edad de 41 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su compañera de vida , la cual labora como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tres hijos , todos independientes y casados los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , don Arturo desde hace nueve años se dedica a trabajar el cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es las malezas y enfermedades que atacan al cultivo   por falta de insecticidas, fertilizantes e insumos . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Arturo is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his life partner who works in domestic services in order to help him with the household expenses.  They have three children who are independent and married.  His future plan for his family is to be able to improve their living conditions.  Arturo has worked growing pineapple for the past nine years and the greatest difficulties he faces are weeds and diseases that attack his crops due to the lack of insecticides, fertilizers and supplies.  He wants the loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a licensed massage therapist with 18 years of industry experience. He works with a wide variety of patients, such as people suffering from muscle-skeletal diseases like Parkinson’s and muscular dystrophy, as well as people recovering from injuries sustained in severe accidents. He also helps people suffering from occupationally-induced pain and general wear and tear. In addition to using massage therapy to alleviate patients’ pain, David gets to the root of the problem by teaching them therapeutic exercises that help cure the underlying issues causing the pain. For example, he helps patients correct their gait and posture to avoid further joint or ligament damage, and works with them on increasing muscle strength around areas of injury or irritation.

David says that even as a small child, he had the ability to ease pain. He describes it as having a natural “therapeutic touch” that people’s bodies respond to. Growing up, he would massage relatives complaining of pain as well as injured pets. Before deciding to start his own business in 1996, David had attained his license and worked with a chiropractor for four years. David says that his decision to start his own business came from him wanting to challenge himself personally and find his own path.  

David is using this loan to buy tables and chairs for his business, as well as to increase his marketing efforts. Until now, he has advertised through fliers and networking. He collaborates with another massage therapist in leading seminars that educate people about the benefits of natural healing. He also visits many businesses in the greater-El Paso area to let people know of his services.  

“At some point, all of us will need some kind of hands-on work,” David explains. Though David likes marketing his business on a personal level, he recognizes its limitations and feels the need to move into media with a larger impact. “Every day I reach out to individuals,” David explains, “but with the internet I want to reach out to more groups.” He is currently in the process of building a website and is also developing educational CDs that talk about the benefits of massage therapy.

loans.use: to pay for marketing, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto, tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del cultivo , ellos tienen cuatro hijos , todos trabajan y son independientes , los planes hacia un futuro es poder  proteger de animales su pequeña y humilde finca cercado todo el perímetro que cobre el terreno ya que estos le dañan el cultivo , don Roberto desde hace veinte y cinco años labora como agricultor de piña , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta en no poder contar el capital suficiente para darle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo .El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para realizar aplicaciones y obtener producto de muy buena calidad
texts.en: Roberto is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife who helps him care for the crops.  They have four children, all of whom work and are independent.
