His future plan is to be able to protect his small and humble farm from animals that damage his crops by installing a fence around the perimeter of the land.  Roberto has worked as a pineapple farmer for 25 years and the greatest difficulty he faces is not having enough money to provide good maintenance to his crops.  He wants the loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crops and obtain a very good-quality product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Georgina

texts.es: Rosa madre soltera sus hijos estudian, le ha tocado salir adelante con su humilde trabajo, le han permitido un de su hijos trabajar medio tiempo siendo un ingreso a su hogar. Su proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Trabaja como domestica desde hace un tiempo. Por lo poco que obtiene de salario no ha podido poner en práctica el proyecto. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción cemento, arena, láminas, de zinc, alambre, piedrines, bloques, piedras canteras entre otros. Obteniendo mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en: Rosa is a single mother who has a humble job as a housekeeper, which allows her to support her children, who are students.  She seeks this credit in order to make needed housing improvements. Her modest salary has not allowed her to make housing repairs thus far, but with a loan she plans to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting, wire, blocks, stones, and other items to make repairs, allowing her to live in greater comfort and security.

loans.use: to make housing improvements

loans.name: Ramiro José

texts.es: El señor Ramiro tiene la edad 50 años , habitan en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tienen un hijo mayor de edad e independiente ; los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar la cocina ya que la que actualmente está muy viejita y se le hace incomodo a su esposa estar cocinando el pan de cada día , don Ramiro desde hace veinte cinco años trabaja al campo , la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo de piña son las plagas que le  invaden ya que este carece de un mantenimiento adecuado , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para darle una mejor vida a su cultivo de piña y pueda ser una producción  rentable  .
texts.en:
Sr. Ramiro is 50 years old and resides in the town of Ticuantepe.  He and his wife, a fruit and vegetable merchant, work together to cover the household expenses.  They have an adult son who is independent.  

His plans for his family include improving their kitchen which is currently outdated.  His wife does not have enough room for preparing the daily meals.  Don Ramiro has worked as a farmer for 25 years.  The greatest challenge he has faced in growing pineapple has been dealing with pests that have invaded his fields and prevented him from providing adequate maintenance.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and supplies in order to provide better conditions for his pineapple crop and promote a profitable harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Yelna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Yelna, tiene la edad de 44 años , habita en el municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen cinco hijos todos ya independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder compra un camioneta para no tener que estar pagando transporte cada vez que sale la producción y se tiene que llevar al mercado para realizar su venta de piña , doña Yelna desde hace quince años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación son las cenizas del volcán que le ocasiona  pérdidas  ya que esta quema las plantas de piña por falta de exfoliación , fertilizantes e insumos. El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para poder realizar aplicación al cultivo.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelna is 44 years old and resides in the town of Concepción.  She and her husband work together as fruit and vegetable merchants in order to cover their household expenses.  They have five children, all of whom are independent.  

Her plans for her family are to improve the living conditions and to buy a truck so that she does not have to pay transportation costs for each harvest.  Yelna transports pineapples to the market so that she can sell them.  

Doña Yelna has been cultivating pineapple for fifteen years.  The greatest challenge she faces is dealing with ash from a volcano that has resulted in occasional crop loss.  The chemicals from the volcanic ash cause the leaves of her pineapple plants to fall off.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and supplies that she needs to maintain her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies to maintain her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Francisco Salomon

texts.es: El señor Francisco, tiene la edad de 24 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe,  junto a su compañera de vida la cual es ama de casa y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , al mismo tiempo se encarga de vender el producto cuando está listo para ser vendido , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar la vivienda donde actualmente habitan , don Francisco desde hace doce años se dedica a trabajos de campos , la mayor afectación es que no cuenta con un capital disponible para poder inducir su cultivo de piña . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 24 years old and resides in the town of Ticuantepe.  His life partner is a homemaker who handles the chores and takes charge of selling their products when they are ready to be sold.  

His plans for their family include improving their existing home.  Don Francisco has been farming for twelve years.  His greatest challenge has been not having enough available capital for maintaining his pineapple crop.  This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Ever José

texts.es: El señor Ever, tiene la edad de 49 años , habitante del municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales estudian su secundaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder apoyar siempre a sus hijos en sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales y personas de bien  , don Ever desde hace seis años labora como docente en una escuelita publica del sector , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción ya que él quiere terminar de construir un baño por que el actual está muy deteriorado . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. Ever is 49 years old and resides in the town of Nidirí.  He and his wife, who works as a merchant, help each other with the household expenses.  They have two children who are high school students.  

His plans for the future include continuing to support his children with their studies so that they can become professionals and successful individuals.  Don Ever has worked six years as a teacher at a local school.  The greatest challenge that he faces is not having enough money from his salary to make a one-time purchase of construction materials needed to complete the renovation of a bathroom that is currently in disrepair.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy these construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for renovating a bathroom.

loans.name: Elcira Pepita

texts.es:
Elcira  tiene 53 años de edad,  tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya son independientes  ella vive con su esposo en una localidad de Coretal II, en  el distrito de Guadalupe, en la Libertad.

Elcira cuenta  con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual atiende ella misma.   Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona productos lácteos, haci como también productos de primera necesidad , abarrotes, frutas y gaseosas que le genera ingresos para sus gastos framiliares.   El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores, especialmente ovejas y aves, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio los  alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside.

Ella desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para sus aves y ovejas, ya que la demanda aumentado en estos últimos tiempos.  Erlita espera obtener mejores resultados en su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.

Ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia., cuenta con muy buenas referencias, las personas de su localidad la reconocen como una mujer trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Elcira is 53 years old.  She has seven children who all now live independently.  Elcira lives with her husband in Coretal II, in Guadalupe district, in La Libertad.

Elcira has a small grocery store in her home where she works.  She offers her neighbors and local customers dairy products and also basic household products, groceries, fruit and soda which makes her income with which to cover her family expenses.  Her business is very popular.  Elcira also raises animals, especially sheep and birds, in some pens which are located near her home.  She feeds them grain and natural pasture.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who frequently visit her area.

Elcira would like to acquire balanced feed for her birds and sheep since her demand has increased recently.  She hopes to obtain better results in her business and so has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Elcira helps her husband to financially support their family.  She has very good references.  People from her town recognize her as a hard-working and responsible woman.

loans.use: to acquire balanced feed for her birds and sheep

loans.name: Jerick Jose

texts.es: El señor Jerick, tiene la edad de 32 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como domestica en una casa privada para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes futuros es poder terminar de construir un muro de la vivienda ya que este solo tiene dos filas de piedras y lo demás es maya ; los niños de un colegio cercano lo han destruido poco a poco y sus sueños es poder hacerlo todo de piedra ,don Jerick desde hace tiempo labora como Jardinero en una casa privada , lo cual su salario no le ajusta para poder realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de construcción , se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva siendo él una persona humilde y de bajos recursos .
texts.en:
Mr. Jerick 32 years old and resides in the town of Ticuantepe.  He and his wife, who works as a housekeeper at a private residence, help each other with the household expenses.  They have dependent children.  

His plans for the future include finishing the construction of a wall around his house.  There are only two rows of stones left standing and the rest has been destroyed.  The children from the nearby school have damaged the wall over time and he dreams of rebuilding all of it with stone.  Don Jerick has worked for some time as a gardener at a private residence, but his salary is not enough to cover a one-time purchase of construction materials.  

He is very pleased with the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds to a modest individual like him who has limited resources.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Verbina

texts.en:
Verbina is from the village of Kalangahan, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Verbina is married and has children.

To make a living, Verbina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish like sardines and milk fish. She also provides motorcycle transport services with her husband as the driver. Verbina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Verbina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Verbina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Verbina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like milk fish and mackerel. This will be the second loan taken out by Verbina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like milk fish and mackerel.

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae is from the village of Camaque, Iligan City. She is 28 years old. Sheila Mae is widowed and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Sheila Mae sells electronic loads (prepaid cell phone credits) from several networks like GLOBE and SMART. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Sheila Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Sheila Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional electronic loads. This will be the second loan taken out by Sheila Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic loads for resale.

location.town: Camague, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and married with five adult children. She is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling vegetables like squash, cabbage, spices and tomatoes in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Editha joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This is the first loan that Editha has requested from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

His main source of income comes from buying and selling bananas and firewood in the local community. Felisardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Felisardo joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional bananas and firewood. This is the first loan that Felisardo has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Mrs. Moeun is a 33-year-old farmer and mother. She has two kids, both of whom are attending the public school. Her husband, Tin Sophorn, is 34 and works in the farming business. Mrs. Moeun and her husband always grow different kinds of crops on their own farmland and hire their neighbors’ land to grow more potato crops and rice crops. Besides this, Mrs. Moeun’s husband often goes to buy cows and calves to raise and sell when they are big. Mrs. Moeun will be using her loan to purchase potato seeds, to hire a machine, and to pay for land rental.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, hire a machine, and rent land

loans.name: Josy

texts.en:
Josy is 43 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Josy owns and operates a business making and selling food. Her main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and bibingka in the local community. Josy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Josy joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional ingredients and provide working capital. Josy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients such as sugar, flour, and rice. This is the second loan taken out by Josy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as sugar, flour, and rice

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 52 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Feliciana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, eggs, detergent, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Feliciana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Feliciana joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Feliciana is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and beverages. This will be the second loan taken out by Feliciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, junk food and beverages

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut  is chairman of the Sari Karya  group whose members live in the Village Manistutu. Ni Ketut is a widow with two children. Her husband died of brain cancer. Ni Ketut and all the group's members  are able to pay off all their obligations on time. 

Currently, the group is applying for  loans for the third time. Ni Ketut get the loan of Rp. 1.500.000.- These loans will be used to buy a superior quality pig and the rest to buy feed. Ni Ketut feels there is an increase in her business. After having loan twice from MUK, the profits always increase. This is due to the assistance of MUK in training and marketing information about pigs. She has a dream to open a restaurant business from the  pig farming profits.

loans.use: To buy a superior quality pig and feed.

loans.name: Delyn

texts.en:
Delyn is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past three years, she has run a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Delyn has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF. 

Delyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fish to sell and also to buy an icebox to store her inventory. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an icebox and fish to sell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 55 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has run a food vending business in the Philippines. Julita is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Julita has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: From Ornlong Veng district, Mrs. Toem is a 42-year-old married woman who is able to earn a low income by selling snacks to her neighbors and other passersby around her village. From this business, she can generate a profit of about US $5 a day to manage the financial expenses of her whole family. Her husband also assists her in the same business. They are blessed with two children; one is married and works as a teacher and the other one is single and still enrolled in school. Mrs. Toem will be using her loan to buy some piglets to raise and sell when they are big.

loans.use: to buy some piglets to raise

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past three years. Aida also earns an income from running a general store. 

Aida has been sustaining her fishing business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other fishing equipment. In the future, Aida hopes to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and fishing equipment

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and married with two children. For the past 13 years, she has run a firewood business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fe is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP from NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old while the youngest is 6.

Yolanda is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Yolanda sells her harvest at the market. For the past months, Yolanda earned about 3,000 PHP per month from farming. Yolanda works hard to improve her earnings and sustain her family.

This loan will be used by Yolanda to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn more and be able to improve their house soon.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn.  

Nenita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell for her business. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Estrella works hard to support her family. She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food. 

Estrella is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her business. Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old and married with four children.

Maribeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maribeth has borrowed and paid 13 previous loans from NWTF. 

Maribeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gracelda

texts.en:
Gracelda is 34 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gracelda has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from selling fruit.

Gracelda is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 49-year-old, married woman with 7 children, 4 of whom are in school. Corazon is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, which she has had for 22 years.

Corazon requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 33 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income selling cosmetics. Celeste works hard to provide for her family. 

Celeste is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy inventory for her sari-sari store. She has repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. Celeste aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Lady Grace

texts.en:
Lady Grace is 28 years old and has a common-law husband with two children.  Lady Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Lady Grace runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries for her store.

Lady Grace has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lady Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of groceries for her sari-sari store to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is from the village of Suarez, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Adela is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Adela owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells bananas and coconuts in the local community. Adela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Adela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Adela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

Lilibeth is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lilibeth has a food vending (halo-halo) business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

Lolina has been in this business for 30 years. Lolina earns additional income from piggery and the selling of fermented shrimps.

Lolina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of  fish to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 56 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Dionesia works very hard to provide for them.

Dionesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries for her general store.

Dionesia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, softdrinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Dionesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her general store to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like sugar and other groceries.

Erma has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.

Erma aspires to save to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 31 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a wholesale and retail soft drinks business in the Philippines. Jessica has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could purchase a delivery truck for her soft drinks business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from the village of San Roque, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan, 58, is a domestic farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To make a daily income, she always grows various crops on her own farmland. She is married to Mr. Chhan, 58, who works in the crop-planting business also. They earn about $3 each day to pay for the expenses in their family. For instance utilities expense, food expenses, and education expenses etc. Because this is the rainy season and Mrs. Yan doesn’t have money to plant her crops yet, she decided to ask for a loan in order to pay for plowing costs, fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, and the land she bought earlier. Mrs. Yan is pictured with her husband inside their house.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, and previous land costs.

loans.name: Jibek's Group

texts.en:
Jibek is the treasurer of this group. She is 46 and married to a contractor. Together with her husband, she takes care of a son and a daughter. Both children study at school. The family lives in a rural area. 

In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Jibek and her husband breed cattle, and they also cultivate agricultural products. This activity made it possible for them to pay the tuition for their children’s education.  

With money received from the loan, Jibek wants to purchase seeds for farming, and it is for this purpose she applied for the loan.  In the future she wants to see her younger children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
The group was formed by the village leader of Pemuteran village, Singaraja, North Bali, with 10 members. All members are farmers; most of their time is spent in the garden. They even make a simple shack to live in the garden to keep the corn and bean crops they planted from wild animals.

 As an additional effort, they have formed a group of pig farmers. Wayan is one of its members. She got a loan of Rp. 1,000,000 to be used to buy four piglets that will be sold every 3 months. Because of living in the garden, she feeds the pigs with different types of leaves. 

Every 3 months, buyers will come to the garden to buy a pig. Per pig, she gets a net profit of Rp. 150,000. All profits are used to support the education of her child who is currently in 5th grade of elementary school.

loans.use: to buy four piglets.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga, 35 years old, is a mother of three school-aged children. She is married to a farmer. She has a corn farm in her village and she earned PHP 20,000 at the last cropping. She has operated her business for almost four years. She decided to take a loan from KIVA of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional farm inputs for her corn farm. Her profits will be used to pay for the labor of some farmers who will help her till her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm inputs

Currently, Eric is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies needed to grow his source of income. As a father, Eric wants the best for his children. Therefore, he is really working hard. He dreams of having another business to increase his profit.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Most of the people who live in the Kompong Cham province work in farming. One of them, Mrs. Pen, frequently spends at least ten hours per day working on her farm. Her husband supports her in the farm fields. They have been married many years and have five kids, four still single. The fifth is married and lives dependently. Mrs. Pen would like to apply for a loan of US$800 in order to buy a motorcycle for traveling needs. She says this loan would allow her and her family to go anywhere without hiring a taxi as they do now.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for traveling needs.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is 53 years old, married with four sons. Two of them work while the other two are studying. The eldest one is a computer operator in a private organization while the 2nd one is a computer embroidery expert. 

Zahida herself is a housewife as well as a working woman. She operates a sewing business for her neighboring clients and charges 100-150 PKRs per dress. Due to her quality of sewing, she receives good number of orders every month. The income she earns helps her to pay off the utilities. Besides her work, she also manages her household responsibilities very well. 

Her husband is a vegetable vendor and sells vegetables in the vegetable market. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating this business for many years. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. Through the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress. 

She is hopeful that by purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete the orders in less time and earn better profits.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Tanzila's Group

texts.en:
Tanzila is the treasurer of this group. She is 31 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she raises four sons. The older son helps his parents with the housework, the second is at school and the other sons are preschool age (under seven). Four years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Tanzila bought two sheep and then resold them at the higher price after being fattened. Tanzila’s husband helps her with that activity. The family has just started building a new house, but they have a shortage of financial funds for purchasing construction materials. For this purpose Tanzila has applied for the loan. She hopes to finish the house construction in the near future.

Diosdada  is from the village of Segatic Daku in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 50 years old. Diosdada is separated from her spouse and has six grown children. To make a living, Diosdada owns and operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Diosdada has been engaged in her business for over one year, and she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdada is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Diosdada from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob resides in Siem Reap Province and earns daily revenue by selling ice next to her house. She has a life partner in her husband. He is an ice porter for a general store, and he could get a fixed salary of approximately 2 USD a day for his work. Nob is concerned, because her husband always rents a motor taxi to go to work. In order to reduce this expense, Nob would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to his job location. Nob has two children who are attending local school and who still rely on her income.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to his job location.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime, 52 years of age, is married and blessed with six children. He has been a corn farmer for almost 30 years in the village of Calaocan. Jaime wanted a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional agricultural supplies for his farm. He earned PHP 20,000 for the last cropping. 

His profits will be used to supplement his family's daily needs. He hopes that the generous lenders will continue to support his loan to improve his way of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural supplies for his farm

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is very supportive by nature and always ready to help her family in the time of need.  She operates a grocery store. She utilizes her guest room for her grocery store where she sells daily use items like sugar, rice, spices and cooking oils etc to her community clients. 

Her husband is a vegetable vendor by profession. He also has a horse. He gets up early in the morning, goes to the vegetable market on his horse cart, buys vegetables from the vegetable market and then sells them in his shop. 

Naseem has given birth to three sons. All of them are unable to get an education because Nasreen and her husband are unable to afford their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her grocery store business. Using the loan she will buy more groceries for her store to improve it.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Beishegul's Group

texts.en:
Beishegul is the treasurer or this group. She is 29 and married a private entrepreneur. Together they bring up two daughters, who are preschool age (under seven). Three years ago with the initial investment of 10 000 soms the family purchased equipment for producing ice-cream. In the beginning of this business activity there was just one equipment and now they have three. The monthly profit from selling ice-cream is 20 000 soms. With money received from the loan, Beishegul wants to purchase sugar, milk, and other products, which are needed for ice-cream production. In the future she plans to save money for purchasing an apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar for ice cream production.

loans.name: Nhong

texts.en: Kompong Cham Province is the best territory for planting different kinds of crops. Nhong is a local farmer who has over five years of experience in the agriculture sector. She and her husband work together in the field and make a profit averaging 3.25 USD per day, which they use to support their family. Nhong is going to use her loan to pay for plowing costs and to buy bean seeds in order to start planting. Nhong is blessed with a child who studies in a primary school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to buy bean seeds in order to start planting.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en: Mr.Ulambayar is 26 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives in the extension of his parent's house which he built two years ago. His wife looks after her baby at the moment. Ulambayar runs a taxi business using his family car. The car, which he bought two years ago, has gotten old and needs replacing. The taxi business is the family’s only source of income. Ulambayar is asking for a loan to replace his old family car which he uses in his taxi business. He is going to sell the old car and to buy better second hand car.

loans.use: To replace his old family car which he uses in his taxi business.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mrs. Met is a 40-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. She is earning approximately of $2 a day from her farming business. Her husband is a local farmer also. The humble couple has only one child who is no longer in school and who is working with their businesses. 

This rainy season is coming now; the lakes are full of water and it is a good chance for Met to feed small fish in her pond but she lacks money to make it possible, Therefore, Met is applying for a loan to purchase some small fish for breeding purposes. With the rest of loan funds, she will buy some farming tools for her farming business. 

Note: Mrs. Met is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase some small fish to raise and some farming tools.

loans.name: Mairamhon's Group

texts.en:
Mairamhon is a young leader of this group. She is 20 and married to a farmer. Two years ago the husband suggested Mairamhon to start a retail trade of foodstuffs. The business was started with the initial investment of 10 000 soms. The monthly profit from this activity is 4000 soms. This profit has allowed the young family to repair their house. Mairamhon applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more products for sale. She hopes that the loan will help her to increase the commodity turnover. In the future she wants to expand the business and will try to open her own grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her sale.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo  is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Arnulfo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Arnulfo owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating "tricycle" transport services. Arnulfo has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Arnulfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnulfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Arnulfo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Arnulfo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 43 years old and involved in a clothes-sewing business. She is an expert in her work and earns a good profit every month from her skills. 

Her husband is involved in selling wheat and rice. Razia is the mother of one son and five daughters. Her eldest daughter is also a seamstress and helps Razia in fulfilling her clients' orders order on time. Her only son works with his father selling wheat and rice. Razia is able to provide education only to her youngest daughter who is studying in class 4. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her nephew who is also involved in the wheat & rice selling business. Through the loan, he will buy wheat and rice in bulk quantity which will help him filling the clients' orders on time and earn better profits. 

He has been operating this business for the past 18 years and Razia is hopeful that after this investment, it will start bringing him better profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy wheat & rice to sell.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh, 42 years old, lives with his wife and three children, all secondary school students, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a land plot and a small family house on it. Batmunkh’s all three children attend a local secondary school.

Batkmunkh is a taxi driver, and about six years ago he and his wife started growing vegetables in their garden for the family's consumption. He is now requesting a loan to replace the garden's old and dilapidated greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse for his garden and grow vegetables for his family’s use.

loans.name: Turgambu's Group

texts.en:
Turgambu, the 40-year-old leader of this group, is a married mother of four sons and two daughters. The older children study at school and the others are of preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to meet the needs of the family, she and her husband breed livestock. They started this activity 17 years ago with an initial investment of 4500 soms and now earn a monthly profit of 4000 soms from selling the livestock. With money received from the loan, Turgambu wants to increase their number of livestock, and in the future wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 33 years old, a housewife, and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very responsible person and performs her daily routine work very responsibly. Her husband is involved in the wheat-selling business. He also has a donkey cart and provides loading services with it to his clients.  

Shazia is the mother of four children. Only two of them are able to attend school and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Through the loan, he will buy wheat in bulk which will help him fill larger orders on time and earn more profits.  Her husband has been operating this business for the past seven years and Shazia is very confident that an investment will be beneficial for him. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Baktykan's Group

texts.en:
Baktykan is the leader of this group. Fifty-years-old and married to an electrician, she and her husband have raised three daughters and two sons. The older children are married and live separately with their families, while the other children study at school.

In order to contribute money to the family budget, Baktykan breeds livestock, an enterprise she began 14 years ago with an initial investment of 6000 soms. Reselling livestock animals after fattening them, she earns 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Baktykan wants to purchase two more animals in order to resell them after they are fattened. In the future Baktykan plans to build a house for her older son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Damian

texts.en:
Damian is 38 years old and married. He has 2 children aged 13 and 6. Damian runs a business making and selling "balut". Balut is a boiled, fertilized egg and is very popular in the Philippines. Damian's business has been running for a year and three months. He said that so far it has been going well and that it has helped his family immensely.

Damian is planning to expand his "balut" business. He requested a loan of 50000 PHP from CEVI, a KIVA partner in the Philippines. He plans to use it to purchase more eggs. He also will use part of the loan to buy materials for making a bigger incubator for eggs. Damian hopes to have a progressive business.




“Asenso Loans are a new product offered by CEVI for clients showing strong performance in previous loans, and who need a larger loan in order to continue to develop.  CEVI recognises the importance of helping people out of poverty, as well as providing continuous support and training as these clients progress. CEVI aims to provide financial services, not only our poorest clients, but also to our developing clients who should be rewarded for the way in which they display promising business skills.  Please help us provide support for these clients.”

loans.use: to purchase more eggs and materials for making a "balut" incubator

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Virginia is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling pillows, pillow cases, bed sheets and blankets in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of blankets and pillow cases. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of blankets and pillow cases

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man living with his wife and one child who is still attending school. He has been running a clothing store since 2009. He also sells men’s shoes. His business income is very important because he represents the only income provider for his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. In the future, he is hoping to sell woman shoes & bags also.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a rice farmer who can earn meager income. She uses her own farmland to plant crops following rainy season and dry season. From her farming business, she is able to make an income of approximately $1.50 a day to help support her family. She married but she divorced from her husband a few years ago and at this time, she lives with her three kids. All of them are working in various jobs and they always share some of their gross salary with Mrs. Meas every month. 

Her house is old and the walls are rotten, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to repair it. To deal with this trouble, Mrs. Meas is seeking a Kiva loan to buy planks to rebuild the walls. She plans to use any remainder to purchase piglets for feeding.

loans.use: to buy planks to rebuild walls and purchase piglets to feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four young children. Some of the children are still attending school. She has owned a bakery since 2009 and has more than nine years of experience in the same occupation. She works in collaboration with her husband. He has worked as a pastry distributor for the past 26 years in order to better support the family money-wise. She has a very good repayment history and this will be her third Kiva loan. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to develop her shop and increase her productivity by renovating her tools and purchasing a meat-cutting machine. She is certain that the loan will positively impact her business.

loans.use: to renovate her tools and purchase a meat-cutting machine

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 67 years old. Pilar is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Pilar has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pilar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and biscuits. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Pilar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and biscuits

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Adelyn is married and has three school-aged children. Adelyn has a motorized tricycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Adelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Adelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Adelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Adelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ibonde Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Job is a 53-year-old married man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has four children and six other dependants and he is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after 14 of his household members. In order to be able to provide for the family, he started a retail shop and has been in business for 20 years. The business is still profitable. He started with 200,000 shillings and currently he has working capital of 1,000,000/=. He has the challenges of limited capital and bad debts. His dream is to own a wholesale shop and to educate his children. Job needs the loan to buy sugar and soap for sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap for sell.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
This client lives in Shinuhayr village, Syunik region, together with his parents. Sevak is engaged in agriculture. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income. He would like to increase the income through his business development. 

With the requested loan Sevak plans to purchase three cows. With the loan’s help, he will increase his income and will be able to start a family. This is very important for community development, where population has decreased throughout the years.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy RTW products like pants, blouses, etc. to sell in her stall.

Delia has been in this business for 29 years.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy RTW products like pants, blouses, etc. to sell in her stall

loans.name: Goodwork Group

texts.en:
Agripina, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has had two businesses: selling food and selling charcoal since 2001.  She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Agripina's fourth motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  She used the previous loans to increase both businesses and has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase her food stock. Her dream is to one day finish building her house.

Agripina will share this loan with her loan group "Goodwork", which has a total of 11 members. The members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Agripina is the first one in the left front row with a white scarf.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Emelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns & operates a business buying and selling vegetables like cabbages & eggplants in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables like carrots & potatoes. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like carrots & potatoes

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 62-year-old widower with three children.

He earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. Felix is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Felix has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling chicken.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables and fruit to sell in her stall.

Evelyn has been in this business for 11 years. Evelyn earns more income from clothing sales.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife. He has owned a small shop where he sells woman, men and children's shoes, all branded and stylish. He has one employee helping him with the work. His wife works in a locA. company to help him pay the costly living expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to diversify his merchandise selection further by purchasing the new summer collection of shoes. He wants to expand his business because he is planning to have a baby soon and he needs to gain more profit to be able to handle the child's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase the new summer collection of shoes to sell

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 30 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are in school.

Jena is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jena has been raising vegetables for 13 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business 

In the future, Jena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nora Grace

texts.en:
Nora Grace is 45 years old and still single. She has been raising hogs for over five years now. Her income in the business is of great support to her parents. With her hard work, she is able to generate at least PHP 3,500 when she sells one of her raised hogs.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a stock of feed and to vaccinate her piglets. Nora Grace wishes to maintain her business and continuously improve it to help her parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccinate her piglets

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 52 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nena has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 26 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nena aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Troeng

texts.en:
Troeng is a businesswoman who sells many different wares in the Toul Krang High School, Kompong Chhnang province. She has been running this business since 2006, making a profit of, on average, $3 a day. Most of her items are study materials, souvenir goods, soft drinks, and other essential products. 

To share responsibility, her husband works as a motor taxi driver. They have four single children, two of whom are working. The other two are studying and depend on her care and her income. In order to increase her daily income, Troeng would like to request a loan to purchase additional goods for resale.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieva works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Nieva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Nieva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 52 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a networking business of personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase of additional products to sell.

Regina has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Networking of personal products for seven years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Regina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Carmela is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns & operates a business buying and selling vegetables like cabbages & eggplants in the local community. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional eggplants & carrots. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggplants & carrots

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school. Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop for the past seven years with a previous 15 years of experience in the same occupation. His work consists of painting all types of cars. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client with prompt payments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing a specific paint brand and all related paints and tools. This brand is well known and generates high-quality  products. In that way, he will be able to attract more customers, which will result in earning higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a specific brand-name paint

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is married and has two children aged 11 and 9. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Ginalyn has been in the hog-raising business for three years. She raises pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. Ginalyn also helps her husband in maintaining their rice farm. She also decided to put up a sari-sari store to help augment their income. She sells items like soft drinks, cup noodles and coffee.

This loan will be used by Ginalyn to purchase piglets, feeds and farm inputs. She said she wants to see her business grow. She also hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en: Crescencia works hard to support her family. She is married and owns a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Crescencia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Narcisa works hard to support her family. She has an egg sales business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling firewood. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy greater quantities of eggs to offer for sale to her customers.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of eggs to offer for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
